loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two young children who are still attending school. She has more than 11 years of experience as a tailor. 

In 2005, she opened a curtain store where she started to produce a wide variety of drape designs. She has been running a business in order to help her husband with the household expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store's inventory. She reports that the extra purchases will enable her to serve more customers which will bring her higher profits. She hopes to be able to open a new branch of her shop in the coming year.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
45-year-old Leonila has had a flower business for 17 years now. She is a widow and a mother of four school-aged dependents. Leonila has a flower business as a blessing of nature because of their beautiful colors and pleasant scent. She plants and sells flowers like red roses, chrysanthemums, asters and anthuriums. She plants and sells flowers to earn PHP 9,150 every month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer.

Leonila has been member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Leonila hopes to buy a hectare of land for a flower plantation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen tiene 39 años, vive en con sus dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Maria posee un negocio que es una pulpería, cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes debido a la buena calidad de servicio que ella viene ofreciendo desde hace 8 años, además existe variedad en cuanto a los productos que su tienda posee. Ella desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, pan, jugos, enlatados y sopas.
texts.en: Maria del Carmen is 39 years old. She lives with her two young children who are dependent on her. She has a small grocery store. Her customers speak of her with great esteem. For the past eight years she has offered them good service. She also offers a great variety of products at her store. She would like to invest in her business by buying basic food supplies such as hard candies, bread, juice, canned goods and soups.

loans.use: to buy basic food supplies such as candy, bread, juice, canned goods and soups.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam lives in Kampong Chhnang province.  She is married and has seven children.   Two are single and five are married.  

To earn a living, Mrs. Sam sells rice soup in the busy market.  Her husband, who is a pig breeder, supports the family as well by raising pigs for slaughter.  The family typically earns about $3.5 per day.  Mrs. Sam would like to take out a loan to help her husband purchase two sows to raise and sell for slaughter.  She will use the remainder of the loan to mend her broken house.  

Mrs. Sam’s family currently lives in a thatched house, but if she and her husband can increase their income, they hope to build a wooden house that will be more protected from flooding.

loans.use: to purchase two sows and repair her broken house.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Yadira con su anterior credikiva compró cosméticos, colonias cremas, perfumes, que vendió y generó un nuevo capital de trabajo. Hoy planea aplicar a su segundo credikiva porque,  quiere comprar nuevas mercancías como paraguas, drogas naturales entre otros productos, que traen revistas especializadas a unos muy buenos precios, con lo que proyecta impactar su mercado.  Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias por su ayuda, sigan ayudándonos para que Dios los siga bendiciendo” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Yadira ingrese al siguiente enlace:  http://kiva.org/lend/235197
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan Yadira purchased cosmetics, colognes, creams and perfumes which she sold to generate new working capital. 

Today she plans to apply for her second Kiva loan because she wants to buy new merchandise such as umbrellas and natural medicines, among other products shown in specialized magazines for very good prices, which she expects will make an impact on her market. She sent the following message to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much for your help. Keep helping us, so God will continue to bless you." If you would like to know Yadira's story, follow this link: 

http://kiva.org/lend/235197

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise such as umbrellas and natural medicines among other products.

loans.name: Halimatu

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Halimatu. She is married and has 3 children ages 15, 12 and 9 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is her friend’s daughter from the village. In 2001, Halimatu established her provision shop business. She began her business because she gained experience from her husband and the two decided that she should start her own business in a new location. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Halimatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional provisions such as sugar, sardines, margarine, milk, tea and coffee for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Halimatu plans to build a house of her own. Halimatu was much excited about her previous loan because it helped her to increase her sales and get more customers.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional provision such as sugar, sardines, margarine, milk, tea and coffee for her business.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 20 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Flor tiene como actividad laboral la elaboración de bordados de sábanas y manteles con máquina de coser, también ofrece el servicio de costura, desde hace unos años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares diarias.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 600 para comprar material y así pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Flor con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante y a brindarle otras oportunidades en la vida a su familia.
texts.en:
20-year-old Flor lives with her husband and children in her own home which has water and electricity.  It is located in Monsefú district, in Chiclayo province: an area which is noted for its agriculture, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Flor's business is embroidering sheets and tablecloths with a sewing machine.  She also provides sewing services.  She has been in this business for some years and it is located in her home.  She has her own customer base and also works to order.  There isn't much competition in her field and she uses the income she makes to cover the daily needs of her family.

Flor has requested a loan for 600 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, through their seed capital fund, in order to buy material so that she can continue providing a good service and fulfilling the orders that people have placed with her.  This will enable her to make more profits so that she can improve her family's quality of life.  Through a lot of effort and hard work, Flor has known how to move her business ahead and provide her family with more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy material so that she can continue embroidering

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 29 years old and married. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucel is borrowing 22,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and additional pigs. 

Lucel has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading (cell phone minute sales). 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional pigs

loans.name: Cumbe Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe Centro está formado por 5 socias y un socio quienes laboran arduamente en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar y salir  adelante con sus familias. Nuestras socias viven por la parroquia de Cumbe, este  lugar  es de clima frió y nos regala un hermoso paisaje y vista de la naturaleza, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señorita Andrea, es socia del banco comunal Cumbe Centro, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su padre quien es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios con su propia unidad de taxi. Comparten los gastos del hogar y la casa en que habitan es propiedad de su padre.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal hace 6 años, vende sus productos todos los días y sin un horario fijo. También en su casa cría de gallinas. 

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar su negocio.

Su meta es tener un local para vender sus cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Cumbe Centro Communal Bank is made up of five women and one man who work hard in different activities that allow them to help their families and get ahead with them.  Our members live near the parish of Cumbe.  This place has a cold climate with a pretty landscape and a view of nature.  The people there maintain the culture and traditions of their communities, and they work in commerce, raising animals, and agriculture.

Andrea is one of the members of this group.  She is a member of Cumbe Centro Communal Bank.  She is 28 years old and single, and lives with her father, who is a driver by profession and works for hire with his own taxi.  They share the household expenses, and the house they live in belongs to her father.
 
Andrea has been selling Yanbal cosmetics for six years.  She sells her products every day and without a set schedule.  She also raises chickens at home.

This is the fourth loan she has taken from the communal bank, and she will use her new loan to buy chickens to increase her business.

Her goal is to have a place to sell her cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elsa has a shop where she makes & sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has operated a business of butchery in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. She is 42 years old, married to Samuel, and they have four school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her sixth loan. She paid all of her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep and cattle.

In future, Teresia hopes to expand the business and become the best business woman in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and cattle.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family member. She operates a food stall at the market. Her other source of income is from dry cleaning services. She has been in this business for the last five years.  She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy Irish potatoes, bananas, cassava, tomatoes and onions. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked stall and to buy a plot of land.  Her major business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication and rent

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, bananas, cassava, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Silas Mczato

texts.en:
Silas, 48 years old, is a resolute, prolific and good-natured farmer, who plys his business in the food basket Western Ugandan district of Ibanda. He is a happily married father of 8 good-humored kids, and says he has been pulling out all the stops to ensure the sustainable growth of his business. He mostly grows cash crops such as coffee, bananas, cassava and beans, etc. Hard work, he says, made his business stand in a good and supportive stead.

He hastens to add that season in, season out, it has not been all rosy and good spells. The dry and often long drawn out seasons, by and large, have been seasons of stagnation. His unwavering purposefulness, perseverance and tenaciousness have in many respects been the bedrock of his growing success. Thus far, this business generates him income to the tune of about Ugandan shillings 350,000 per month.

On the side, Silas also banks on income from milk and food sales. He says he intends to use his loan to purchase more land to expand his farm. He plans on growing more coffee and bananas. The lady with him in the picture is his wife.

loans.use: to purchase more land to expand his farm.

loans.name: Chamila

texts.ru: Чамила жительница района Кумсангир. Ей 50 лет. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Она печет у себя дома самбусу для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для приобретения холодильника, чтобы хранить продукты.
texts.en: Chamila is a resident of the Qumsangir district.  She is 50 years old, a widow and has three children.  She bakes samosas at home for sale.  Chamila has been involved in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a refrigerator, so that she can store products.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Helen has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jenalin

texts.en:
Jenalin is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children who are in school.

Jenalin is in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenalin has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 9 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Jenalin would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ane

texts.en:
Ane is sixty years old and is married with five children.

Ane owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Ane needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Ane joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Ane's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran (pictured here), age 28, is a taxi driver. His wife, Srei Lors, age 24, is a hairdresser. The couple lives in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have one young daughter.  

Ran is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to repair his taxi. Because his taxi’s spare part breaks, this upset his business.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nida is 55 years old and has two children are still in school.

Nida has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fishing nets, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Nida has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, bamboo and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Contreras

texts.en:
J. sells clothing from her home and door-to-door. She has been in this line of work for over 20 years. She has had much experience working for clothing factories and stores, but due to the instability of the jobs and the poor pay she decided to start her own business. She is requesting this loan because she wants to buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to manufacture her own clothing. She is a single mother of one child. She and her husband separated after she had a baby with a mental disability that passed away. She is very optimistic about the future of her 4 year old child though.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine so she may begin to make clothing on her own

texts.en:
R. is a 46 year-old mother of four children. She has been selling cooked food such as fish, chicken, and vegetables at her small shop for about 4 years.

She urgently needs to get a loan to buy more raw goods, so that she can produce and earn more. At this time, she usually earns $10/day. Her husband, Mucing, has a sewing business at the house. His income is currently declining, but it may increase in the holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase more raw material to increase her business

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine started his business in 2002. After his primary education, he was unable to continue with secondary education due to lack of school fees. Thus he opted to start out in business.

At first, Augustine was a cereal seller.Though the business was good, there was stiff competition and he decided to open up a little restaurant when he saw there was an unmet demand. He used the money he had saved from his cereal business as capital and his little restaurant is doing well. His customers are mainly market people so during market days he is quite busy.

Augustine's little restaurant is right at the market centre so his customers have easy access to his services. Through his business, he has been able to offer employment opportunities to two youths who work hand-in-hand with him. He has been an inspiration to the youth in his community and has been able to support his parents and his sibling. He has also been able to purchase cattle and develop his farm.

Augustine is not yet married. With the loan of $75 from PEMCI, he wishes to increase on his stock of foodstuffs for his little restaurant.

loans.use: Expand restaurant business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie B. is married and the mother of four children. At forty-two years old, with ten years experience in business, Marie lacks capital to expand her grocery business. Her husband is a daily laborer whose income depends on when there is need for his service. This means that Marie’s income sustains the family’s livelihood. A loan of $175 will enable her to increase her income and expand her business.

loans.use: Marie would like to expand her long-standing grocery business.

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela started her small business selling toys three years ago after recognizing an opportunity to fill a market niche. She has a great location at the central outdoor market in Nikopol with many potential customers passing by. Her little kiosk keeps her very busy and rarely gives her time to slow down. Anjela is a stable, hard working entrepreneur with definite goals. She’d like to continue growing her business and increasing her income. In the future she hopes to be able to do some remodeling on her home and start a small farm. 

Anjela has requested a loan of $500 to purchase new inventory for her business. With a new toy selection, she would be able to continue developing her business and pursuing her goals.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Jero Tirta

texts.id:
Jero Tirta married Putu Suardana who works as a tenant farmer. Jero Tirta has 2 children who are still in Grade school. Income from farm is not enough to pay for daily expenses, and also children schooling expenses. Jero Tirta decides to borrow Rp2,000,000 (about US$220). Jero Tirta used this capital to buy a mother pig for Rp800,000 (about US$90). But that pig is not in a stall, since that stall is being built, paid from the rest of the loan. Although this is new business, Jero Tirta is strongly convinced that it will move and expand so that she could help her husband to pay their living expenses, and pay for childrens education to higher levels, so that it could change their lives for the better.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Jero Tirta menikah dengan Putu Suardana yang bekerja bebagai seorang petani. Jero Tirta memiliki 2 anak yang masih duduk dibangku Sekolah Dasar. Dari hasil ladangnya tidak mencukupi untuk biaya hidup sehari –hari dan juga biaya sekolah anak –anaknya . Jero Tirta memutuskan untuk meminjam modal sebesar Rp 2.000.000,-. Jero Tirta mempergunakan modal ini untuk membeli induk babi sebanyak dengan harga Rp.800.000,-. Tetapi babi ini belum dikandangkan karena sedang dalam proses pembuatan kandang .Yang dananya diambil dari sisa modal yang dipinjam tersebut. Walaupun usaha ini baru dirintisnya, tetapi Jero Tirta tetap memiliki suatu keyakinan yang kuat bahwa usaha ini akan terus berjalan dan berkembang agar bisa membantu suaminya untuk biaya hidup mereka. Dan bisa menyekolahkan anaknya sampai tingkat tinggi yang nantinya akan merubah kehidupan mereka menjadi lebih baik dari sebelumnya.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and build a stall

Membeli induk babi dan pembuatan kandang

loans.name: Maritza Elia

texts.es:
Señora Maritza is 42 years old. She finished high school. She has 3 children who still depend on her financially. They live in the district of El Porvenir, in the town of Trujillo in the state of La Libertad.

She works in the craft industry making sandals which she sells at wholesale price to the various different local markets in her city. She has also asked her sister to sell sandals for her in other cities.

Señora Maritza is a member of the local community bank called 'Creative Little Seeds' which she joined at a request from one of her sisters. She obtained her first loan of $300 Nuevo Sol which she purchased leather and synthetic material to make sandals.

With this loan of $175 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase material such as leather, moulds, soles and much more.

Señora Maritza is not only happy at making sandals, but she would also like to one day open up a bookstore out of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maritza Elia tiene 42 años, estudió la secundaria y tiene 3 niños que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la fabricación artesanal de sandalias, las cuales vende al por mayor en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, además también le da a su hermana para que los distribuya en otras ciudades. La señora Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “Semillitas Creativas” al cual ingresó por invitación de una de sus hermanas y obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300, con lo cual compró cuero y material sintético para la confección de las sandalias. Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 soles, el cual se pagará en cuatro meses, comparará material como cuero, hormas, plantas, entre otros. La señora Maritza no solo se contenta con la fabricación de sandalias, sino que sueña con poner una librería en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase leather, moulds and shoe soles

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, despite being in the last stages of her beautiful pregnancy, she continues to work in order to provide a meal to her family. Selling fruits at the market isn’t too difficult since her mother is along side her to assist and make light of the work. Nonetheless, her biggest fear is when she finally gives birth no one will be there to purchase her fruit supply or take care of her children since her husband is working at his job in the city of Lima. The reason why Martha is requesting a loan is so she can purchase a large variety of fruits for her stand and not have to depend on her dear mother, who will be selling them, to also have to make the purchase. She will also be taking care of her grandchildren while her daughter is with the newborn. We hope for your collaboration in making this fruit stand the best market for Martha’s satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha a pesar de estar en la dulce espera y en los últimos meses de su período de embarazo sigue trabajando para llevar un plato de comida a su hogar. Oferta frutas en el mercado y no le es dificultoso, puesto que en compañía de su madre le es liviano el trabajo.Sin embargo su mayor preocupación es cuando llegue el momento del parto y no tenga quien se haga cargo de la compra de su mercadería de frutas y de sus hijos, debido a que su ayuda idónea es decir su querido esposo radica en la ciudad de Lima debido a que su trabajo se encuentra en esta ciudad.Este es el motivo por la cual Martha solicita una suma de dinero en calidad de préstamo a fin de invertido en la compra de frutas para surtir su puesto de ventas y dejárselo sin ningún pendiente a su querida madre, quien se ocuparía en venderlos, además de velar por el bienestar de sus nietos durante la ausencia de su hija.Esperamos vuestra colaboración a fin de hacer de este puesto de ventas el mejor del mercado para satisfacción de Martha..

loans.use: Purchase more fruits.

loans.name: Kyabagu Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rehema N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rehema is 38 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 10 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Rehema makes approximately UGX 18000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Rehema has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Rehema is joined in her small group by Florence K., Prossy B., Night K., and Jane N.. Florence K. has a business in farming and wants to add to the business. Prossy B. is currently operating a drug shop business and wants a loan to purchase more drugs for sale. Night K. operates a business of charcoal selling and wants to purchase more bags of charcoal. Jane N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal and expand her business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel T. V. runs a restaurant from her home in Picota, San Martin. She serves dishes typical of the region, including Juane (chicken and rice wrapped in palm leaf), meat on a stick, soups, and many others. She started the business 10 years ago and has plenty of loyal customers.

Isabel loves cooking and serving people her delicious meals. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. Her family is very supportive of her work and often help her out. She is proud of her business and her ability to pay for her children’s education.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Mujeres En Accion, Isabel is requesting a loan of s/ 800 to be repaid over 6 months. She will use the money to buy food ingredients for the restaurant and to make some home repairs.

loans.use: 1) Purchase of ingredients for a restaurant, and 2) home repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Safargul Nematovna K. lives in the Khuroson region. She is 38 years old, is a widow and has 5 children. She has a secondary school education. Safargul buys and sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. This business is the only source of income for her large family. All her children are secondary school students. Safargul has been in this business for more than 3 years. Currently she wants to increase the assortment of the produce she sells and has applied for a loan to do just that. She plans to repay her loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Камолова Сафаргул Неъматовна проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 38 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Сафаргул занимается куплей продажей овощей и фруктов на местном рынке. Бизнес я вляется единственныи источником дохода ее большой семьи. Все дети клиентки учатся в средней школе. Сафаргул имеет опыт в бизнесе более 3 лет.В данное время клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки для чего ей нужны деньги. Сафаргул решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of the produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase work material.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 31 years old and has 2 children. She earns income making oil from palm kernels, used to cook all kinds of dishes that use oil. To be able to make enough oil, Gifty has to buy and roast a large quantity of palm kernels. She therefore needs a loan to buy additional bags of palm kernels to be able to stay in the business. With the additional palm kernels, she will be able to prepare more oil and sell it to local soap manufacturers. This, she believes, would allow her to save some money for her children’s education. Gifty is a member of the group called Gospel Light whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of palm kernels for making cooking oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy O. is married with seven children. She is 52-years old and has been in business since 1981. She sells provisions, pure water and drinks. She is from Edo State, Nigeria and is requesting a loan of $875 to start additional business which entails buying garri (ground cassava) to sell. Garri is a staple foodstuff in Nigeria.

loans.use: To start additional business selling garri (ground cassava)

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en: Radhika S. is 52 years old and lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. Kritipur is a developing city of  Kathmandu. She lives with her husband, Ram Krishna S., and their two daughters. Their eldest daughter is studying BBS second year and another daughter is studying in 10+2 class. Radhika's husband works in a private office, but the family's income is not enough to meet their basic needs. Radhika opened her grocery business 8 years ago and seeks a loan of Rs. 30,000 ($425 USD) to buy more rice, biscuits, noodles and other items to meet the demand of her customers. She wants to earn money for her daughters' education and also to raise the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Georgina Aurea

texts.es:
Georgina es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Cocharcas. Georgina es casada, tiene 57 años y 6 hijos, Georgina venD. golosinas, bebidas, pequeños juguetes, actividad que realiza en la puerta D. un colegio privado desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 7 D. la noche, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. su hija.

Georgina junto a su esposo hacen cancha D. arrocillo (bocaditos D. arroz), que embolsan en pequeñas bolsas e incluyen en ellos pequeños juguetes, aretes, ganchos, sus ventas lo realizan en diferentes pueblos D. la región. Georgina viaja a la ciudad D. Lima para comprar los juguetes.

Georgina necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. juguetes pequeños. Los sueños D. Georgina son construir su casa D. material noble, tener un restaurante en su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen D. Cocharcas.” Georgina is married, 57 years old and has 6 children. Georgina sells snacks, beverages, small games; she sells in the entrance of a private school from 6 in the morning until 7 at night, and she does so with the help of her daughter. Georgina, along with her husband, makes “cancha D. arrocillo” (a snack maD. from rice), that they wrap in small bags and incluD. small toys, earrings, and charms. She makes sales in different towns of the region. Georgina travels to Lima to buy the toys. Georgina needs a loan for 1200 soles, which will be invested in buy small toys. Georgina dreams of constructing her home with sturdy materials, having a restaurant in her home and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small toys

loans.name: Zainab Group

texts.en:
Zainab baji is the wife of H. A. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 31 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son works in a factory; her second eldest works driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor transit vehicle;) and her youngest son is a mechanic. Her daughter is a student in 4th standard. Zainab baji’s husband sells warm clothing, and has two years experience in the clothing sales business. Zainab baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more warm clothes for her husband to resell.

This is a group loan, and Zainab baji is joined in her loan request by four other members: Sugran baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell; Nagina baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles and waste paper) to sell in their scrap business; and Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy flour to sell. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy warm clothing to resell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel  es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del  Centro Poblado de Chimbo, Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 3 hijos que están a su cuidado, estudio el tercer grado de primaria, es casada, su esposo se ocupa de otras labores  y le ayuda a trabajar para poder cumplir con el pago correspondiente. Maribel con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro un chancho para engorde y luego poder venderlo.

Actualmente  continua con la crianza de animales menores y  realiza labores agrícolas para su sustento. Ella hace un año es integrante del Banco Comunal.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, aumentara su capital y comprara 01 ganado vacuno a S/. 2,000.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casa fuera de su pueblo y así iniciar con otro negocio.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning, Holy Spirit), located in Centro Poblado de Chimbo, in the District and Province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 35 years old and she is mother of 3 children who are still under her care. She has a grade 3 education, she is married, and her husband works as a laborer and works to help her make her payments. Maribel, with the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) of S/.300 nuevos soles, purhcased a pig to fatten and later sell.

Currently she still raises small livestock and works in agriculture to make a living. She has been a member of the Community Bank for one year.

With this loan of S/.1500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 5 months, she will supplement her capital and purchase 1 head of cattle at S/.2000.

Her greatest dream is to be able to purchase a huose outside of her town and start another business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Mrs. Boeurn Muong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of nine people, is located in Krang Somor village in Kampong Chhnang province. The members will each use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Boeurn M. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is 52 years old and the mother of two children who help their parents in their business activities.  Mrs. Boeurn M. is a farmer who owns 1 hectare where she grows rice. Her husband is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. He is also a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it.  So Mrs. Boeurn M. decided to ask for a loan to buy three more piglets for her husband's business.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy three more piglets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Olufunke

texts.en: Olufunke sells provisions like toothpaste, toothbrushes, bathing soap, cream, etc. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Olufunke is 34 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Olufunke is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell at her market.

loans.name: Ngoan

texts.vi:
Chị Nguy ễn Th ị Ngoan   năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư cho công việc dệt chiếu nhưng sau đó chị đã mạnh dạn vay thêm vốn để mở cửa hàng kinh doanh tạp hóa. Hiện nay chị là chủ một cửa hàng tạp hóa nhỏ tại địa phương. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị đang ngày càng có điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn mua thêm hàng hóa và mở rộng quy mô kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Ngoan is 32 yrs old. She joined TYM fund since 2004. At the beginning, she borrowed money to invest in the business of weaving sedge mats, but later she borrowed additional money and invested in a grocery store. Currently she is the owner of a small grocery store in the region. With income of 175 USD per month, her family has the ability to improve their standard of living and invest in the children's education. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to purchase additional merchandise and expand the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sergio Enrique

texts.es: Sergio Enrique O. es un señor emprendedor y quiere seguir la tradicion de la familia. Sus papas siempre se dedicaron al negocio por muchos años ahoran ven que Sergio ya tiene la necesidad de formar una familia y darles un patrimonio como el que el tuvo. La mamá de sergio establecio el negocio hace 22 años en una colonia de la ciudad llamdo “Abarrotes Lucia”, el cual se lo esta transapasando a Sergio y con el tiene 2 años el quiere surtir bien el negocio para tener mas variedad, satesfacer las necesidades del cliente y obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Sergio Enrique O. is an entrepreneur who wants to keep his family tradition alive. His parents have been in retail for many years, and they now realize that Sergio needs to form his own family and leave them an inheritance like the one that he had. Sergio’s mother set up a general store called “Abarrotes Lucia” 22 years ago in the neighborhood. She then handed the business over to Sergio, who has been running it for 2 years. He wants to stock his shop well so that he can offer a variety of products, meet customer demand, and earn greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Kadi

texts.en:
Kadi P. is currently in the business of selling beer and soda and is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer and soda. Kadi is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Kiva partner BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. The microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non government organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells provisions and food items. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more goods to sell. She hopes for the loan in the amount of ~US$ 350 to purchase these goods. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food items and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells tubers of yams and loaves of bread. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. Grace is married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yams to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda C. is supporting her husband financially through her small variety store. In addition, she peddles food which she has manually processed. Though these businesses are small, Hilda is confident that her efforts help a lot in meeting their daily expenses. She is 34 years of age and the mother of three children. They presently live in Purok 1-B Del Carmen Iligan City. She wants to make more money from these businesses, therefore she is requesting additional capital of 5,000 PHP for business expansion.

loans.use: To puchase stock for a variety store and ingredients for a food processing business

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es:
El señor Ysmael y su esposa la señora Guadalupe son originarios de Tabasco, pero tienen en esta ciudad mas de 8 años, se vinieron a esta frontera buscando salir adelante trabajando. 
Ahora don Ysmael a pesar de ser un padre de familia joven de dos niños el y su esposa son personas muy trabajadoras. El esta trabajando en una empresa muy bien establecida, día a día luchando por salir adelante, y por tal motivo el esta solicitando este crédito para la ampliación de un cuarto y asi obtener mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Ysmael and his wife Guadalupe are from Tabasco, but they have been living [in Piedras Negras] for more than 8 years. They came to this border area looking for better work opportunities. Ysmael and his wife are very hard workers even though they are the parents of two small children. He is working for a well-established company, fighting every day to get ahead. They are asking for this loan to add on a room so their family will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room addition

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 1 Itungu Victoria Group

texts.en: Victoria I. is a 33-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She also cares for three dependants. Victoria has been in business for ten years buying and selling passion fruits, vegetables and beans. She will use the loan to purchase more passion fruits, vegetables, beans and so on, to expand and increase her business so that she can make more profit. Victoria is an active, hardworking lady whose dream is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase passion fruits, vegetables and beans

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos.
Juana tiene estudios D. secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Jr. Cuzco s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 03 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 200.00 Nuevos soles, para aumentar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. comidas, nos indico que comprará papa, chuño y trucha.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y si es posible agrandar su negocio.

A ella le gustan las reuniones las charlas y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the Communal Bank “Medalla Milagrosa” [“Miraculous Medal”], which is located in the Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Juana did not finish secondary school (up to her 3rd year). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 3 years; her first loan was of 300 PEN, which she invested in her business in the sale of food. At present she requires a loan of 200 PEN to invest in her food business; she indicated that she will buy potatoes, chuño (potato flour), and trout. Her hope is to continue working, and if it’s possible she would like to expand her business. She enjoys the meetings, discussions, and get togethers held between the Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, chuño (potato flour), and trout.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is engaged in a variety of interesting business ventures.  She's maD. good use of her loans over the past 10 years while working with Kiva's partner, Manuela Ramos.

Silvia has a large garage area on her property where she stores motorcycle taxis overnight for a fee.  Silvia has been fixing this area by improving the pavement and installing better walls. She also has Balto, an affectionate hairless dog (native to Peru), to help guard the taxis at night.

Silvia also owns two fishing boats.  She keeps one boat on the Ucayali River (a wiD., brown river that eventually joins the Amazon). Silvia has used recent loans to purchase necessary boat supplies, including a motor, fishing net, etc. The boat is used up to five days at a time. When it returns, Silva and the crew share the earnings from fish sales. Silvia earns between 800 to 2000 soles (about $265-$665) each time the boat returns, depending on the catch. Silvia also keeps another smaller fishing boat on the lake in the town of Yarinacocha, where she lives. Silvia's fishing enterprise is going well.  Summer is the best season for catching fish.

Silvia requests a 3000 soles loan.  Half will be used to purchase another net maD. of a heavier material; better for fishing in the winter season.  The rest will be used to improve her garage.

Silvia is married and has two adult daughters and three grandsons. One daughter and two grandsons live with her.

Silvia is the treasurer of her communal bank, "Teresa Ramos."  She has worked very well with Manuela Ramos, advancing "slowly but surely," in her words.  Several years ago she and another woman were chosen by Manuela Ramos to attend a workshop in Lima.  Over 250 Manuela Ramos borrowers from around the country attended this several-day-long conference to discuss their businesses and learn more about Manuela's future projects.

loans.use: Improve her garage and buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Mathieu Wolawolé

texts.fr: Ce monsieur vend depuis 2002 à Tokoin-Ramco à Lomé des pneus d’occasion pour voitures. Son atelier de réparaton est très connue des conducteurs de taxi qui trouvent chez lui tous ceux dont ils ont besoin. Ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge et de régler les besoins de son enfant. Pour commander de nouveaux pneus d’occasion venant du Nigéria, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Il est célibataire.
texts.en:
This gentleman has been selling used automobile tires since 2002 in Tokoin-Ramco in Lomé.  His repair shop is well-known by taxi drivers who find everything they need from him.  This business enables him to support himself and to meet the needs of his child.  To order more second-hand tires from Nigeria, he's requesting a WAGES loan.  He is unmarried.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi S., a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Tulaele, is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Naomi operates a food stall from which she sells fried foods to the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 650 WST a month.

Naomi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from SPBD that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 2500 WST which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Naomi's third loan from SPBD, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sadiya

texts.en:
T. Sadiya is a hard working woman and since 2001 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. Sadiya is the mother of 5 children that she would like to offer an education. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood working hard labor. To realize this dream, Sadiya now requests a loan of $800 USD. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement A. is single and he has received senior high educational background.  Clement sells locally made pans for moulding cement, metal stand for oranges and coal pot at Elmina near Ankanful which he has been doing since 2004.   Clement uses his income in the payment of utility bills and apartment.  Clement will use the loan to buy more metal plate for his coal pot, cement mould and orange stand. With the new profits from his expanded business, Clement plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: Clement will use the loan to buy more metal plate for his coal pot, cement mould and orange stand.

loans.name: María Carmelina

texts.es: María Carmelina D. D. R. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. María lleva años dedicándose a la venta D. pan, razón por la cual es muy conocida por muchos, ella llega con su canasto a muchas colonias, pero ahora sus clientes no solo quieren francés, también le piden pan dulce y galletas, motivo por el cual María solicita D. un crédito para poder invertir en otro tipo D. pan para ofrecer a sus clientes y a su vez le ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María Carmelina D. D. R. is 49 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband and three children. For years María has worked selling bread and has become well known for it. She brings her basket to sell in many neighborhoods. but now her clients ask her for sweet bread and cookies as well as french bread. This is why María is applying for the loan so that she can invest in other types of bread to offer her clients and thus increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Kang H. is 54 years old and lives in Takeo province with his wife. He is a village chief who makes a living of US$1 per day. His wife has been a professional tailor since 2000. On average, she is able to make about US$1.30 per day. This couple has three children, one of whom is in school and two are workers. Kang H. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin A. is 53 years old and has been married for 31 years to Pelagia Ortega, who is 54 years old. They have 6 children of which three are already married and living independently. The other three live still live at home. Agustin has been a trader for 4 years. He began his business with money he earned from selling produce that he grows, such as sugarcane, cassava, watermelon and beans. 

Agustin will use this loan for the purchase of products like oil, noodles, flour, shirt, soaps, insecticides, coal, and other beverages in general. This would allow him to increase his stock of merchandise and thus offer his customers greater variety.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Mori

texts.en:
Mori M. is currently in the business of selling used clothes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase new materials to sell.  Mori is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a boutique in the city centre.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fawe, Waterloo Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at the 'Forum for African Woman Educationalist' (FAWE). This is a Junior Secondary School with classes I – III. It was built in September, 2005, by FAWE, a local NGO, for the promotion of education for the less privileged girl child.

This is the second loan these teachers are accessing from SMT/Kiva, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo. With the help of the previous loan, these staff members were able to complement their monthly salaries – they were able to pay their children’s school fees, invest in their businesses, or solve their immediate financial challenges.

Having repaid their last loan, they are again requesting a loan of SLL 7,300,000 total. With this new loan, some of these borrowers can again pay school fees for their children, invest in their businesses, buy pieces of furniture, or buy house-building material.

Denka M. is the leader of this group of teachers. Denka was born in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone thirty-nine years ago. He is married and has two children who are attending school. This loan will complement Denka’s salary; he can use it to take greater care of his family and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mr. Chin C., 27, and his wife, Mrs. Poe Dany, 24, live with their parents along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple just has a young son. Chin was not available for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

Chin is a construction worker and is a motor taxi driver as well. His wife used to be a garment factory worker but she now stays at home to take care of their son.

Chin is asking for his second loan of US$500 to help provide capital to enable his sister to purchase vegetables to sell and a cart to carry them.

loans.use: To provide capital for his sister to purchase vegetables and a cart

loans.name: José Gerardo

texts.es:
José Gerardo S. V., tiene la edad de 36 años, es soltero, y tiene un hijo, que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 12 años de edad. Además, el vive en la casa de un hermano, con la esposa y dos hijos del hermano, pero el vela por su madre la cual tiene el mal de Parkinson. El crédito lo quiere para asistir 3 hectáreas de café que posee, para así poder comprar el abono, fumigarlo y poder realizarle las chapias de manera adecuada.El darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo va a permitir un buen desarrollo y así tener una mayor producción y por ende mayores ingresos económicos.Don Gerardo siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lo heredó de su padre.
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo el estudio para llegar a verlo todo un profesional, además desea seguir ayudando a su madre, ofrecerle a ambos una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
José Gerardo S. V., 36, is single and has a 12-year-old son, who is his main priority in life. He lives in his brother’s house, with his sister-in-law and their two children, but he cares for his mother, who has Parkinson’s. He will use the funding for his 3 hectares of cultivated coffee fields. He will buy fertilizers, nourish the plants and be able to prune them properly. By giving the proper care to his plants they will develop optimally and produce greater crop yields, thus: higher income. Gerardo has always been a farmer; he inherited it from his father. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is happy with the loan terms offered. He hopes in the future to be able to provide his son with advanced schooling so that he will become a professional. He also wants to continue to assist his mother, offering them both a better quality of life and improved economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Berthe

texts.fr: Née en 1965 dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, A. Berthe vit depuis près de 40 ans dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Berthe est mariée à TOKPANOU Jacques, un employé au Port de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Berthe a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Berthe vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille. C'est une jardinière qui vend ses légumes au marché de Ganhi à Cotonou, et les livre également aux revendeuses. Berthe achète les graines qu'elle sème à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Berthe exerce cette activité depuis 20 ans environs, et a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé et qui lui a permis de renforcer un peu son activité. Berthe ambitionne agrandir son jardin et vendre en gros ses légumes, ce qui lui permettra d'accroître son revenu et de faire face à ses besoins. C'est pourquoi Berthe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in the town of Abomey Calavi, Ms. A. Berthe has lived there for forty years. She is married to Mr. TOKPANOU Jacques, an employee at the Port of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Berthe has six children, of whom some are in school. All of the children live together with their parents. Berthe helps out her husband where it concerns the different family expenses. She is a gardener who sells her vegetables at the Ganhi market in Cotonou and who also delivers them to retailers. Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she buys seeds for planting. She has been in this business for about twenty years and has already obtained an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid. It enabled her to build up her business a little. Berthe has the ambition of expanding her garden and selling her vegetables in bulk. This will enable her to increase her revenues and to address her needs. She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé for these reasons.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 8 sacks of manure and 5 sacks of seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make and sell cakes and fritters

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Maria de la Cruz M. N. es casada tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, tiene un negocio de venta de tortilla de puro maíz en su casa. Tiene mas de 10años de tener su negocio con este negocio ella ha salido adelante con sus hijos y con la ayuda de su esposo.
Tiene seis años de trabajar con ceprodel de los cuales ella se siente bien agradecida por que a mejorado su casa y su negocio lo ha acondicionado mejor.
La señora M. N. es trabajadora se esfuerza para darles el sustento a sus hijos y su estudios trabaja desde las cinco de la mañana pone a nizquezar el maíz para luego mandarlo a moler para palmear toda el día una de sus hijas le ayuda a vender sale a vender con una pana tortilla a los lugares aledaños de su casa y al mercado central vienen a vender
texts.en:
Sra. Maria de la Cruz M. N. is married, has two children who are of school age, and has the support of her husband. She manages a business selling pure corn tortillas from her house. Maria has more than ten years of experience in this business, which has helped her succeed for her children with the help of her husband.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for six years. Maria feels grateful because her home has improved and her business is better equipped. She is a hard worker who strives to support her children with their studies. Maria starts work at 5am to go acquire the corn that she sends to have milled so that she can spend all day forming tortillas. One of her daughters helps with making sales by traveling with a bundle of tortillas to sell in the surrounding areas near her house and at the central market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & firewood

loans.name: Rehana Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Rehana Kosar lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. She has a two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past 20 years. She has one son, who is just eight months old. She takes care of him and also makes flower ornaments, such as rings, bracelets, etc. for brides and grooms to wear at their weddings, on order. Her work generates 10,000 PKR every month. 
Rehana Kosar's husband, S., has a milk-selling business. He purchases milk from milk shops and resells it in the community. He is unable to generate much income from this business because he has to pay the milk-sellers first. Therefore, Rehana has decided to apply for a loan to buy a dairy cow so that her husband can start to get milk from it and earn a better profit.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming for the last twelve years in Naivasha. He is 42 years old, is married to Alice Wanja, and they have three school-going children.

Paul was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm.

In the future, Paul plans to buy another piece of land for farming, hence increasing his output.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna P. is a member of a Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) cluster organization. She attends monthly meetings and has obtained loan services from CEVI.

Edna’s business is rice production. She tills only a small farm but her income goes directly towards the needs of her family and children. Because she wanted to augment her income, she also ventured into a piggery business. Now, she is earning with the pigs, too.

Edna would like to request a loan of Php 6,000. She will utilize her loan to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Paulina es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Paulina vende cereales y verduras en diferentes mercados de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria, en algunas oportunidades también vende leña.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Paulina sueña con construir una buena casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paulina, 38, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She is married and has 6 children. She sells cereals and vegetables in an itinerant manner in various city markets every day; sometimes she sells firewood. Paulina needs a 750 sol loan to buy cereals. Paulina dreams with building a good house and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Talex

texts.en: Talex Mamamdov, a 32-year-old internally displaced person from the region of Fuzuli, is single and lives in the Absheron region.  For 10 years he has been teaching children how to play the accordion, and he also composes melodies for the instrument., enjoying both aspects of his work.  With a current total of 15 students, Talex is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy another accordion so that children who do not have their own can also play.

loans.use: To buy another accordion

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng P., 31, is married and resides with her husband and young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. P. weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband sells traditional cakes, earning an income of about USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase raw silk to produce more silk products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more raw silk to produce silk products to resell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos en la casa de sus padres en la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Martha  trabaja como empleada en un domicilio particular, con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para el pago de una cuota inicial de la compra de un lote de terreno y hacer construir su vivienda propia.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is single and lives with her two children in her parents’ home, located in the northern zone of the city of La Paz. She works as a domestic employee in a private home, and uses the income she earns to maintain her household. She will use the money from this loan as a down payment toward a lot and to build a home of her own. This is her first loan request and our analysis of her socioeconomic status qualifies her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land and build a home

loans.name: Zoraya Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zoraya de 38 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene un restaurante desde que se separo de su esposo para poder mantener a sus dos hijos. 

Ella comenzo con una mesa y una silla a vender comida a sus conocidos y vecinos, pero como la demanda de comida ella mucha decidio comprar mas mesas y ubicar su negocio ya en un local, por esa buena decision  ahora ella trabaja con una de sus hijas desde la mañana hasta la cena haiendo platos como "Yapingachos", "guatita" etc. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio ella necesita comprar mas viveres como arroz, carnes y bebidas, en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener sucursales de restaurantes.
texts.en:
Zoraya, 38-years-old, lives in Primavera de Duran (an outlying area with a disappearing ecosystem in the outskirts of Guayaquil). Ever since she separated from her husband she's had a restaurant in order to support her two children. She began with one table and one chair, selling food to her acquaintances and neighbors, but as the demand for her food increased she decided to buy more tables and locate her business in a shop. As a result of that good decision she now works with one of her daughters from morning to evening making dishes such as "Yapingachos," (stuffed potato patties) "guatita," (beef stew) etc. In order to be able to continue her business she needs to buy more supplies such as rice, meat, and drinks. In the future she wants to expand her business and have multiple restaurant locations.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, meat, and drinks

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena B. is from the village of Manaring. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending her canteen in the community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $150 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Ma. Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Elena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ati

texts.en:
Ati F. is 52 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has 5 years of experience in this business.  

In 2005, Ati joined SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Ati's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  She has had 4 previous loans with this organization, and is asking for a new loan of WST 2,000 to purchase a new sewing machine.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida M. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Zenaida has been involved in her business for over 10 years. She also helps her husband at their farm by keeping the farm free of weeds and pests.

Zenaida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her store and fertilizers for the farm.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her store and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy V. is a 62-year-old married woman with three children: one is a teacher, one is a security guard in a private company, and another is a seamstress in a garment factory.

Mrs. Dy V. is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members located in Preaek Samraong village, Kandal province. She stays at home while her husband, Mr. Kheng Chok, is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn some income to support the family. But now her husband’s motorcycle is old so she wants to replace it. Thus, she requests a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike to support her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Agali Awamu Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Christine is happily married and has 4 children. Self-interest was a driving force in establishing this modest hotel business in Lubugumu-Mukono. It has been in existence for 2 years now. She mostly sells local foods and all kinds of beverages. With weekly profits of 40,000 shillings, 43 year-old N. Christine, who belongs to Agali Awamu Development group, has supported herself and her family in various ways. To begin this business she had to bank on profits from a stone and sand quarry business, which she says was her first business. She still runs the quarry business, though her major priority is now overseeing the hotel. With this loan she wants to purchase more foods and beverages for her business.

loans.use: The purchase of more foods and beverages for her hotel.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Don Samuel de 39 años de edad, reside en Usulután con su familia su esposa e hijas, tienen 15 años de vivir en ese lugar, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz desde hace 10 años también le gusta la ganadería.
El quiere comprar un motor de bombeo y abono para la milpa, y está solicitando un préstamo para realizar esta inversión, ya que al contar con el motor podrá regar la milpa durante el verano dándole un mejor cuido para que se desarrolle y crezca sanamente.
Quiere cancelar este préstamo y progresar con sus cultivos para llevar a su familia la alimentación y los ingresos necesarios para subsistir.
texts.en:
Samuel is 39 years old and he lives in Usulutan with his family, his wife and daughters. He has lived in the same place for 15 years. He has had his corn plantation for 10 years and he also enjoys cattle farming. 

He wants to purchase a water pump and fertilizer for his farmland. He requests a loan to carry out this investment. With the water pump he will be able to water his plantation in the summer, providing better care for its healthy development. 

He endeavors to pay off his loan and to advance with his plantations. He will be able to feed his family and cover their living expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel tiene su negocio que es la venta de CD y DVD hace más de 4 años que tiene esta actividad. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, el mayor desafío que atraviesa es que hay mucha competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a este negocio, por lo que él se esmera en ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes para que siempre sigan llegando a buscar sus productos. Este crédito es para la compra de CD y DVD que sus clientes le solicitan ya que tiene bastantes pedidos.
texts.en:
