El trabajo de su marido es eventual, ya que es albañil por su cuenta, por lo que los ingresos no son seguros y no alcanzan a cubrir todas la necesidades básicas del hogar. Antonio, esposo de Adriana, hace un año y medio se enfermó y necesitaba urgentemente consultas y exámenes médicos, por lo que ella comenzó a vender cosméticos, con el objetivo de conseguir los medios necesarios para atenderlo.

No ha sido fácil luchar en todo este tiempo, pero la constancia y el amor a su familia lo han hecho posible. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito para poder continuar con su proyecto, por la cantidad de $250 dólares, mismos que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Adriana y su familia necesitan de ti, de tu apoyo y generosidad, no lo dudes más y decídete, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Born in 1975, Celine is in a polygamous marriage and mother of three children. After the death of her two children and her mother within a space of two months, and the costly procedure at the birth of her last child, Celine needed a strong support system to deal with her loss and economic issues.

She saw GHAPE as the only shoulder to lean on. Her group and center has continued to provide her with support as they share their experience. With acquired minimum marketing and management skills, she utilized and repaid her first two loans. Her goal for her next loan is to regain self-esteem through interactions and more business techniques.

With a loan of $300, she plans to increase her stock by buying raw foodstuff and fruits in bulk. The growing population of Mbemgwi, her skills and commitment in improving her situation, and the location of her business are factors indicating success. She plans to pay loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Trading and farming.

loans.name: Aide

texts.en:
Aide is 42 years old and has 4 children. She has had a grocery store for three years, where she sells food to her neighbors. She represents the Sonora 6 Group, which is a group of 4 women (including Aide) who run their own businesses to help support their families, since their husbands do not earn enough due to lack of schooling. The other women of the group are: Gloria Hernandez Lopez (grocery store), Rosalinda Garcia Ico (dairy products), Maria del C. Solis Hernandez (door to door cake sales). The loan will be divided proportionally among the group, with each one investing in her business.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

AIDE TIENE 42 AÑOS , 4 HIJOS , DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS QUE TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES DONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA LAS PERSONAS DE SU VECINDAD, ELLA REPRESENTA AL GRUPO SONORA 6 , EL CUAL ESTA INTEGRADO POR CUATRO MUJERES ( INCLUYENDOLA ) LAS CUA.LES SE HAN ESFORZADOS TENIENDO SUS PROPIOS NEGOCIOS PARA SUSTENTAR A SU FAMILIA YA QUE SUS ESPOSOS PERCIBEN UN SALARIO MUY BAJO DEBIDO A LA FALTA DE EDUCACION QUE POSEEN . LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : GLORIA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) ROSALINDA GARCIA ICO ( VENDE PRODUCTOS LACTEOS ) MARIA DEL C. SOLIS HERNANDEZ ( VENDE PASTELES DE CASA EN CASA ) EL PRESTAMO LO DIVIDIRAN EN PARTES PROPORCIONALES ENTRE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, INVIRTIENDOLO EN CADA UNO DE SUS NEGOCIOS.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Muattar

texts.ru:
Muattar is a teacher by profession and works in a high school. She is 44 years old and is married, but does not have children. Her husband is in Russia earning money. A teacher’s salary is not enough to live on, so she sells goods at the markets. Her sister Nasiba helps her. Muattar specialized in children’s clothing and footwear. The profits from her business help her to cover part of the family expenditures.

Her past loan from MicroInvest helped Muattar to expand her small business. She plans on using the new loan to purchase school uniforms. In the photo is her sister Nasiba. Muattar was teaching school on the day that the photo was taken.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Муаттар по образованию преподаватель и работает в средней школе. Ей 44 года , она замужем, но у нее нету детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Заработка преподавателя недостаточно и она выходит на базары торговать. Ей помогает ее сестра Насиба. Специализируется Муаттар на детских одежде и обуви. Прибыль от бизнеса позволяет покрывать часть семейных расходов. Полученный займ Микроинвест помог расширить ее маленький бизнес. В наступающий сезон продаж школьной формы она хочет получить новый займ. На фотографии ее сестра Насиба, сама Муаттар в этот день преподавала в школе.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 38 years old and she is married to Isabelino Chávez who is 47 years old. He works for a road construction company. Thanks to his revenue, he is able to help his wife with the house’s expenses and their children’s school tuition. They have two children, one of them is 10 years old, who is in school and other is 15 years old who helps her in the business and at night he is in school. Francisca has had this business for more than 5 years. Thanks to her effort, a good administration and the help of her husband; she has been able to expand the business since she has a good clientele due to the good her location. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise as sugar, rice, noodles, pastries, sausages, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca tiene 38 años, está casada con el Sr. Isabelino Chávez de 47 años quien trabaja en una empresa constructora de rutas, gracias a su ingreso ayuda a su esposa para los gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus hijos. Tienen dos hijos, uno de 10 años quien está estudiando en la escuela y otro de 15 años quien le ayuda en el negocio y a la noche estudia en el colegio. Francisca hace más de 5 años tiene su negocio, quien gracias a su esfuerzo, a la buena administración y a la ayuda de su marido pudieron agrandar el negocio ya que cuenta con una clientela formada por la buena ubicación que tiene su local. Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, bebidas, panificados, embutidos, etc.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, noodles, pastries, sausages, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ni Made Sri Wahyuni

texts.id:
Besides being a housewife whose daily work are to care for children and other household work, Ni Made Sri Wahyuni also has a business that supports their family income. That business is cacao sales. She has been in this business for almost 2 years, and has given satisfactory income of Rp25,000 (about US$3)/day from the Rp500,000 (about US$60) capital she owned. Buying harvest from cocoa farmers, Made Sri started her activities daily from 10:00 AM to 4:00PM buying cocoa fruits from farmers and selling it to wholesalers, and the profit came from difference between buying & selling price. Lack of capital, has been a problem in the past, and she could not compete with other salespersons. However, after receiving capital help from Dinari, her business grows, and more farmers too sold their harvest to Made Sri. Today Made Sri could buy 200kg with a profit of Rp100,000 (about $11)/day. With that Made Sri could support her 2 children, Luh Sinta who already goes to Grade school, and Made Sonia, who is still a toddler.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Di samping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang dalam keseharianya mengurus anak dan pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya , Ni Made Sri Wahyuni juga memiliki usaha yang sangat mendukung pendapatan keluarganya . Usaha itu adalah Usaha sebagai Pedagang Kakau . Usaha yang telah di jalankannya hampir dua tahun ini mempunyai hasil yang sangat lumayan yaitu sebesar Rp 25.000/hari dari Rp 500.000 modal yang dimiliki . Dengan membeli hasil panen dari petani yang memiliki tanaman kakau , Made Sri memulai kegiatannya setiap hari dari pukul 10.00 pagi sampai 04.00 sore membeli buah kakau dari petani dan menjual kembali kepada pengepul ( pedagang besar ) dengan keuntungan yang di peroleh dari selisih harga beli dan penjualan . Kekurangan modal , dulu sering menjadi hambatan Made Sri dalam menjalankan usaha ini sehingga kalah bersaing dengan pedagang lain . Namun setelah mendapat bantuan modal dari Dinari , usahanya semakin berkembang dan petani pun makin banyak menjual hasil panennya kepada Made Sri. Rata-rata saat ini Made Sri bisa membeli barang dagangan 200 Kg dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp 100,000,- / hari . Dengan hasil ini Made Sri dapat membiayai dua orang anakNya yaitu Luh Sinta yang telah duduk di bangku SD dan Made Sonia yang masih balita.

loans.use:
To add capital so that could buy more cocoa beans

Sebagai tambahan modal usaha agar dapat membeli biji kakao dalam jumlah yang lebih banyak

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia is a partner of the Communal Bank “Women for the development of Pariahuaca”, she dedicates herself to the sale of grains, wheat, different varieties of corn, and hulled wheat and corn for wholesale (in sacks), her business is located at the market in the Province of Huaraz, in the city of Ancash, she sells on Mondays and Thursdays. With this loan of 1,800 soles, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will buy 5 sacks of corn to hull and 5 sacks of wheat to hull as well. She is 45 years old, she is married and has 4 children, 2 of which are independents. She lives with her husband and 2 grandchildren whom she takes care of. Her husband is a driver with his own car, thanks to it he can help her move her products to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Ella es la señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Desarrollo de Pariahuanca”, se dedica a la venta de granos, trigo, maíz de diferentes variedades y pelado de trigo y de maíz al por mayor (por sacos), su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la feria de la provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash, vende los días lunes y jueves. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 5 sacos de maíz cuzqueño para hacer pelado y 5 sacos de trigo para también hacer pelado de trigo. Ella tiene 45 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son independientes. Vive con su esposo y dos nietos que tiene en su poder. Su esposo es chofer y cuenta con un carro (auto) propio, gracias a ello le puede apoyar con el traslado de sus productos hacia la feria.

loans.use: The purchase of grain for wholesale

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara Beatriz is a 58-year-old mother of six children, of which three are independent, and three are still dependent on her since they are studying technical careers. She wants them to complete their studies successfully so they will be able to work.

Sara studied this fine art of knitting and embroidery long ago, and now that she has made it her business, it has brought in significant income, despite not having a suitable place to do her work. Since Mrs. Sara uses a space within her home to do this work, and the space is limited, it is important for her to improve her space. Mrs. Sara's goal is to rent a crafts workshop, and organize and develop it completely so she can share her skills with other moms in her community. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan in order to be able to rent a space and purchase materials.

With your support, Mrs Sara will realize her dream in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Sara Beatriz tiene 58 años de edad es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales tres de ellos ya son independientes, quedando sólo tres a su cargo y bajo su protección ya que están estudiando carreras técnicas, ella sólo quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios satisfactoriamente para que puedan trabajar. Sara estudió este bello arte de manualidades (tejidos y bordados) hace mucho tiempo, se desenvuelve en el ya que se ha convertido en el sustento económico significativo de su hogar; a pesar de no tener un local apropiado la señora Sara ocupa un lugar en su vivienda para trabajar, debido a este hecho le urge mejorar su ambiente.Para la señora Sara su propósito es poner un taller de manualidades a fin de e implementarlo completamente para desarrollar y compartir sus habilidades con otras madres de su comunidad, para este fin requiere de un préstamo para alquilar un local y la compra de sus materiales. Con tu apoyo la señora Sara podrá concretar su propósito en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: To start her business. (IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO)

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Mrs. Chao N., 38, works collecting rubber, making on average $1.60 a day. Her husband Mr. Leang Chor, 41, runs a business as a motor-taxi driver and every day earns $1.50 a day. They have 3 children, two of whom work in a factory in Phnom Penh earning $60 each a month.

Mr. Leang really wants to create another business as now what he earns every day is not enough for daily expenses, so he needs some money to purchase a plot of farmland to do farming.

In addition to this land, a small part of the money will be used to buy rubber to resell and make an extra profit. For sure, all this is just a dream unless he can get a loan from KIVA.org. So this couple is requesting a loan from KIVA of US$ 750.

loans.use: purchase a plot of farmland and rubber for re-sale

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta, a mother, was very concerned when her family's household needs were not being met. So, in addition to caring for her family, she decided to start her own business. At first, she sold nice clothing without much success, so she decided to knit sweaters in various colors and designs and sell on a smaller scale. Thanks to continued business from her customers and her great desire to get ahead and improve her business, she was driven to seek a loan in order to buy more raw materials and be able to fill all of the orders that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Modesta, es una madre de familia muy preocupada que observando la insatisfacción de las necesidades de su hogar decidió emprender un negocio sin descuidar los requerimientos de los miembros de su familia, fue así como al principio ofertaba prendas de vestir sin acoger buenos resultados, entonces decidió tejer chompas de diversos colores y diseños para ofertarlos en menor escala fue así como gracias a las solicitudes de sus clientes y a su gran ánimo por mejorar y progresar con su labor la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima a fin de concretar cada una de las solicitudes que ha ido albergando.

loans.use: Purchase of additional raw materials

loans.name: Uwezo's Uwenacho Group

texts.en:
Uwezo is 28 years old and is divorced with 1 child, age 3. Uwezo is a cow seller; she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwanaisha, who has a business dealing in cloth sales.

loans.use: To expand her cow business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and the mother of two children. She has been treking to the northern part of Ghana to buy tubes of yam, dried fish and dried tilapia and retailing them in her town for the past five years. Due to the current food shortage, the demand for yams and other foodstuffs are very high. Ama wants to use her loan to buy more tubes of yam, dried tilapia and fish, to avoid price hikes, and also to increase sales. She hopes to start saving for her children’s education with this loan. Ama is member of the group called Francis. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Ama is holding her son in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fresh tubes of yam, dried tilapia and dried fish

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en:
Mrs. Nheb C., age 56, and her husband, live across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for 20 years and have 3 daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter sells meatballs in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nheb has been a silk weaver for 29 years. This is a skill that she learned from a nearby villager. She sells her finished products to a man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows in the village. Mrs. Nheb is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving..

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is 36 years old and she is a teacher. She's married and she has 2 sons who are at primary school. She owns her own home and it has electricity, water and a drainage system. Her home is in the district of Jr Bolognesi in the province of Yunguyo.

Due to her low income she also needs to do other things such as offering a photocopying service, a small bookshop (selling notebooks, folders, graph paper, pencils, ink pens, coloured pens, a variety of paper) from the school. This was a way of increasing her income.

To be able to increase merchandise she managed to join the group Banco Comunal Winay Marca which she has belonged to for some years. Her first credit was of $300 new soles which she invested in writing materials (packets of bond paper, writing books, ink pens, a variety of paper).

With the loan of $1000 (new soles) which she will pay back in 4 months, she will put in some phone booths for cellphone calls, and this will enable her to increase her income.

She has learned that women should be given their place, and her husband helps her a lot in the different activities that she does. Her vision is to buy a house in Tacna or Arequipa and a car so that her kids will get good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Consuelo tiene 36 años de edad, tiene como profesión profesora, es casada, tiene dos hijos varones, están en el nivel primario, casa propia cuenta con luz , agua y desague. Su domicilio esta ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo. Debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos, es que se vio obligada a desarrollar otras actividades como; servicios de fotocopiado y pequeña librería (venta de cuadernos, fólderes, papelógrafos, lapiceros, lápiz , plumones, colores, variedad de papeles) aun inicio dentro del pedagógico. Fue un medio para poder incrementar su ingreso. Para poder incrementar mercadería, logro integrar el Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca quien pertenece hace nueve años atrás, accediendo a un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en material de escritorio (paquetes de papel bond, cuadernos, plumones, variedad papelería). Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, instalará cabinas de locutorio para llamadas a celular, con esto incrementará un poco mas sus ingresos. Lo que aprendió es que las mujeres deben darse su lugar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, en las diferentes actividades que realiza. Su visión futura comprar una casa en el departamento de Tacna o Arequipa, y un automóvil, darles una buena profesión a sus hijos.

loans.use: To put in phone booths/Instalación de cabinas para locutorio.

loans.name: Davlatmoh

texts.ru:
Davlatmoh T. lives in Nurek. She is a businesswoman and sells fabrics at the central market. She would like to take out a loan for the autumn and the arrival of cold weather to purchase winter fabrics. Davlatmoh purchases her products in Dushanbe.

Davlatmoh has been in this business for 18 years, ever since her husband abandoned her family and she was left alone with 6 children to support. She now tries to give her children everything that she can. Davlatmoh’s oldest son needs to apply to college and as a result she needs to work very hard. Davlatmoh will pay back her loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тоджиддинова Давлатмо проживает в городе Нурек. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует тканями на центральном рынке. К осеннему сезону , к приходу холодов хочет получить кредит и уже завезти зимние ткани. Привозит она товар из города Душанбе . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 18 лет , с того момента как муж оставил их семью и она осталась одна с шестью детьми на руках. Теперь она старается дать детям все по мере возможности. Старший сын должен поступать в ВУЗ , поэтому ей необходимо очень много работать. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa M.  vive en la zona de villa cooperativa  de la ciudad de El Alto con su hijo de 12 años, el cual estudia en una escuela fiscal de la zona. Tiene su casa propia hecha de adobe.
 
La Sra. Comercializa chuño y tunta en la población de Senkata los fines de semana en la feria, además vende queso el cual elabora todos los días de la leche de sus ganados.

El crédito lo destinara para capital de trabajo. 
 
Es su segundo  crédito con Impro, los exhortamos a confiar en ella
texts.en:
Luisa M. lives in the Cooperativa neighborhood in the city of El Alto with her 12 year old son who studies in a local school. She has her own house which is made of adobe. She sells products derived from potatoes, “chuño” and “tunta”, in the Senkata weekend market in addition to cheese that she makes everyday with the milk from her cows. This loan will goes towards working capital. It is her second loan with Impro and we urge you to trust her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 49 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Rumbo al Éxito II”, ella tiene como meta arreglar la fachada de su casa, convertirlo en una tienda y vivir de su alquiler.  Tiene 4 hijos y es madre soltera, después de la separación con su esposo que era alcohólico, ella se ha dedicado a sacar adelante a sus hijos, a pesar de haber concluido una carrera en docencia de educación primaria ella manifiesta que no encuentra trabajo por lo que se le hace difícil dedicarse a su profesión.

Ella nos dice que gracias  a la zona donde vive; que es una zona comercial en la ciudad de Huaraz, puede alquilar su inmueble y así ayudarse con las rentas que le proporciona.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, la misma que trae desde la ciudad (Lima) y lo reparte a domicilio.

Con este préstamo de s/. 300 soles, que pagará en cuatro cuotas, iniciará la reconstrucción de la fachada principal de su local para alquiler.
texts.en:
Señora María is 49 years old and member of the community bank "Mujeres Rumbo al Éxito II" (Women on course for success II). She has as a goal to fix the front of her home, convert it into a shop, and live from her rental. She has four children and is a single mother. After the separation with her husband who was an alcoholic, she has been dedicated to making a better life for her children. Despite having the education to become a teacher of primary school, she has not been able to encounter a job and it is difficult to make a living with her profession. She tells us that thanks to the area where she lives (she lives in a commercial zone of the city of Huaraz), she can rent her property and receive help from the income that it provides. She is dedicated to selling clothes by orders, which she picks up in the city (Lima) and delivers to her customers at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of her commercial property

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Олимчон Умирзаков мужчина в возросте 39 лет , женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка занимается домашними делами и уходом за детьми.Олимчон работает постухом в колхозе.Он хорошо разбирается в мелкорогатом скоту. У него на сегоднешний день более 30 коз и 20 баранов.
Посёлок Утконсой расположен вблизи гор и все жители посёлка посут свой скот на пригорной окружности.И только поздно вечером скот пригоняют домой.Олимчон узнав что взяв кредит можно расширить свой бизнес, решил обратится в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Olimjon U. is a thirty-nine-year-old man who is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife who does housework and cares for their children. Olimjon works as a shepherd on a collective farm. He is very knowledgeable about sheep and goats. At present, he has more than thirty goats and twenty rams. The village of Utkonsoi is located near mountains, and all of the village’s inhabitants pasture their livestock in the foothills. Only late at night do they drive the livestock home. Olimjon, having learned that he can expand his business by taking out a loan, has decided to apply for one through MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying livestock and feed

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy L., 36, and her husband, Ponlork Phom, 49, live in a small village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. Two children are garment factory workers and the other three children attend school. Soy L.'s mother also lives with her.

Soy has been a garment factory worker for eight years. Her husband has been in the army for twenty years. He travels to work by motor taxi and the costs are high. Soy is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase one motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for driving to work.

loans.name: Mr. Sokha Rith Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Kroay Wat village in Kampong Chhnang province make up this village bank loan and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Sokha Rith P. was selected by the group members to be the village bank president. He is a firewood seller in the local village. Since this business is doing well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to purchase more firewood to resell. This will help to increase his income and improve their living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Pan Chida, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Sokha Rith P. is 34 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is only four years old. 

One member in this village bank loan has an end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Kodjovito

texts.fr: A. Kodjovito est  âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants Il est un charcutier dynamique, une exploitation qu’il tient à côté d’un maquis de la place à Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Mr. Kodjovito espère gagner un sa vie. Avec cette opportunité de Kiva et son deuxième crédit de FECECAV, il désire accroître la taille de son activité par achat de volailles, de bovins pour sa charcuterie. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre pleinement en charge les besoins de ses enfants qui sont tous en âge scolaire.
texts.en:
Kodjovito A. is 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He is an energetic butcher with a shop located next to a local eatery in Lomé, the Togolese capital. He hopes to earn a living. With this Kiva opportunity and his second FECECAV loan, he would like to expand his business by buying poultry and cattle for his butcher shop. The profits derived from his work will enable him to take full care of his children, who are all school-age.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry and cattle for his butcher shop

loans.name: Eva Felicidad

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Eva Felicidad M. es una dama que se dedica a laborar arduamente para mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación. Su dedicación es la crianza de cerdos o ganado porcino el cual desde hace 5 años ha logrado desempeñar en su propia localidad.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de productos para engorde de cerdos y de esta manera mejora sus condiciones de vida proporcionándole mejores oportunidades a su familia el cual se compone de ella que es una madre soltera y de sus tres hijos que debe mantener por ser estudiantes menores de edad.
texts.en:
In the area of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega is Eva, a woman who dedicates herself arduously to improve the conditions of her household. She makes a living raising pigs, which she has been able to carry out in her own place for the past five years. Currently, Eva has come to Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan that would allow her to purchase feed to fatten her pigs and in this way she will be able to earn more money so she can improve her living conditions and provide better opportunities for her family. She is a single mother with three children whom she provides for since they are young and still in school.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai T., 19, is married with one child. She sells banana and taro and her husband does the planting and looks after the plantation. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $83). SPBD loans are Salafai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Salafai wants to focus on her business because she believes it will help immensely in the uplifting of their living standards.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals and equipment

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys P. is 50 years old.  She is a married mother of nine children.  According to her, her last two children are still in school – junior high school. The rest are out of school and running their own businesses. She lives with some of her children in a family house in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

She says though her husband is employed, she still needs to work hard to help herself.

Gladys deals in smoked and fried fish.  She procures smoked fish all the way from Yeji in the north.  She sells to retailers in her community. Gladys has been in business since her youthful days.  She wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk.  Gladys also deals in second hand clothes.  She aspires to give her last two children the best education.

loans.use: Procure smoked fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk for her business

loans.name: Ebtissam

texts.en:
Ebtissam is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Ebtissam has been selling used clothes for a year. She requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for her work. This is the first time that Ebtissam has requested a loan.

Ebtissam is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her work, she didn’t face any difficulties. Nadia decided on doing her work because of her experience and she also likes the contact she has with her clients. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Ebtissam will use the loan to purchase clothes for her work

loans.name: Orzubek

texts.ru: Сангов Орзубек житель района Гиссар. Возраст 35 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает водителем частного такси. Автомобиль собственный, поэтому ремонт придется делать за свой счет. Поэтому он решил получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить автозапчасти.
texts.en:
Orzubek S. lives in Gissar. He is 35 years old and is married with 3 children. He has a high school diploma and works as a taxi driver. He uses his own car, which he has to repair at his own cost. He is applying for a loan in order to buy spare parts.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Confort Group

texts.en:
Y. L., 36, is married with four children, aged 12, 9 and 5 years, and the youngest being 9 months old. He has a business of selling kitchen ware that he started two years ago. He works from 9am to 5pm everyday. He earns a monthly profit of around $177. This will be Y.’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants a loan to increase the stock of his kitchen ware.

Y. will share this loan with his group, Confort, which has 19 members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture above, Y. is in blue shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of kitchen ware

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lolita P. is 63 years old and married with four children. She is from Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She started a business when she became a member of Paglaum MPC in July 2008 and now she's on her fifth loan cycle. 

She is seeking PHP 7,000 for additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store to buy stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. With her previous loans, she demonstrated outstanding loan repayment. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and to save for their old age.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Dalila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Tiene 13 años dedicándose a la venta de pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, vendiendo pocos pollos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.
Así, siguió superándose, ahora vende pollos en cantidad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un ambiente alquilado del Mercado Central, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y amas de casa.  Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  pollos vivos en jabas y  parte del dinero lo invertirá comprando herramientas nuevas como una balanza digital y cuchillos nuevos para remplazar a la que ahora tiene.

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Dalila Dice: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Dalila belongs to the Our Lady of Guadalupe Communal Bank located in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 48 years old, has a partner, is mother to 4 children, 2 of whom are still dependent upon her. She has been selling butchered chickens for 13 years in the city’s Central Market. She began with a loan from Manuela Ramos selling a few chickens, becoming very accepted with steady customers. She continued her successful business and now she sells chickens in bulk. Today she has the same business in a rented stall in the Central Market where she provides service to the restaurants and housewives. With this loan for S/.3000.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy crates of live chickens and with part of the money buy new tools like a digital scale and new knives to replace the one she now has. Today she is an independent woman and she manages and makes the decisions for her business. Dalila says: Belonging to a group of women has helped her better know her rights and together they work to be respected.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crates of live chickens

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice E. sells Fan Milk ice cream at Elmina. Beatrice has a senior high school education.  She is divorced and has four dependents. Beatrice has been selling Fan Milk ice cream since 2004. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy more ice cream for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream for resale

loans.name: Noemi Lourdes

texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 37 years old and has two children 13 and 9 years old. Both of her children are studying in the local public school. Noemí studied administration and took secretarial classes. After finishing her education, she worked in a law firm for two years until she was presented with an opportunity to work in Argentina. She had to return when her mother was diagnosed with a tumor, however, the operation was a success and the tumor was removed safely.

Noemí is dedicated to her husband and children and wants to return to work. This time she wants to have her own business selling school supplies. She is already successfully selling school supplies out of her home. Noemí feels that her personal and business goals are being met since she joined FINCA. Also, she says the support of fellow entrepreneurs has been inspirational for her.

Noemí is requesting a loan for 1600 soles to buy poster boards, mechanical pencils, and other school supplies. Her dream is to have a bookstore that sells school supplies and also functions as an internet café.

loans.use: buy poster boards, mechanical pencils, and other school supplies

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina Z. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Rosalina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In May 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lurinada

texts.en:
Lurinada C. is 50 years old and married with five children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 22.  The family presently resides in the village of Brgy. Rizal, City of Sagay, Negros Occidental. Her husband works in the sugar mill in Sagay, but his income is not enough to sustain all the needs of their family. As a housewife, Lurinada is the one who budgets the family income, and she saw that it was not enough to support their family. She thought that it would be a good idea to have another source of income to supplement her husband's income.  

To have access to capital to build her own business, Lurinada joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2000.  With her first loan she set up a general store adjacent to their house.  Even though she  earned only a small income when she started, she persevered and reinvested part of her profits back into the business, and industriously paid her weekly loan installments. As she built her good credit rating with NWTF-Project Dungganon, she was able to access a larger loan, and with it she expanded her business activities and started selling dried fish, which further increased her income potential. 

For over nine years, she managed to expand her business and this gave her an average monthly net profit of $109, which has been a big help to the family. Lurinada continues to maintain her good credit record: she just paid off her thirteenth loan of PHP 19,500 without a single delay. Now she is borrowing another PHP 19,500 to add to her revolving working capital for her business ventures.


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. is 38 years old. He is a single parent and has one daughter who is in primary school. He is a college graduate, who worked briefly as Admin Officer with a mobile company, and resigned to go into private business. He has 14 months of experience in business and sells soft drinks and liquor wholesale from a shop which he rents at New London Transit Lorry Park, Bo.

John is seeking a loan of Le 4,000,000 for 8 months to buy more drinks and fill the empty space in his store so that he will be able to meet the market demand of his customers.

John is a firm believer in the values of private enterprise. Among his many hopes and ambitions, John plans to use the proceeds from his store to support his daughter in school and to eventually own land on which to build a home. In the near future, John hopes to serve as an agent for his suppliers.

loans.use: To buy more beverages for his store

loans.name: Jemimah Priscillah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 45-year-old mother of two. She operates a general store, a business she has had for the last year. Her husband assists her in transporting the stock from the wholesalers to her shop.

Jemimah learned about KADET Ltd., a Kiva partner, through her neighbor, who has been a KADET client for four years. This is Jemimah's first loan from KADET and with her loan, she will purchase more stock for her shop. She also intends to include charcoal among her stock items.

She aspires to develop a plot of land that she has already purchased and ultimately move her business there, as she currently operates from rented premises.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase stock in her general store and diversify into the charcoal business

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella J.'s main source of income comes from making and selling native delicacies in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the town of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Mis. Occ. Annabella has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Annabella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Annabella is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment for making food. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for making food

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, a 42-year-old widow, has a poultry farm in Kisaasi with around 400 chickens. She has 150 broilers and 250 layers. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She incurs transport costs to and from Mengo-Kisenyi buying poultry feed. Aisha works seven days a week. She gets an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all kinds of people, both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges are thieves and the ever increasing price of chicken feed in Uganda.

Aisha has four children between the ages of 10 and 16. All her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she lives with four people. Aisha also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.

Aisha has been in business for over 15 years and with MCDT for 10 years – now on her 25th loan. Aisha joined MCDT because it is near her home and easy to work with. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of chicken feed and 100 laying chicks. She dreams of owning 1500 chickens.

loans.use: To buy sacks of chicken feed and 100 laying chicks

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La socia BACILIA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene su chacra donde siembra papa, alverjas, maíz, culantro y zanahorias. Ella distribuye su mercadería al mercado de San Jerónimo “Vino Canchon”. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más semillas para luego sembrar en su chacra.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Bacilia is a humble mother who belongs to the communal bank Virgen Purificada - Angostura.

The member is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo in the community of Angostura, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She has a farm where she grows potatoes, vetch, corn, cilantro, and carrots. She takes her goods to the "Vino Canchon" market in San Jerónimo. She has been working in this business for some years and it has gone very well thanks to the effort that she puts in to her work. Our member is a working mother and entrepreneur who supports her family. The member needs this loan to increase her business capital to buy more seeds to sow at her farm.

The member is very grateful for the opportunity offered to her and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her business capital to buy seeds to sow at her farm.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 24 years old and married, with one child. Her child is currently in primary school. She supports herself and her child by selling cosmetics. Esther sells by “hawking,” a form of selling where the seller moves door-to-door while carrying her stock on the head. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income and support her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas de Belén”, del Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 43 años y 04 hijos, 02  que aun dependen de ella.

Consuelo, se dedica a la venta de aguajes y turrones, iniciándose con un capital de S/. 100.00, hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio, por las mañanas y tardes,  ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio y esta muy  contenta con el trabajo que realiza.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará sacos de aguaje, maní en sacos, para sus turrones.

Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Ms. Consuelo belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Activas de Belen”, in the district of Moyobamba, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She is 43 years old, single, and has 4 children, two of whom are dependent on her. Consuelo sells aguajes (a small fruit) and nougat. She started with working capital of 100 PEN, and continues today with the same business. She works in the mornings and afternoons. Her stand is located in the center of the city. She tells us she is doing very well in her business and is very pleased with the work that she does. With this loan of 3000 PEN she will buy aguajes, and bags of peanuts to make the nougat. She feels very happy despite the difficulties she knows are part of trying to get ahead with her family. She recognizes the strong support that the Manuela Ramos Movement is providing to her and to other women in the San Martin region.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit and nuts

loans.name: Restauracion 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Restauracion (Restoration), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Santa is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling clothing by purchasing pants, shoes and blouses. She will use the profits to save toward her long-term dream of owning her own salon. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pants, shoes and blouses for resale

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Fernando João tem 48 anos de idade é solteiro pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 6 aos 14 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelas suas duas sobrinhas que vivem com ele em sua casa e consegue poupar por mes 1.000.00mt.

Sai de Nampula para Maputo emissão de serviço começa a trabalha na mecânica e serralharia durante 5 anos consequentemente é recrutado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Após 6 anos ele é desmobilizado e passa a viver com seu irmão na vila de namaacha na fronteira da Suazilândia, após sua chegada continua com seus trabalhos de Mecânica e serralharia. Anos depois com o fundo colectado nos seus trabalhos ele inicia com a criação de pintos primeiramente com uma caixa e meia (1500x100) assim aproxima se hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 6.000.00mt para reforçar o volume do seu negocio. Hoje e um dos melhores criadores da região tem comprado uma media de 100x3caixas de pintos gastando 24.000.00mt em cada fase, tem tido um lucro mensal no valor de 9.000.00mt caso não haja mortalidades.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Fernando na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro de 6.000.00mt foi usado para aumentar a criação de pintos, este segundo de 15.000.00mt será usado para mesma finalidade. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para ampliação das suas capoeiras.
texts.en:
Fernando João is 48 years old and is a single father of 3 children ages 6 to 14, all of whom attend school. In addition to his children he supports his two nieces who live with him. He manages to save 1.000.00 MT per month. He left Nampula for Maputo and worked as a mechanic and locksmith for 5 years. He was then conscripted to serve his mandatory military service. After 6 years he was discharged and went to live with his brother in Vila de Namaacha on the border of Swaziland. He again worked as a mechanic and locksmith. Years later, with funds saved from his work, he started raising chickens, starting with a box and a half (1500x100) of chicks and approached Hluvuku to request a loan for 6.000.00 MT to increase the volume of his business. Today he is one of the best chicken farmers in the region and has purchased an average of 100x3 boxes of chicks at a cost of 24.000.00 MT in each phase. He has monthly earnings around 9.000.00 when none of the chicks die. This is Fernando's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan for 6.000.00 MT was used to grow his business raising chickens. This second loan for 15.000.00 MT will be used for the same purpose. He is confident that he will repay the loan before it is due and request a new loan to expand his chicken coops.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling chickens

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: A. Christine est née le 3 septembre 1974.  Mariée à HOUNTONDJI François, un couturier, Christine est mère de trois enfants dont deux sont encore à sa charge.  Certains des enfants sont scolarisés.  La famille vit ensemble au quartier Djèdjèlayé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Christine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Christine vend de condiments, de charbon de bois, d’huile végétale, et d’huile de palme à son domicile.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Christine s’approvisionne.  Christine a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Christine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.  Christine ambitionne plus tard diversifier son activité en s’approvisionnant en tissus à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin, pour les revendre à Cotonou.
texts.en:
A. Christine was born on September 3, 1974. Married to Hountondji François, a dressmaker, Christine is the mother of three children, two of whom are still dependents. Some of her children have been educated. The family lives together in the Djèdjèlayé neighbourhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She and her husband provide for the family.
Christine never went to school. To support herself, Christine sells condiments, charcoal, vegetable oil and palm oil from her home. Christine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin’s international market.
Christine has already received and repaid two Alidé loans. Christine is requesting a third loan from Alidé to stock up on supplies and to better satisfy her customers. Christine plans to diversify her business by acquiring cloth from Lomé in Togo, a neighbouring country of Benin, to then resell in Cotonou.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal, condiments and peanut oil.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Despite the burden she is carrying upon her shoulders, being a single parent and a sickly woman, 59-year-old Lorna U. remains strong and determined to reach the dream she wishes to attain for her three children and one grandchild.

Lorna’s eldest, 22 year-old, son got married at an early age and without reaching a higher level of education. She thought that maybe this is because he realized how hard his mother worked just to earn money for their needs. He goes fishing to have his own income for the needs of his own family.

Being a mother and a grandparent, Lorna cannot seem to ignore the feeling of guilt when she sees her son and his family suffer from shortage of food and other basic needs.

When Lorna joined ASHI, the loan she requested was used to support her son’s fishing business. She sells the fish caught by her son by going house to house to the people in town, particularly in the neighboring village. The profits of this business are shared with her son and his family. This provides their cash flow and provides them with their basic needs.

The income, however, is just too small to support their need to improve their standard of living. Thus, Lorna is now requesting a much larger loan to put up her own businesses which are a variety store and hog/pig fattening. With an inventory in her store of items most needed by people like rice, charcoal (used to cook food), soap, and beverages, she will gain more customers from around the village.

The hogs she fattens can be slaughtered after four months and the meat sold in her store. If not, the pig can also be sold live to a meat vendor in the market.

Lorna is hoping that her envisioned businesses will help her in supporting the financial needs of her two children so that they are able to graduate from college. By then, she thinks their lives would be changed and she will have her dreams fulfilled.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her variety store, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mr. Mot M. (pictured here) and his wife, Mrs. Mon Pich, have been married since 1978. They are living along National Road No. 1, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Mot raises cows to sell, while his wife sells vegetables. She buys vegetables from Koki market for resale at Phnom Penh market. Mot hopes to continue expanding his business and that it will keep doing well. Therefore, he is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase supplies & equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Regina Nancha

texts.en:
Regina Nancha S. is 43 years old. She is married to Charles S. and has one child.

Regina is a farmer. She farms her own piece of land, which she has been doing for the last seven years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to use the loan to prepare the land for planting potatoes and to start sheep rearing. Potatoes have been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Regina's dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To prepare land for planting potatoes and to start sheep rearing

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta E. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 46 and married with school-aged children. She runs a general store selling a variety of different products. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marietta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product line. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marietta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product line

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda F. is a 55 year old married woman who supports her family by raising livestock and engaging in buying and selling of rice grains. She lives in Prk Bamandayan, Barangay Buenavista, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her 53 year old husband, Inocenioa, a carpenter, and their 7 children who are between 16 and 37 years old. Three of their children already have their own families. The other 3 are already working and help their parents. They still have one child currently going school.

Hilda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her livestock raising and buying and selling of rice grains business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Hilda is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she can add additional working capital to her business re-open her general store. This will be her 17th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Hilda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital and re-opening of her general store business.

loans.name: Paula De La Paz

texts.es:
Paula tiene 42 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es soltera vive con la madre, posee una tienda  de venta de producto de primera necesidad.
Inicio su negocio hace tres años con el apoyo de la madre, actualmente comercializa los productos con vecinos y personas que visitan el lugar, ella necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en compra de productos como son azúcar, harina, aceite, jabón, bebidas carbonatadas y otros que  tienen gran demanda por sus clientes.
Con la compra de nuevos productos atraerá  clientes y obtendrá más ganancias,sus aspiraciones son solventar las necesidades básicas de la familia, mantener su negocio, darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Paula is 42 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazán. She is single and lives with her mother. She has a store where she sells basic goods. She began her business three years ago with her mother’s support. Currently, she sells her goods to her neighbors and visitors. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of goods such as sugar, flour, oil, soap, soft drinks etc. that are in high demand by her customers. By buying new products, she will attract customers and increase her profits. She aspires to meet the basic needs of her family, maintain her business and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, oil, soap, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Harlin Danilo

texts.es:
El Sr. Herlin Danilo Díaz A. es padre  de familia  de tres  hijos  y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena y piedra.
Don Danilo dice  que toda la plata  que ha trabajado  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, y ha mejorando su hogar de acuerdo a sus posibilidades de sus ingresos y los prestamos brindados.
texts.en:
Herlin Danilo Díaz A. is a father with three children who are currently of school age. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials: cement, sand and stone. Danilo says that he has used all of the funds he has received from Ceprodel to improve the house where he lives, and he has improved his home in accordance with the opportunities offered by his income and the loans granted to him.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to construct a room in his home

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings. Despite his young age, he started his own business in 2007. He decided to purchase a big generator and provide electricity to his town. He chose this business after seeing a need for such services in the region. As do the majority of the Lebanese men, he helps his father with the family expenses. His business was suceeding and he has found an opportunity to expand into other areas. In order to fulfill his project, he needs to buy new tools and supplies. To do so, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: buy new tools and supplies

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is 39 years old and is married to U. D.. She has lived in the small city of Chichawatni since she got married. Chichawatni is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agriculture. Lubna is a housewife and the mother of three children: two girls and a boy, all of whom are attending school and getting their education. Lubna lives in a three room brick house and spends most of her time with her family by staying at home.

Lubna’s husband operates a used clothing business. He buys the clothes from different shops at the market and sells them on his cart by going to different areas of the community. He specifically deals with children's clothes. He earns a good income from it because he buys clothes at cheap prices and sells them at a good profit. In this way, he provides financially for his family. With the earned profit, he manages his children's school fees.

Lubna has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband upgrade his business. He will use the loan amount to buy used clothes in large quantities and sell them for a good profit. Lubna is hopeful that her husband will be able to successfully improve his business with the loan money. Lubna is a regular lender with Asasah and is in her 3rd loan cycle. In her previous loan years, she has proved to be a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and attended meetings regularly.

loans.use: Purchase used clothes for resale

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Sidibé est un homme marié de 36 ans et père de 6 enfants qui  vit avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Dougounina.
Monsieur Adama Sidibé n’a pas  fréquenté l’école moderne mais plutôt l’école coranique. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins il utilisait une charrette pour transporter les marchandises des commerçants de Bougouni. C’est ainsi qu’après une longue réflexion, il décida d’apprendre auprès de son ami le commerce d’achat et de vente des articles de fêtes,  des chaussures et d’habits.
Après quelques années d’économie et l’aide de certaines connaissances  il décide d’ouvrir une boutique des prêt à porter. Avec 6 années d’expériences, il maîtrise son activité.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso qu’il a connu à travers un ami.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter des chaussures, chemises et pantalons.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa  clientèle est composée d’hommes et femmes. Les fêtes religieuse et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les périodes où les ventes  sont les plus élevées.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de  50 000 FCFA.
Dans les années à venir  Adama Sidibé  ambitionne agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Sidibé is a 36 year-old married man and the father of 6 children. He lives with his two wives and their chldren in the Dougounina neighborhood of Bougouni. Mr. Sidibé did not attend a modern school but rather a Koranic school. In order to support himself, he used a cart to transport the merchandise of Bougouni shopkeepers. After reflecting at length, he decided to learn about the business of buying and selling festival items, shoes and clothing, from his friend. After saving for a few years and with the help of some friends, he decided to open a ready-to-wear shop. After 6 years of experience, he has mastered his business. Within the framework of expanding his business, he decided to affiliate with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program which he knew about from a friend. He plans to buy shoes, shirt and pants with this loan. He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). His clientele is made up of men and women. Religious holidays and important ceremonies (baptism, marriages) are the periods when his sales are the highest. He expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA with this loan. Mr. Sidibé hopes to expand his shop in the future.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, shirts and pants

loans.name: Shalimar

texts.en: Shalimar G. is from the village of Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Shalimar is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Shalimar raises ducks to produce and sell eggs. Shalimar has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Shalimar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shalimar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Shalimar from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita S. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 55 years old. She is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she provides multicab (or habal-habal) services  to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. 

Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for maintenance. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for maintenance

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: La señora Concepción G. L., tiene la edad de 54 años vive en el barrio San Caralampio, es madre soltera  de 5 hijos mayores de edad que sobreviven de manera independientemente  y apoyan a su madre a los gastos que esta incurre, ella es agricultora desde hace mas de 38 años, a problemas de plagas se ha enfrentado a lo largo de su larga experiencia y fue gracias al apoyo de la Reforma Agraria de los 80s que logro iniciar su negocio, a futuro espera diversificar sus cultivos, pero para poder realizar esta inversión primero solicita un préstamo para la ejecución de un mantenimiento fitosanitario, con el crédito comprara fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos, que le permitan a futuro un mejor capital de trabajo que favorezca a su economía.
texts.en: Concepción G. L. is 54 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighbourhood. She is a single mother with 5 grown-up children. They live independently and help their mother with her living costs. She has been a farmer for more than 38 years and has faced pest problems throughout her long years in the industry. The support of the Agrarian Reform in the 1980s enabled her to start her business, and in the future she hopes to diversify her crops. However, in order to make this investment she is first requesting a loan to help her maintain the health of her plants. With the loan she will buy fertilisers, fungicides, and raw plant materials. These will allow her to improve her working capital in the future, which will help her financial situation.

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Celina Almeida

texts.pt:
Celina Almeida Babi nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos de 5, 12 e 20 anos de idade e todos vão a Escola. Fez moente 2ª classe não continuou devido problemas financeiros. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, tem um negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, óleo, peixe, caldos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu produto.

 Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito, para construir a sua própria mercearia.
texts.en:
Celina Almeida Babi was born in the city of Maputo, province of the same name, south of Mozambique, she is divorced and has 3 children who are 5, 12 and 20 years old they all go to school. She studied until the 2nd grade because of lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support any other relatives.

She never left the city of Maputo, she has a grocery store for the last 5 years, she doesn't has employees and is able to get a profit of 3,000mt a month which is used for household expenses and is able to save some money on her bank account.

She never had loans with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku thru a friend who is also client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for 10,000mt she will use it to buy supplies (rice, flour, oil, fish, soups, among others) to increase the quantity of her products.

She is confident she will pay the debt before it's due and will request another loan to build her own grocery store.

loans.use: to buy supplies (rice, flour, oil, fish, soups, among others)

loans.name: David

texts.en: David K. G. is 54 years old and he has been selling sugarcane for three years in a busy environment. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase his stock of sugarcane. David also sells water and owns rental houses. He is a married father of seven and he hopes to buy a pick-up truck for transporting sugarcane for sale in wholesale markets.

loans.use: To increase his stock of sugarcane.

loans.name: Deysi Del Carmen

texts.es: Deysi del Carmen C. N. de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niños de 7 y 11 años de edad, junto a los cuales reside en Cojutepeque, en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Con el deseo de poder vivir mejor, desde hace 5 años y medio que Deysi inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación.
