Deysi atiende el negocio de lunes a domingo, su faena inicia cada día a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche, a pesar que su trabajo es pesado ya que debe atender clientes a lo largo del día, le permite estar en su casa y así mismo vender con sus vecinos los cuales la conocen desde hace mucho tiempo atrás. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad, sobre todo  bebidas frías, y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas para brindarles una mejor vida a sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en: Deysi del Carmen C. N., 30, is a single mother with two children aged 7 and 11 years old.  She lives with them in Cojutepeque, in the department of Cuscatlán.  Five and a half years ago, Deysi started her own business selling perishable goods in the hopes that it would allow her to live better.  The store is located in her house and Deysi tends to her business from Monday to Sunday.  She starts her first chore each day at 6 in the morning and finishes at 10 at night.  Although her work is heavy since she has to tend to customers all day long, it allows her to be at her house and likewise, to sell to her neighbors, who she has known for a long time.  This is why she is requesting a loan through which she will be able to buy a greater quantity of staple products -- above all cold drinks -- in order to improve her sales and offer her two small children a better life.

loans.use: to buy staple items

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos, el señor vende chompas en viajes al interior y su esposa es empleada en una artesanía, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen, en anterior crédito realizó la construcción en obra gruesa de esa habitación. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

El crédito será utilizado par la compra de estuco y cemento para terminar una habitación en la casa de sus padres.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Juan lives in his parents' house in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children. He sells sweaters on trips to the interior and his wife is employed in handicrafts. They get by with the income that they earn. The previous loan was used for the construction of the structural work of this room. He is satisfied with the loans that we have granted him.

The loan will be used for the purchase of stucco and cement in order to finish a room in his parents' house.

His previous history qualifies him for the obtention of a new loan and he is considered a good client.

loans.use: Purchase stucco and cement to finish a room

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin C., age 25, is married with one young child. Her husband sells firewood and makes a profit on average of 1.5 USD per day. Hin cultivates rice to sell, and she also feeds a few pigs in the cage behind her house.

This is rice harvesting season, and Hin has always hired an ox cart from her neighbor or other villager to transport her rice sheaves to her house. She would like to have her own ox cart, but she lacks the money to buy one, so Hin is asking for a loan to purchase her own cart.

loans.use: To purchase a new ox cart

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES  UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. David; el tiene 41 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; el socio tiene su negocio de carpintería el realiza puertas, ventanas, muebles, armarios entre otros mas, el tiene su negocio en su misma casa, el socio lleva años en este negocio y de esta forma el saca a su familia adelante, la socia es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por sus hijos.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas menores para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “MUJERES  UNIDAS” [Women United] communal bank. The bank is located in the Cuzco district, belonging to the province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is David. He is 41 years old and in a common law marriage and a father of 4. He has a carpentry business where he makes doors, windows, furniture, and closets, among other things. He has his business in his own home and has had it for years. This is the way that he gets his family ahead. He is a very optimistic person who really wants to get ahead for his children.   

The member is asking for the loan tobuy small tools for his business. 

He is happy with the loan and committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy small tools for his business.

loans.name: Fredys Edenilson

texts.es:
Fredys de 23 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 2 años de edad, Fredys se dedica al trabajo como panificador desde hace 3 años, trabajando en horas de la tarde, este oficio se lo enseño su patrón y actualmente obtiene lo necesario para el hogar  por el sueldo que recibe de este trabajo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de láminas para mejorar  su vivienda, ya que las paredes de la casa son de varas de bambú haciéndola un tanto insegura, por lo que busca mejorar con la instalación de laminas en su lugar.
Fredys sueña con lograr algún día construir una casa de paredes firmes de ladrillo, que sea segura y cómoda para su familia.
texts.en:
Fredys, 23, lives in Delicias de Concepción with his wife and their two-year-old son. Fredys has worked as a baker for three years, working in the afternoons. He learned this trade from his boss, and it now pays for his living expenses.

Fredys is seeking this loan to buy sheet siding to improve his house. Currently, the house has only bamboo walls, making it very insecure. He wants to replace the bamboo with sheet siding.

Fredys dreams of one day building a house of brick, which would be safe and comfortable for his family.

loans.use: Sheet siding for house

loans.name: Khadim Rassoul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KHADIM RASSOUL est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 18 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles sont unies par des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de PALENE COKI

Khady T. assise devant la photo en troisième position à partir de la droite, de noir vêtue, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant mais elle a la charge de ses trois neveux et une nièces.

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique au marché centre de son village. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Mais ce prêt sera utilisé pour l'achat de tissus qu'elle va revendre dans le village.

Elle participe à la prise en charge des enfants de son frère. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
The Khadim Rassoul solidarity group was created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 18 women who are all from the same village. They share ties of friendship and kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of Palene Coki.

Khady T. is the group leader. In the photo, she is seen sitting in the front row, third from the right and dressed in black. She is 36 years old and single with no children, although she does have three nephews and one niece in her care.

She runs a shop at the central market of her village. She also practices sheep fattening. The loan, however, will be used to buy fabrics for resale in her village.

She helps to take care of her brother’s children. Her goal is to boost her savings and support herself.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for resale

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 25 years old, married, and has a 4 year old child. She owns a shop in which she sells several household items such as sugar, rice, salt, and more. She is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business.  She will use the extra profits to help meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her shop

loans.name: Maylon Adonay

texts.es:
El Sr. Maylon P. se dedica a la micro Industria, su especialidad es la elaboración de bloques de concreto en tamaños grandes y pequeños.

Don Maylon tiene (2) dos años de dedicarse a la elaboración de este producto y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, observamos el crecimiento de su negocio y la cantidad de metería prima que posee para la fabricación de bloques.

Don Maylon además de vender el producto en el lugar donde se encuentra ubicada la fabrica de bloques también tiene en el servicio de transporte de los mismos, ya que cuando el cliente compra el producto y no tiene en que transportarlo él brinda este servicio a un costo adicional, esto le genera otra fuente de ingresos adicional a su negocio.

El Sr. P. esta casado y junto a su esposa han procreado un hijo.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de los bloques.
texts.en:
Maylon P. is a small businessman who makes large and small concrete blocks.  Maylon been making these products for two years and it is clear that he has known how to run his business.  His business has grown and he now owns a larger quantity of raw materials for making his blocks.

In addition to selling his blocks from his factory, he also offers a service transporting them.  When his customers buy his products and don't have any way of transporting them, he offers this service at an additional cost.  This is an additional source of income for his business.

Mr P. is married and has one child.  He will use his loan to buy raw materials for making blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and water

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Trinidad tiene 32 años, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Raúl, de 37 años y sus hijos menores. Por quienes trabaja arduamente. Desde su infancia estaba ligado a la crianza de cerdos, actividad que le enseñaron sus padres y que ahora lo realiza como un negocio personal. Ella considera que esta actividad le es bastante rentable, sobre todo cuando son cerdos de raza los que tiene que comercializar, ya que requiere de mayor cuidado y alimentación. Ante esto se ha propuesto comprarse material para elaborar  corrales y separar machos y hembras con crías. En adelante, cuando tenga más capital podrá construir un corral a base de cemento. De este modo, quiere lograr intensificarse en la crianza de cerdos, procurar que sea más higiénica. Su mayor propósito es ganar más para así poder cubrir la educación de sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que piensa acceder a posteriores ayudas, para crecer son su labor. De obtener el crédito que necesita, comprará materiales para hacer el corral de cerdos, así como alimentos balanceados para el desarrollo de cerdos.
texts.en: Trinidad is 32 years old and lives in her parents' house with her husband Raul, age 37, and their young children, for whom she works so arduously. Ever since childhood, she has had ties to pig breeding, which she learned from her parents. She is now in the business for herself. She thinks that this business is lucrative, especially when she sells pedigree pigs because they require more care and nutrition. She has decided to purchase materials to build pigpens and separate the boars from the sows and their piglets. Later on, when she has more capital, she will be able to build a cement pigpen, this way she can expand her pig breeding business in a more hygienic manner. Her biggest goal is to earn more money so that she can cover her children's educational expenses until they become professionals. This is her first loan from MFP, and she commits to making her payments punctually since she is planning on obtaining subsequent loans so that her business can grow. Once she obtains the loan she needs, she will purchase materials to make pigpens and feed that is balanced for her pigs' development.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and materials to make pigpens.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Prescilla has been in this business for 10 years. Prescilla earns more income from food vending.

Prescilla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La Señora Georgina B. tiene la edad de 41 años, estudio hasta el sexto semestre de preparatoria, esta casada y tiene dos hijos una mujer de nombre Bris de 18 años y un hijo de nombre Vladimir de 21 años ambos asisten a la universidad, doña Georgina vive en una comunidad llamada El Jicaro que se ubica en la carretera Tierra Blanca-Joachin, esta zona se caracteriza por ser ganadera.
Doña Georgina nos platica que muchos años vivio en el estado de México pero su esposo siempre habia tenido el deseo de poner una purifica de agua y cuando junto el dinero para iniciar su propio negocio regresaron a su comuidad a trabajar en su proyecto, su purificadora tiene el nombre de "Electrover", nos dice que al principio fue dificil hacer clientes y que su producto fuera aceptado pero con el paso del tiempo sus  esfuerzos valieron la pena y ahora es un negocio sólido con mucho futuro pero necesita que se le invierta mas poco a poco.
Ella nos dice que ya tienen 7 años con su purificadora y que gracias a Dios las ventas son buenas y necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de garrafones y dar mantenimiento a su purificadora.
Ellos desean que con esta inversión puedan dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y  una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, tambien envia mucho agradecimiento a la fundacionpor el apoyo que le ha brindado con este prestamo.
texts.en:
Georgina B. is 41 years old.  She studied up to the sixth semester of high school.  She is married and has two children: one daughter called Bris who is 18 years old and one son called Vladimir who is 21.  They are both university students.  Georgina lives in a community called El Jicaro which is located on the Tierra Blanca-Joachin highway.  This area is noted for being an area where people raise livestock.

Georgina tells us that she lived in the State of Mexico for many years but her husband had always wanted to set up a water purifier and when they gathered together enough money to start their own business, they returned to their community to work on their project.  Their purifier is called "Electrover".  She tells us that at first it was difficult to attract customers and to get their product accepted but, over time, their efforts paid off and now they have a solid business with a great future.  However, she needs to gradually invest in her business.

Georgina says that she and her husband have been in the water purification business for 7 years and, thanks to God, their sales are good.  She needs this loan to invest in buying large water bottles and having their purifier serviced.

Georgina and her husband are hoping that this investment will enable them to provide a better service to their customers and a better quality of life to their children.  Georgina also sends thanks to Fundación Realidad for the support that they have provided through this loan.

loans.use: to produce purified water and sell the water bottled

loans.name: Leonel Ernesto

texts.es: EL SEÑOR LEONEL LABORA COMO COLECTOR DE RUTA ,ES SOLTERO ,TIENE  UN  HIJOS A SU CARGO,ES  ELNOVENO CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE HAN BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTILO  UNA PARTE EN COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO Y LA OTRAPARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO ARENA CEMENTO BLOQUE, HIERRO,PARA AMPLIAR LA SALA  DE SUS VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Leonel works as a route collector.  He is single and has a child in his care.  This is his ninth loan that Ceprodel has provided.  He is thankful for the opportunity this institution has given him.  

He will use this loan to purchase merchandise for his small business and to purchase construction materials like sand, cement blocks, and iron to expand a room in his home.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 42-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has manufactured glass and mirrors since 2009. He likes this business, and is willing to improve it and update his machines as much as he can. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, to buy a new machine required to etch glass and a computer to help search for new designs or to design new ones.

Abbas works hard to provide his children with the best education and healthy lives. He works hard to improve his business. Most of his customers say that he has very good quality products and that his prices are affordable to anyone. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a special machine to etch on glass.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann, 43 years old, is a gruel seller. Before, she was a farmer, but the income from the field is small and some seasons she could not get any income at all. That’s why she sells gruel. Her husband is a water seller. They have five children. Three are still studying and the rest are working in the factory. She needs to spend $5 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 for other expenses every month. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a hand tractor to plow her field. She plans to buy a hand tractor because she thinks she can get more income by using it to plow the other farmers' farmland when they need it. Her plan for the future is only to keep the current career running well.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor to plow the field.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 42 years old. He is married and has 3 children aged 9, 12 and 15. In 1991, he established his used clothing (junks) business. He started his business because he wanted a means of employment for himself and his family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month. 

He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy 8 bales of assorted used clothing @ Le500, 000 each. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, he plans to open a stall for his wife, educate his children and buy land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Willan Osvaldo

texts.en: Willan Osvaldo, who goes by his middle name, is 29 years old and lives near the city of Ibarra, Ecuador. He is unmarried and has two children aged four years, 5 months and one year, eight months, respectively. Osvaldo is the kind of man who gets along with everybody. Osvaldo and his brother make bricks. They complete the process from start to finish, forming the bricks and baking them in their large brick oven. Osvaldo began his business with a small amount of credit 10 years ago. Since then, he reports that he owes his business, his house, and his life, as he knows it to the opportunity afforded to him by his first loan. He did not have the capital to start the business. Osvaldo has many dreams for the future. He wants to continue making bricks. However, he sees expansion in his future. His goal is to buy land, build houses with his own bricks, and sell his houses.

loans.use: to buy brickmaking materials and firewood

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man with two children; one child attends school and one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Nicholas' greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six months, Nicholas has operated a business selling vegetables from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in his business. His major dream is to become a leading vegetable seller in the market. 

Nicholas plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of vegetables for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sonia Tamara

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio.
 
Ella junto a su querido esposo tiene un restaurante en su casa en el cual preparan meriendas y todos los días prepara diferentes platos al gusto de sus clientes. Llevan más de diez años que se dedican a esta actividad y siempre les ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes están muy a gusto con lo que ella prepara pues como dice ella todo lo que se  hace con amor sabe más rico.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en el banco ha hecho muy buenas amigas.

Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton which is renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts which are recognized both nationally and internationally.  It is the place where the famous straw hats come from.

Sonia, 38, lives here.  She has a spouse and two children who are 14 and 12 years old and going to school.

She, together with her beloved husband, has a restaurant at home where they prepare meals.  Every day she prepares different dishes according to her customers’ tastes.  They’ve been in business over ten years and have always done well because their customers are very satisfied with what she prepares because, like she says, everything that’s prepared with love tastes better.

This loan will be used to buy foodstuffs to prepare the meals.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because she’s made many good friends here.  Her dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy foodstufffs.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en: Jackie is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She did not go to school. She is married and has four children between 1 and 15 years old, all of whom live at home and are in school. Her husband is a driver. For the past three years she has been selling charcoal and plastic bags, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and plastic bags for her business. Her plans are to build her house and sent her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastián tiene 32 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la ofrecer el servicio de barbería, uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido lograr complacer a sus clientes que diariamente llegan a su negocio en busca de variedad de productos.  Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Surge por la necesidad de brindarle a su familia lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de talcos, cuchillas, vaselina, tijera, peines, cremas entre otros.
texts.en: Sebastián is 32 years old. He is married and is raising 2 children. His economic activity is offering barber services. One of his biggest challenges has been pleasing his customers who come to his business everyday seeking a variety of products. He has worked in this business for more than 3 years. He started because he needed to give his family what they need. The loan is for working capital to buy powders, blades, vaseline, scissors, combs and creams, among other things.

loans.use: to buy powders, blades, vaseline, scissors, combs and creams, among other things.

loans.name: Seboblo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEBOBLO est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de  Franck est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Franck est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Franck est marié à une revendeuse  du nom de Marie. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Franck a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Franck fait la maraîchage. Franck mène cette activité depuis cinq ans ennvirons. Franck s’approvisionne en engrais, en insecticides et en graines dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Franck sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEBOBLO, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SEBOBLO Group is made up of three persons, who live in the same neighborhood. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial help from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group leader, named Frank, is the one raising his hand in the photograph. He's 32 years old, lives in Benin, and is married to a reseller named Marie. The couple has two children to support, who both attend school.

Frank attended school up to middle school. To support himself and his children, he's been growing fruits and vegetables for five years. He gets his supplies of fertilizers, insecticides and seeds from one of Benin's market.

Eager to meet customer demand and increase his revenue and income, Frank is seeking a third loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, together with the other member of SEBOBLO Group. Previous loans were repaid with problems.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds

loans.name: Jenibeb

texts.en:
Jenibeb is a 24-year-old married woman with 2 young children. She is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Jenibeb grows rice crops to sell. She also raises pigs to help augment their family income. Jenibeb works hard to earn more and save for her children's education.

Jenibeb has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pig feed. She hopes that this loan would help improve her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pig feed

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and a father of one child. He lives with five family members; two of them work.

Wissam has owned a bookshop since 2008, for imaging, photocopying and stationery items. He has sufficient experience in this field, and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to purchase a professional video camera. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a professional video camera.

loans.name: Zvichanaka Group

texts.en:
Fungayi is 40 years old and single.  She has two children aged 18 and 12 years; both of them attend school. She lives in Shurugwi, a small town near Gweru.

She is a cross-border trader and she sells footwear, blankets and clothes in the local flea market. She has got two employees. The business is affected by late payments from her customers, import duty, border hassles, competition and high transport costs. Fungayi has a brother who stays in Botswana who frequently sends her some money as additional income.

She wants to open her own shop and have many employees which will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy footwear, blankets and clothes.

loans.name: Dominga Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga, es clienta antigua, que se encuentra en la cuarta secuencia en nuestra institución, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. Dominga demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, razón por la cual se le otorgo el crédito,   La Sra. Dominga vive en la zona Sopocachi, de la ciudad de La Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con su hija, la Sra. se dedica a la venta de diversos productos, ella tiene su puesto de venta en zona de Sopocachi cerca de una universidad,  ya hace unos 14 años que tiene su kiosco donde ya es muy conocida por la zona, el crédito va invertir en la compra de mercadería como cigarros y tarjetas telefónicas y otra mercadería para surtir el negocio de su kiosco.
texts.en: Dominga is an old client, and has had four loans with the communal bank. When the bank evaluated her loan Dominga was found to have a good attitude, polite and friendly, and this is why she was approved for a loan. Dominga lives with her daughter in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She works selling various products. Her business is located in the Sopocachi area near a university, and she has had her kiosk there for about 14 years so it already well known in the area. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as cigarettes and phone cards and other merchandise in order to supply her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes and phone cards and other merchandise in order to supply her kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are women. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chemicals, cosmetics and braids. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, cosmetics and braids.

loans.name: Elizalde

texts.en:
An industrious man, 41-year-old Elizaldy has been a farmer for five years. Although it is a difficult occupation, Elizaldy has worked persistently to continue to improve it. Now requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds and to pay for labor costs, he wants his crops to grow well in order to surpass his profit of P15,000 last cropping season.

The father of five children, Elizaldy needs to work hard to grow enough crops for his family. Hopefully, through his perseverance and patience, he will lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rosalie is buying and selling clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing to sell. Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 29, is married with one child who is four years old. He has been a mechanic for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,300.

This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the funds to buy paints and a mechanic's tool box. David intends to use the expected profits to pay school fees for his child and hopes to open a big garage in the future.

loans.use: To buy paints and mechanic's tools

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Khamis is a 58-year and married. He has been into poultry farming   business for the last six months. 

He is requesting for his first loan with KADET ltd of kes 20,000. He plans to use the loan to purchase more chicken for rearing on his farm. The proceeds from the business will be used to expand his business and repay his loan. 

He hopes are to expand and excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily has been with KADET LTD and is servicing her third loan from KADET LTD after paying back the previous loans successfully. She does dairy farming on their farm in Kiboswa location and has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. Even the monthly income has not changed  She very happy with the progress.

She will use the loan to purchase more dairy cows and improve the dairy farm.  The profits will be used to repay the loan and plow back into the farm.

She hopes to improve in dairy farming and have a bright family.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy cows

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana tiene 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus dos pequeñas hijas de 3 años y 2 años de edad el cual les tienen que brindar mucho cariño y sobre todo el pan de cada día. Ana tiene su pequeño negocio de artículos plásticos, papel de regalo, peluches, loncheras desde hace 5 años que gracias a su experiencia ella cuenta con mucha clientela que solicitan sus artículos. Ana solicito un crédito el cual invirtió en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y se dio cuenta que obtiene buenas ganancias, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: artículos plásticos, papel de regalo y peluches loncheras para seguir invirtiendo y manteniendo su negocio.

loans.use: Para invertir en: artículos plásticos, papel de regalo y peluches loncheras para seguir invirtiendo y manteniendo su negocio.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 49 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marlene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marlene requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Marlene has been in this business for twenty-five years. In the future, Marlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Samangul

texts.en:
Samangul is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan, Gubadli. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. She is 48. She is a widow and has 5 children. Samangul has lost the husband in war. Despite all difficulties during 14 years this mother could grow up the children alone. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro she built the grocery store. The second time she borrowed $700 and expanded a quality of the goods.
She applies for the loan $1000 to buy the textile goods and increase the goods assortments.

loans.use: To buy the textile goods and increase the good assortments

loans.name: Nengsih

texts.en: N. is 36 years old and is married with four children, aged 19, 16, 8 and 1. The first three are girls and the last one is a boy. She sells kerosene, some snacks, and other household goods in a small booth. Her husband, Nali, is a fisherman with unfixed income. She can earns $6 per day and will need a larger loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Jumaboi

texts.en: Jumaboi  is married with two children and he has been running his business for over 10 years. He started his business with $100. His business is situated in an open air market in the Mastchoh market. When he heard about MicroInvest, he became a client and grew his business. His business is now sucessful and he has loyal clients. He plans to use loan for buying an inventory of seasonal shoes to sell. He also wants to rent another location for his son.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Mrs. Roth N. is 53 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband (pictured here) and their 5 children.  She works on the family's farm and also sells Khmer noodles to local villagers.  She earns about $1/day selling noodles and the family earns $2/day from their farming activities.  Three of the children work at a garment factory and help to supply the house with income.  This loan will be used to purchase a pump for cultivating their crops.

loans.use: To purchase a pump for cultivating their crops

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is a 56 year old merchant, she’s married to 47 year old Felipe Torres. He is a carpenter and he is in charge of polish wood and sells it. They have two adult professional sons thanks to the help of their parents. Felipe learned the trade by his father since a very early age, then he became independent and he started his own business more than 15 years ago. His business is thriving thanks to his effort and Lucila’s hard work at home and on selling the products. They will use this loan to buy a brushing machine because this time of the year there is much demand and the machine will be used a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Lucila tiene 56 años, comerciante, está casada con Felipe Torres de 47 años de edad, el es carpintero quien se encarga de pulir las maderas para ponerla en venta. Tienen dos hijos mayores de edad quienes son profesionales gracias al trabajo y sacrificio de sus padres. Felipe aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien trabajó desde muy temprana edad, luego se independizó y puso su propio negocio más de 15 años, lo cual le va muy bien gracias a su esfuerzo y al trabajo incansable de Lucila quien se encarga de la venta y de los trabajos de la casa. Destinará este crédito para la compra de una maquina cepilladora, en esta época del año tiene alta demanda y le será de mucha utilidad en el negocio.

loans.use: compra de una cepilladora

loans.name: Flora Antonio

texts.pt:
Flora lives in Neighborhood 4 in Macia, Bilene district. She entered the program this year. She is a widowed mother of 4. All of Flora's children attend school. She entered the loan program in order to expand her business and thereby cover the household expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Flora vive no Bairro 4 da Macia ,distrito do Bilene.Entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Ela e viuva e mae de 4 filhos. Todos os 4 filhos de Flora estao a estudar. Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito para poder ampliar o seu negocio de modo a poder custear todas as despesa da casa.

loans.use: Flora would like to use the money to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anave

texts.en: Anave joined SPBD in 2004 to start her ice cake (popsicles in a bag) business. After two months she earned more money than she had before and she started to expand her business. She began to sell items like fish and chips in a fast food stall so she could continue to help her family. It has been almost four years, now, and she has moved into a new house, which is a big improvement. Anave and her family live in a healthy environment now because of her hard work and ability to save money. Anave earns $350 WST ($140 USD) in profit weekly. She is requesting this loan to buy more supplies to sell in her fast food stall.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, oil, fish, chicken, pepper, flours, pots, and other supplies for her fast food stall

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret Y., age 45, and her husband have been married since 1988. They have five children—four sons and one daughter. Their four sons are all studying in a local school, and their daughter works with her mother. Saret and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been running a grocery store for over five years. Her husband is employed full time.

Saret is requesting her fourth loan, in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to buy grocery items to resell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to resell

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Mrs. Va T. is a 46-year-old housewife and mother of four children.  Her husband has more than nine years of experience working in construction  and typically earns about $5 per day; this money is used for household expenses, including her children’s tuition. Mrs.Va T. would like to develop another source of  income by requesting the loan from KIVA to purchase pigs to breed on her plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to breed on her plot of land.

loans.name: Monica Lisbeth

texts.es:
Mónica belongs to the Community Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, located at 651 Jr. Los Ceticos in the district of Manatay in the Department of Ucayali. She is 37 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband is a motortaxi driver. Monica invested the first loan of 300 Soles she received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase and sale of motor lubricants.

Currently she has a mechanic’s workshop and a spare-parts store in her house, she also owns a motortaxi for which she is still paying. In the mornings she busies herself caring for her children and with domestic chores, and in the afternoons she attends to her business.

With this loan of 1000 Soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy parts for the motortaxi, spare parts and clothes to sell.

Mónica is united with her companions at the bank because they are like a family for her.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mónica pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Los Ceticos 651 del Distrito de Manatay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Mónica con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en la compra y venta de lubricantes.

En la actualidad tiene un taller de mecánica y venta de repuestos en su casa, cuenta con un motocarro que esta pagando todavía , en las mañanas se dedica a atender a sus hijos y a las labores domesticas, y por las tardes atiende su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara piezas para su motocarro, repuestos y ropas para vender.

Mónica es solidaria con sus compañeras de bancos por que son como una familia para ella.

loans.use: Purchase products for her business

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is the owner and operator of a small pharmacy in the coastal town of Elmina.

Kofi started his business career by selling mobile phones. With the help of his first microloan, he was able to begin renting this shop. He now hopes to use this loan to expand his inventory and selection of drugs. In addition, he would like to begin saving some of his profits to build a home for himself. He has operated his shop for two years.

Kofi is a member of the "Trust God" lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs for his shop in Elmina

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married, and he has one daughter. He is a businessman from Zaporozhye. Igor sells sports footwear in the Yubileynyi market. His vending spot is well-known in the market because there are few other locations with the same type of merchandise and because the prices Igor offers for his products are very reasonable. He has been in this business for several years. Currently, Igor has about $2,000 worth of merchandise in inventory, and his gross income is approximately $1,200 per month.

Igor is very industrious and enterprising: he is focused on his business, and he is determined to expand his vending facility. Therefore, he is currently seeking a loan for 5,000 Grivnas ($1,050) so that he may increase his assortment of sports footwear and thereby grow his business. With the expected increase in sales and profits from the loan, he hopes to open an additional vending kiosk and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his inventory and to further grow the business

loans.name: Ayeshetu

texts.en: Ayeshetu is married with three children. Due to high transport costs she has been selling smaller quantities of her products such as peanut butter, maize, beans, okra, etc  This has reduced her working capital and her family income. She wants to use the loan to buy  larger quantities of peanuts for butter, maize, beans, etc to increase inventory and income. She believes this loan would help her save some for her children’s future. Ayeshetu is a member of the group called “Adom no nti” meaning Because of Grace. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Ayeshetu is seated first on the left side in the photo and the others are her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of peanuts to make peanut butter, maize, beans, etc

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana is 43 years old and provides internet services at her internet cafe where customers can use a computer and the internet for a fee. A short time ago, she began her business with only 4 computers, and now she feels proud of her business' growth, having more than 10 computers. Through this service Viviana makes life easier for the people in her area. However, she doesn't want to remain only here, she has set her sights on other businesses as well. She is also the owner of a motorcycle taxi, and counts on the unconditional support of her husband who drives the taxi. Viviana is the mother of four children, 2 of which are on their own and 2 of which are students, and she would like to see them have a good professional future. It is for that reason that she works hard to provide them with whatever they need. Viviana requests this loan in order to expand and improve the condition of her store. Please support this dedicated mother who is working arduously to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Viviana tiene 43 años, ella brinda los servicios de cabinas de Internet desde hace poco tiempo, ella empezó en este negocio con sólo 4 computadoras, ahora cuenta con más de 10 máquinas y se siente orgullosa de su crecimiento. Viviana, mediante este servicio brinda muchas facilidades a las personas de su entorno, sin embargo no sólo quiere quedarse ahí ya que tiene visiones para otros negocios. A la vez es propietaria de un motocarro y para ello cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo quien se dedica a manejar la moto. La señora Viviana es madre de 4 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos independientes y los dos últimos estudiantes, a los mismos que quiere ver en un futuro buenos profesionales, es por eso que trabaja duro para brindarles lo necesario. Viviana quiere ampliar y mejorar las condiciones de su local y para esto es que solicita el préstamo. Apoyen a esta madre emprendedora y decidida, que trabaja arduamente por salir adelante.

loans.use:
To expand and improve the atmosphere of her store where she provides public internet access and use of computers (cabinas de Internet).

Ampliar y mejorar el ambiente de su local donde brinda el servicio de cabinas públicas de internet.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Ms. Luz María is 41 years old, a single mom, and studied higher technical education which she was not able to finish, has three children who are students, and lives in the district of Trujillo in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad.

The entrepreneur began selling juices and out of her display cabinet she sold bread, later she was advised by a non-governmental organization helping mothers. Because she wanted to expand her business she decided to join the communal bank “Luz Divina” and with the first loan of 300 soles (US $100) that she received she purchased a small car to sell juices, cakes, bread.

With a loan of 1200 soles (US $425) which will be repaid in six months, she intends to purchase beer, rice, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc. In the communal bank in which she belongs she has the role of treasurer, whose function is to receive all payments, keep accounts. She dreams of having a garment manufacturing company.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz María tiene 41 años, es madre soltera, estudió educación superior técnica la cual nunca pudo ejercer, tiene 03 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria inició vendiendo jugos y en su vitrina vendía pan, después le avisaron que una ONG ayudaba a las madres, como ella quería ampliar su negocio decidió incorporarse al Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró un coche pequeño para vender jugos, pasteles, pan. Con el crédito de S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado compra cerveza, arroz, leche, azúcar, gaseosa, etc. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de tesorera, cuya función es recibir todos los pagos, llevar la contabilidad. La socia sueña con tener una empresa de confecciones de ropa.

loans.use: Purchase of various products (groceries)

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Dona Maria is from the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 17-year-old son. This photo was taken of her husband, Filiberto C., because Dona Maria was out running errands when her loan officer went to visit her.

The couple has two sources of income: 1) an automotive workshop in their home and 2) food and drink sales from a lunch counter they run on the weekend. There is little competition in car repairs, since they have regular customers who drive big rigs and other large automobiles. There is a lot of competition with other lunch counters, but there is also high demand, and Dona Maria and Don Filiberto have many regular customers.

The couple would like to use this loan to buy more drinks for their lunch counter as well as some additional tools for their repair shop. This is Dona Maria's third loan, and she is considered an excellent client since she has always been very punctual with her repayments.

loans.use: Buy drinks for re-sale and car repair tools

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is Esther from Dar es Salaam, married with three children between the ages of 9 and 17. Since 2007, Esther has been operating a shop that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides, printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Esther's business is doing well as she works 12 hours per day, six days per week, earning about $100 monthly from her business. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to buy more African traditional cloth such as kanga and vitenge. In the future, she plans to increase the stock of African traditional cloths for her shop. Esther thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase traditional African cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Narong

texts.en:
Mrs. Narong N., 33, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Hul, 36, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1992 and have three children, one son and two daughters. They all are students.

Narong has been selling vegetable for sixteen years. She buys vegetables from villagers and sells them at Dem Kor market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To help build a small house for her family

loans.name: Shina

texts.en: Mrs. Shina S., a resident of Chek Village in Kandal Province, and her husband, Mr. Ton Chom, are farmers who own 3 hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Due to field infertility, Shina is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to make their crop more productive. She hopes to thereby increase their rice revenue with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Ivelisse

texts.en: Ivelisse is wonderful lady, who lives in the Dominican countryside.  She operates a town "colomado" that provides food and supplies to the community. This loan will provide new walls and doors for her store.  Thank you for supporting Ivelisse!

loans.use: Repair a little store building

loans.name: Rocío Melida

texts.es:
ROCIO MELIDA, pertenece al banco comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Los Cipreses N°  202 – Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 43 años de edad, 3 hijos, su esposo es mecánico. Ella tiene una bodega. 

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró artículos para su bodega como arroz 01 saco, azúcar 01 saco, gaseosa 06 paquetes (todos descartables), golosinas y agua mineral 02 paquetes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró arroz 01 saco, azúcar 01 saco, gaseosa en botellas descartables 10 paquetes, 02 paquetes de agua mineral, embutidos en variedad, yogurt 02 paquetes, leche en tarro grande media caja.

Ella es una cliente fiel a Manuela Ramos, y agradece por poder  salir adelante en su negocio, y sabe que seguirá creciendo.
texts.en:
Rocio Melida belongs to the community bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors), located in Jr. Los Cipreses N 202 in the Yarinacocha district. She is 43 years old and has three sons. Her husband is a mechanic. She has a small grocery store.

The first loan she received was 300 Nuevos Soles (about $90 USD), with which she bought articles for her shop such as one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, six boxes of soda, candies and two boxes of mineral water. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles (about $325 USD) she would buy a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, ten boxes of sodas in disposable bottles, two boxes of mineral water, a variety of sausages, two boxes of yogurt and a box of large bottles of milk.

She is a faithful client of Manuela Ramos, is thankful for the ability to move forward in her business, and knows that she will continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables for her store: a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, ten boxes of sodas in disposable bottles, two boxes of mineral water, a variety of sausages, two boxes of yogurt and a box of large bottles of milk.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L., 73, is married with three children. She has two years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the villagers and the public seven days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala ($150). SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She has working kids who help out with the family needs and back up the business.

loans.use: Restock the business

loans.name: Sheyi

texts.en: Sheyi A. is 50 years old and married with four children. Sheyi lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, foodstuffs and tailoring materials and has been in this business for years. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Thuỷ Lê (1426050990) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Thuỷ owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Thuỷ has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Thuỷ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Thuỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Thuỷ is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Thuỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Amanecer se conformó en el mes de agosto del 2008, por la iniciativa de la señora Basilisa A., cuya función en el grupo es la presidencia. La misma viendo las necesidades de sus vecinas y amigas se interesó por el programa y convocó a una reunión con la respectiva asesora de la Fundación Paraguaya.

Después de dicha reunión todas muy motivadas decidieron conformar un comité, el cual hasta hoy día ha cumplido en forma excelente sus pagos.

La mayoría de las integrantes se dedican a actividades comerciales como: venta de mercerías, comidas, ropas, frutas y verduras, etc.

Todas las integrantes del grupo manifiestan su contento ya que gracias a esta oportunidad sus ingresos han aumentado y de esta manera han proporcionado una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Valoran la oportunidad de obtener un crédito con accesibilidad rápida ya que para ellas es muy fundamental contar con capital de trabajo, por dicho motivo se sienten muy comprometidas y activan dentro del comité fomentando la solidaridad, la unión y comprensión.

Basilisa A.	- Venta de comidas - 
María Angela B.	- Venta de mercería - 
María Evergista B. - 	Venta de mercería - 
Fermina C. - 	Venta de comidas - 
Benigna A. - 	Venta de comidas - 
Felicita Pavón - 	Venta de ropas - 
Clara B. - 	Venta de ropas - 
Elva A. - 	Venta de verduras - 
Norma D. - 	Despensa - 
Carmen D. - 	Venta de ropas - 
María Benita Benítez - 	Venta de mercerias - 
Pabla A.	- Venta de comidas - 
Andrea M. -	Venta de mercería - 
Sofia E. - 	Venta de frutas - 
Perla López - 	Venta de ropas -
texts.en:
The Amanecer Group was formed in august of 2008 and was founded by Señora Basilisa A., who acts as the group's president. Basilisa saw that her friends and neighbours needed some financial help and became interested in the credit offered by Fundación Paraguaya after meeting with one of their administrators. After that meeting, the members of Amanecer founded their group and have always been extremely responsible with their payments. Amanacer's members have small businesses. Basilisa A., Pabla A., Fermina C., and Benigna A. sell meals; Andrea M., María Angela B., María Evergista B., and María Benita Benítez sell household goods and hardware supplies; Felicita Pavón, Clara B., Carmen D., and Perla López sell clothing; Elva A. sells vegetables; Sofia E. sells fruit; and Norma D. runs a corner store. All of the group's members are very happy that, thanks to this opportunity, their incomes have risen and they have been able to better their children's quality of life. Having easy access to credit and working capital has made a huge difference for the group, and because they value this, they are very committed to communal banking. They work in solidarity with one another as a team and work to understand and support one another.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes, vegetables, household goods, hardware supplies etc.

loans.name: Andrea De Jesus

texts.es: Andrea de Jesús S. M. tiene35 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes, y necesitan de ella para sustentarse. Andrea se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva. ya que ella inicio con un pequeño negocio de cosméticos, y luego de intentar mejorar sus ingresos decidió vender ropa y hacer clientela de manera ambulante visitando los barrios y repartos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Ella ya ha trabajado con financiamientos de Fundación León 2000 los que han sido oportunos para la mejora de su negocio. El propósito de Andrea, una vez aprobado este préstamo es, invertir en su capital de trabajo de manera que le permita comprar más ropa para vender y por lo consiguiente mejorar su vivienda ya que necesita repararla. Su deseo es tener una tienda propia en su casa que le permita estar al cuidado de sus hijos y su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea de Jesús S. M., 35, is single and the mother of two dependent children who go to school. Andrea sells new clothes. She started with a small cosmetic business. Later, with the intention of improving her income, she decided to sell clothes in a traveling fashion by visiting the neighborhoods and suburbs of Chinandega. She has worked with loans from Fundación León 2000, and they have given her the opportunity to improve her business. Once this loan is approved, Andrea will buy more clothes to sell. Then she will improve her house since it needs repairs. Her wish is to have her own store in her house. This would permit her to take care of her children and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Seiha

texts.en:
Mrs. Seiha M. is a 49 year old widow with two sons and two daughters. Her two sons have had full-time employment as drivers in a company in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, for two years. Her daughters attend school. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Seiha has been selling food in her village for five years. She is able to earn a gross daily profit of about $2.50. Her old house is broken in some parts and it’s difficult for family members to stay. She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia M. D. D. resiD. en Santa Tecla en el departamento D. La Libertad. Maria vive en casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor y sus tres hijos Aarón D. 10 años D. edad, Josué D. 8 años D. edad y José D. un año D. edad. Maria tiene un negocio D. venta D. medicina popular que no requiere D. prescripción médica, el negocio D. Maria está ubicado en buena zona ya que se encuentra en el mercado Dueñas D. Santa Tecla un lugar muy transitado, las ventas D. los productos D. Maria son en efectivo y sus ventas son diarias, Maria solicita este crédito para compra D. medicinas que le hacen falta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia Mejia D. D. lives in Santa Tecla in the state of La Libertad. Maria lives in her own house with her husband Victor and her three children: Aaron, ten years old, Josue, eight years old and Jose, one year old. Maria sells common medicines that don’t require a doctor’s prescription. Maria’s business is located in a good area. You will find it in the market called “Caretakers of Saint Tescla”, a very active place. Maria only sells her products for cash and the sales are daily. Maria is looking for a loan in order to buy medicine that she doesn’t offer currently in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 34 años, 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio de venta de ropa y nos cuenta que le va muy bien es así que logro ahorrar su dinero que le permitió comprar  mas ropa variada, ya que tiene como meta implementar su negocio con ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, a su edad el trabajo que realiza no le causa mucha molestia, y esta muy tranquila con lo que hace. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada,  en el barrio ya es muy conocida y es la única que cuenta en el barrio  con este tipo de negocio  y esto le da mayores ventajas para sus ventas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará ropas como pantalones, polos, vestidos y blusas. Con parte del dinero también comprará una vitrina, donde le servirá para exhibir su mercadería de ropas.

Se siente muy contenta, tiene fuerzas aun para seguir adelante, y esto; hasta que Dios lo permita, se esta asegurando una vejes tranquila; por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the "Mujeres del Futuro" (Women of the Future) community bank in the district of Bellavista, San Martín department. She is 34 years old, widowed, and has 3 dependent children that are in school. For years she has worked selling clothes. She tells us that she has been doing well, thus she has been able to save money that allowed her to buy a greater variety of clothing, since her goal is to stock her business with clothes for women, men and children. At her age, Rosario's work doesn't cause her much trouble and she is very contented with what she does. Currently she is continuing the same business and has a loyal customer base; she is already very well known in her neighborhood. Rosario is the only one in her neighborhood with this type of business and this gives her an advantage in sales. With this loan of 800 PEN, she will buy clothing such as pants, polos, dresses and blouses. With part of the money she will also buy a display case, where she will exhibit her merchandise. She feels very content, she still has the energy to continue to advance her business and this, godwilling, assures her security in her old age. For this she recognizes the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos, helping her and other women in the region of San Martín.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing such as pants, polos, dresses and blouses

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A., who received no formal education, is divorced and has three children. A fish seller in Elmina since 2001, she uses her income to pay for school fees and other bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more fish for resale, and with the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save money and educate her children.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 41 years old and married with two children, has been selling medicine for many years. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M., 57 years old, is a basic storeowner.  She sells snacks item, rice, sardines, canned goods, and other basic needs of the people living in their village. She started selling since 2008. And aside from store, she also own a farm, which is 1-hectare in size that she keeps productive to be able to support the growing needs in their family. She has one child that is 20 years old now. Her dreams for her child is are able to graduate in college and pursue a high paying job. She also wished that her child would grow as a responsible person in the future.

She needs a loan of Php 15,000 to finance her business. She will buy additional merchandise to attract more customers and maximize her sales. She is hopeful that she will reap a good return of all her investments.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Donny

texts.es:
Nuestro socio se llama Donny, el pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza, el vive en la urb. Santa Beatriz D-4, en la cuidad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 27 años de edad el es soltero, y trabaja como empleado de la empresa Limagas, el maneja la pequeña camioneta de la empresa para poder así repartir a las diferentes casas que hacen el pedido de gas, el trabaja como chofer y repartidor de gas, el solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en un proyecto propio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Nuestro socio se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: building a shed and buying machinery

loans.name: Kiganda 4 Nakafero Robinah Group

texts.en:
N. Robinah is a cashier of her group loan. She is single and blessed with two children. She owns a dry-cleaning business and bakes chapatti (flat, unleavened bread) for sale. She is requesting a loan to purchase items to use in her dry-cleaning business and to pay those who help her wash, iron and maintain the clothes. 

She has stayed in her business of dry cleaning for 13 years so far. She is a hardworking businesswoman of 42. She is hoping for improvement in her business and in the well-being of her family. More so, her dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house of her own.

loans.use: To purchase items for her dry-cleaning business and to pay those who help her wash, iron and maintain the clothes

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Though Mirabel is married and has two children, she is not living with her husband under the same roof. She lives in Mile 2 Nkwen, Cameroon, with her entire family, in a house with 5 rooms.

Mirabel has had to overcome some challenges in life, including ill health and the death of her father. Since she has been separated from her husband, she has had to take care of her children and pay their school fees alone.

She sells food and drink. She plans to use this loan to buy drinks, crates, pots, dishes, groundnuts, and plantains.

This will be Mirabel's fifth time receiving a loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2003 and has been quite successful in the past with her business due to its location and her reasonable prices. Also, due to her experience, she is now having good profits from her business.

Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family, and provide good medication for them whenever they are sick. She will invest the rest back into her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying drinks, crates, pots, dishes, groundnuts, and plantains

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is 30 years old and is in the business of selling electrical goods in Mombasa's Kongowea market. He is married and has a daughter, Mercy. The family lives in Magongo in Mombasa.

Joseph was introduced to KADET by a friend recently and is now accessing his first loan from the lending institution to boost his business. He plans to buy radios and other electrical goods for sale at the Kongowea stalls. 

He hopes to grow into a leading supplier of electrical goods in Mombasa town in the future.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy radios and other electrical goods

loans.name: Wilber Fernando

texts.es: El señor Wilber Fernando E. G. tiene 28 años de edad habita en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa labora con él, cómo su asistente, tiene un negocio el cual es una Óptica ambulante y tienen dos hijos entre las edades de 12 y 6 años el mayor estudia la escuela secundaria y el menor la escuela primaria, tiene la firme visión de poder terminar de construir su hogar el cual se encuentra con un 50% de adelanto, pero para poder realizar esto, solicitó un préstamo para invertir nuevamente en su negocio en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de lentes bifocales, que es la mayor demanda de productos que tiene en la actualidad, esta inversión le generaría mayores utilidades, que le apoyarían en gran medida a poder terminar de construir su hogar  y brindarle a sus hijos y su esposa un espacio más cómodo y seguro.
texts.en:
Señor Wilber Fernando E. G. is 28 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He is married and his wife works with him as his assistant. He has a business selling eyeglasses in the street. He and his wife have two children between the ages of 6 and 12 years; the eldest studies in the secondary school and the younger one is in primary school. He is requesting this loan to invest in his business; he will buy raw materials used in the production of bifocal lenses, which is the product that is currently most in demand. This investment will generate higher profits, which will support him to a great extent in his efforts to finish construction on his house, so that he can provide his children and wife with a space that is more comfortable and secure.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to use in making bifocal lenses

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma V. is a rice grower and a mother of one child. Her child is only 11 years old. As a mother, she wants to provide her child with a good education and a bright future. Her farm is what she earns income from to buy her family adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy all the needed farm supplies to grow her crops well. With her loan, she could expect better harvest in the farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Phal Kung Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Doun Pheu village in the Takeo province. These members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phal K. is the group leader. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

Mrs. Phal K. and her husband, Mr. Sdeung Chhorm, are farmers who breed ducks. They can make a small income. Currently, Mrs. Phal K. needs some money buy fertilizers to support her farming crop and to buy ducklings and duck food for her second business. Thus, Mrs. Phal K. decided to ask for a loan to buy these items.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to support her farming crop and buy ducklings and duck food for her second business

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es:
Jovanna es una joven de 25 años que vive en la casa de sus padres. 
Hace dos años decidió ser independiente económicamente forjando su propio negocio de venta de comida en su restaurante. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su madre en la atención de los clientes, todos los días incluyendo los domingos.
Jovanna tiene muy buena sazón por lo que cada día sus comensales disfrutan de comidas deliciosas y sanas. Para ello, cada mañana se abastece de los ingredientes necesarios para las comidas y una vez terminadas sus ventas lava los platos y demás utensilios, dejando todo listo para la siguiente jornada.
Aunque el trabajo es agotador, para Jovanna es un gran disfrute tener su propio negocio, esta es la razón por la que mira al futuro con gran entusiasmo.

Esta es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal, así como puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes y en la mejora de su restaurante renovando los manteles de sus mesas y otros utensilios.
texts.en:
Jovanna is a young woman of 25 who lives in her parents house. Two years ago, she decided to become economically independent forming her own business, selling food in her restaurant. She depends on the help of her mother in attending to clients. Jovanna has good taste because everday her customers enjoy her tasty and healthy food. For this, every morning she supplies the necessary ingredients for the food and once finished with her sales, cleans the plates and utensils, leaving everything ready for the next day. Although the job is exhasting, for Jovanna it is enjoyable to have her own business. For this reason she looks at the future with much enthusiasm.

This is the fourth time that she has had credit with MFP. She is one of the most active clients in the communal bank as she is punctual in her payments. The money she is now soliciting, she will use in the purchase of ingredients and in the the improvement of her restaurant, changing her table cloths and other utensils.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food consumibles and utensils for the resaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beans, maize and rice in bulk

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José, tiene 49 años y tiene dos hijos (José de 21 años y Karen de 11 años).  José es periodista y trabaja en una radio local llamada Santa Mónica por horas, ya son 20 años que se dedica al periodismo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que a parte de ser periodista se dedica al mantenimiento de inmuebles, él trabaja con varios empleados en obras que le contratan, por ejemplo ellos hacen enchapados de mayólicas, refacción de paredes, etc. José requiere el préstamo para pagar los sueltos de sus empleados porque José tiene un contrato para realizar una obra pero los dueños de la obra pagaran al finalizar la obra. 
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Pucyura es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
José, 49, has two children (José, 21 and Karen, 11). José is a journalist and works hours at a local radio station called, Santa Mónica. He has been a journalist for 20 years. He is a hard-working father who, besides being a jounalist, also provides building maintenance services.
