He has several employees and they are hired to do jobs like: applying veneers, wall repairs, etc. José needs financing to pay his employees because he has a work order pending but he won't get paid for it until it is completed. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (Pucyura is a district of the city of Anta, Cusco department and is located 40 minutes away from the city of Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay employee salaries.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya R. A. is 30 years old. To earn a living, she buys chicken in bulk at a reasonable price and then slaughters and sells the birds. She hA. a solid  financial partner in her husband, who is a military policeman. Ya R. A. hA. two school-aged children who are dependent on her income. For a long time, Ya R. A. hired a taxi to deliver her chicken to market. She is requesting a loan to purchase a used car so she can supply the transportation in her business and also reduce her costs. Any remaining money from the loan will buy more chicken for her customers. (Ya R. A. wA. not available for taking a photo so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a used car to transport chicken to market

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., age 68, is widowed and resides with her child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country.

S. rents part of her house to workers of a local garment factory for an income of about USD 2.50 per day. Her daughter is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair the house she rents. She would like to use any additional profit to purchase the neighboring house to rent to more workers.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house she rents

loans.name: Marilin Geraldine

texts.es: Marilin Geraldine R. D. L. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una fábrica textil, y junto a su hijo el cual se dedica a estudiar educación básica. Marilin posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa productos lácteos como queso, crema, y otros más. Su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa D. habitación, la cual esta ubicada sobre la calle principal, un lugar muy estratégico para ella, ya que todos los día hay una gran afluencia D. personas, las cuales consumen su producto. Marilin solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. queso en diferentes tipos D. este, así mismo más crema y requesón. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora quien siempre esta en vistas D. algo mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Marilin Geraldine R. D. L. is 29 years old and resides in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works in a textile factory, and her son, who attends elementary school. Marilin has her own business selling dairy products such as cheese, cream, and others. Her business is in her home, which is located on the town's main street. This is a very strategic location for her, since every day large numbers of people pass by and buy her products. Marilin is requesting a loan which she will use to stock her business, buying a larger quantity of cheeses of various types, as well as more cream and curds. Marilin is a very responsible woman who is always in search of something better for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her business with dairy products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu D. is from the village of Romarate, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Marichu is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing photocopying and encoding services in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marichu joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marichu from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Madame Sanata D. est âgée de  56 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Hamdallaye  de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  
Madame  Sanata n’a pas fréquenté l’école, elle fut victime de l’époque où les filles n’avaient pas la possibilité d’aller à l’école, alors  elle s’intéressa à l’activité génératrice de revenus que sa mère menait à savoir la transformation des noix de néré en Sounbala.  Elle exerce cette activité pour elle-même depuis maintenant 30 ans. 
Au Mali, le Sounbala est l’un des condiments alimentaires le plus important et très prisé par les femmes et vu la qualité  de ses productions, cette activité lui procure assez de bénéfices car elle peut vendre plus de 5 gros paniers dans la semaine.  
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, Madame Sanata a sollicité la collaboration de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans. Après  8 prêts solidaires et deux prêts individuels, tous  remboursés  correctement, elle est à son 3e  prêt  individuel qu’elle  compte utiliser pour acheter, 10 sacs de noix de néré  auprès des commerçant spécialisés dans le stockage de céréales de Koutiala. Elle vend à Bamako et à Kati  à une clientèle composée essentiellement   de femmes,  au comptant.  
Sanata compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sanata D. is 56 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She lives with her husband and children in the Hardallaye neighborhood in the city of Koutiala, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Mrs. D. did not attend school. She fell victim of that period when girls did not have the opportunity to attend school. She was taught by her mothe, becoming interested in eaning income by transforming nere seeds into Sounbala, a local West African spice. She has been practicing this business for thirty years. In Mali sounbala is one of the more important basic food condiments and well prized by women. Because of the high quality of her production, this business grown to a point where she sells more than 5 large baskets of product each week. To increase her operating capital, Mrs Sanata has been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance group for five years. After duly repaying 8 group and 2 personal loans, she plans to use her 3rd personal loan to buy; 10 sacs of nere nuts from the specilized cereal sellers in Koutiala. She sells to a clientele made up predominantly of women for cash, in the cities of Barnako and Kati. Sanata expects to earn a monthly income of 85,000 francs CFA, which she plans to use to repay her loan to Soro Yiriwaso and contribute to improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of nere nuts

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan with her husband and four children. Vehari is near Multan, a city of shrines. One of Rani's sons is a rickshaw driver and another is a security guard. Her husband is a retired government official and Rani does embroidery to share the financial burden of her family. Her children couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints so they had to work. 

Rani has applied for a loan from Asasah for her son who wants to buy his own rickshaw. A new rickshaw will not only help him avoid paying the cost of vehicle rent but he will also able to do his work more efficiently. 

Rani hopes that a new rickshaw will bring in more income for her family and she will be able to send her younger ones, who still couldn’t start their education, to school.

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw for her son

loans.name: Mr. Mon Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who are villagers in KO. Chreae village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Mon M., who was born in 1974, is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Aside from farming he is also a fisherman, while his wife, Mrs. SaR. Sum, is a seamstress in a garment factory and she is also a pig breeder. 

Now this couple has some problems because their field is far away from aN. irrigation system. Also, their fishing boat is broken. So to solve these problems, Mr. Mon M. is applying for a loan to buy a pump machine, and rest of the loan will be used to buy food for the pigs and resin to mend his fishing boat. 

Mr. Mon M. is the father of three children who all are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine, pig food and resin for his boat

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Lay Ear Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nine people are made up a village bank loan in which located in Sdok Prei village, Takeo province. Mrs. Kim Lay E. is a village bank president who is 28-yE.-old, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways. She is a food seller at Tameou Mountain where she is able to earn some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Boeurn Bing, is a grass chopper. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve her face business, Mrs. Kim Lay E. is asking for a loan to buy chicken, drinks to resale. She is a mother of a child who is six years old.

loans.use: To buy chicken, drinks to resale

loans.name: Izzatulo

texts.en:
Izzatulo K. is a young guy who likes to make his own way. He has run a clothing business for more than 5 years, which is how Izzatulo supports his family. Little by little and with hard work his business has expanded. Still, Izzatulo wants his business to grow even more. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $1,500 USD that he will spend to buy more merchandise. This way he will have new products to offer to his customers. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.en:
Maria Erlinda A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 46 years old. Maria Erlinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Erlinda owns & operates a farm. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maria Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years. She also runs a small sari-sari (general) store that she hopes to grow as well.

Maria Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Maria Erlinda is requesting a loan of 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria Erlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Celina C. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha Provincia de Maputo, viúva e mãe de 5 filhos de 21 aos 36 anos somente dois vão a Escola. Fez 3ª classe não concluiu devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e responsabiliza se pelos seus bisnetos que vivem com ela em sua casa.


Após seu casamento obteve 5 filhos com seu esposo, mas este perde a vida e anos depos ela recebe uma indeminização proveniente do serviço do seu falecido esposo e então inicia o seu próprio negócio. E negociante a mais de 15 anos vende vestuarios e cobertores gastando uma média de 10.000.00mt em cada viagem, conta com ajuda sua filha que lhe ajuda nos negócios e tem de lucro 6.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e poupa algum em sua conta bancaria.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Celina na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar roupa diversa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os anteriores no valor de (7.000.00, 15.000.00 e 15.000.00)mt foram usados para a mesma finalidade. 

Tem como objetivo para o futuro construir um salão de beleza e butique e deixar de vender somente por encomendas.
texts.en:
Celina was born in the Namaacha District, in the Maputo Province. She is a widow and mother of five children ranging in age from 21 to 36 years. Only two of them go to school. She completed 3rd grade but didn't finish school due to a teenage pregnancy. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her great grandchildren who live with her. During her marriage she had 5 children with her husband. He passed away and years later she received compensation from his job and started her own business. She has been in business for more than 15 years selling clothing and blankets. She spends around 10,000 meticais per trip and is helped by her daughter. She has an income of 6,000 meticais which is spent with household expenses. She saves some money in her bank account. This is Celina's fourth loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. It is for 20,000 and she intends to purchase assorted clothing to increase her inventory. The previous loans (for 7,000, 15,000 and 15,000 meticais) were used for the same goal. Her goal for the future is to build a beauty salon and a boutique and to stop only selling through pre-orders.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of assorted clothing

loans.name: Chhe

texts.en:
Chhe N., 51, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. N. sells food for an income of USD 3 per day.  Her children, employed at different workplaces earn an income of about 2 each to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 58 on food and USD 5 on electricity supply. 

 N. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more supplies to improve the food selling business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. N. is the older woman in the photograph with her daughter and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to improve the food selling business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene M. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Arlene is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene raises livestock for sale, primarily chickens. Arlene has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Pablo David

texts.es: Pablo tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, es es el sustento de su familia, se inició en este negocio hace ya 6 años, ahora ya cuenta con una mototaxi propia la cual adquirió con mucho esfuerzo producto de sus ahorros de trabajo, el sueña con adquirir más mototaxis y asi poder mejora la calidad de vida de su familia, solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y buena capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Pablo is 32 years old, single, and lives in his parent's home.  He supports the family.  He started out in this business 6 years ago, and now he has his own mototaxi (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) which he acquired with a lot of effort with money he saved from working.  He dreams of buying more mototaxis, so that he could improve the quality of life of his family.  He requests a loan to do maintenance work on his mototaxi.  He is being provided with this loan because he has good personal references and the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his mototaxi

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.es:
Doña Altagracia, resiD. en el Cantón Pedernal, del municipio D. Chilanga, posee un comedor, tiene 47 años D. edad y vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, Digna es la mayor D. 23 años D. edad y es la que le ayuda en el negocio y su otro hijo René que actualmente estudia 7° grado en la escuela; la fuente D. ingreso D. esta familia es el comedor.
La señora Altagracia tiene más D. 10 años D. trabajar con comida y tiene su comedorcito en el mercado municipal D. San Francisco Gotera,  atendiéndolo desD. muy temprano hasta horas D. la tarD., las dificultades D. ella es que en ocasiones se queda sin dinero para comprar alimentos para preparar las comidas, este motivo le lleva a solicitar un préstamo y contar D. esta manera con una fuente que le permita comprar D. aquellos productos que pueden durar más en la cocina y los que le son mayormente demandados.
La señora sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles los estudios  necesarios para la superación D. estos y así mismo quiere atender las demandas D. su hogar mejorando su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Altagracia resides in Pedernal Canton, which is part of the township of Chilanga. She owns a diner. Altagracia is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Digna, her older child, is 23 years old and helps with the business. Her other child, René, is currently a seventh graD. student. The diner serves as a source of income for her family.

Sra. Altagracia has been preparing food for more than ten years and set up her small diner at the municipal market of San Francisco Gotera. She manages it from the early morning hours until the afternoon. On occasion she has run out of money needed to buy food for preparing her dishes. This motivated her to apply for a loan so that she could have the means to buy products that would make her kitchen inventory last longer and are in great demand.

Sra. Altagracia dreams of moving her children forward by providing the necessary education to help them succeed. She also wants to meet the demands of her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Mgombolwa Group

texts.en:
Grace M. is in her late thirties and is married with four children. Grace has been running her own fruit and vegetable stall since 2005. Grace starts working at 4:00 am when she goes down to the market to buy her goods, she then sells them until 7:00 pm in the afternoon. The business earns Grace a low monthly profit.

This will be Grace's fourth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Grace used her previous loans to improve her stall and increase her business. She also used parts of the loans to buy bricks to construct a new house. These loans were all successfully repaid. With this loan, Grace aims to increase her business as well buy more bricks for the construction of her new house. Grace's dream is to finish her house and keep improving her business.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group Mgombolwa, which has 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Grace can be seen in front row, first on the left and wearing pink.

loans.use: Increase business and to buy more bricks to construct a home.

loans.name: Luis Walberto

texts.es: Luis Walberto N. S. de 36 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada al bienestar de su hogar. Vive junto a una hermana y un sobrino, en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Luis posee una venta de productos plásticos como canastas, masetas en diferentes tamaños, recipientes para colocar comida, recipientes grandes para colocar agua los cuales en El Salvador son llamados “guacales”, así mismo comercializa hoyas y cacerolas. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de San Martín, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes. Es por esto que Luis desea poder aumentar sus productos, ya que las ganancias de este negocio son las que le permiten contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos plásticos y así mismo más cacerolas.
texts.en:
Luis Walberto N. S. is 36 years old and a hardworking individual who is dedicated to the welfare of his household. He lives with a sister and a nephew in San Martín, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. Luis has a store where he sells plastic products such as crates, flowerpots in different sizes, food storage containers, and large water receptacles called “guacales” in El Salvador. He also sells pots and pans. His business is located at the municipal market in San Martín, a place where there are many customers. For this reason, Luis wants to increase his inventory of products. The profits from this business provide him with everything he needs to have a decent life.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a large quantity of plastic goods as well as more pans.

loans.use: Purchase plastic goods & pans to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable  trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 hijos menores y lo que más desea en la vida es brindarles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Marcelina en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de cacao, café y hojas de coca, ya que es muy buena su calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden afectar su producción. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas para mejorar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 38 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her five dependent children.  What she wants most in life is to provide her children with a good education and a better quality of life.  The hard work which Marcelina does on her farm has meant that her crops are very well cared for and, on the day she sells them, they sell quickly.

Marcelina's main source of income is selling very good quality cacao, coffee and coca leaves.  What she most likes about her work is harvesting her land since then she feels that her work is bearing fruit.  She has been in this business for 18 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be protecting her crops from insect infestations that can damage her production.

Over time, Marcelina would like to acquire more land so that she can grow more crops.  This is her second loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her loan repayments and has never had any problems with her community bank where she is in charge of providing the good cheer that keeps the other members very happy.  She plans to use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more manure and insecticides to improve her plantations.

loans.use: To buy more manure and insecticides

loans.name: Soung's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members and they are located in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. This group loan selected, Mr. Soung T., 50 years old, as the group leader. While each member of this village will use their portions of this village to support their different purpose.  

Mr. Soung T. is a fisherman where he can earn a little income to support the family. With this business, he doesn’t have a fishing boat for supporting his business. So, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat for fishing. His wife, Mr. Phim Doeuk, 50 years old, earns her living through selling Khmer cake seller in the local market. 

This couple has seven children: two of whom are laborers and four are attending the local school while the youngest one is 4 years old and is not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for fishing.

loans.name: Elsa Patricia

texts.es: Elsa Patricia P. O., tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, y reside en el barrio San Antonio en el municipio de La Paz. Ella comenzò su negocio a raiz de que su esposo la abandono y para criar a sus hijos necesitaba una fuente de ingresos y como en el pueblo no hay empresas donde solicitar un empleo, se le ocurrio que podia comprar ropa de segunda mano y poner un pequeña venta en su domicilio.  Ademas de eso, hace dos años Elsa tiene una venta de comida en la escuela local. Sus hijos ya no representan una carga economica para ella pues trabajan pero si les ayuda con sus nietos porque los ama mucho. Elsa solicita el prestamo para comprar dos fardos de ropa de segunda mano para revenderla y uno maniquis para poder exhibirla. Con el apoyo del prestamo su vida cambiara de manera positiva porque mantendra su entrada de dinero y podra seguir sosteniendo su hogar. Su meta es poder expandir su negocio a otras comunidades cercanas y que su familia este mas unida. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera poder cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Elsa Patricia P. O., age 45, is the single mother of two children. She lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of the municipality of La Paz. She started her business because her husband abandoned her, and she needed a source of income to raise her children. Since there are no companies in her village where she could look for a job, it occurred to her that she could buy secondhand clothing and set up a small shop in her home. In addition to this, for the past two years, Elsa has operated a food stand in the local school. Her children are longer an economic burden for her, since they are now working, but she helps them with her grandchildren because she loves them very much. Elsa is requesting the loan to buy two bales of secondhand clothing to resell, as well as some mannequins to display the clothing. With the help of the loan, her life will change in a positive way, because she will maintain her source of income and continue to support her household. Her goals are to expand her business to other nearby communities, and also to see her family more united. This is her first loan cycle with FAMA, and she plans to make her payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: Buying two bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.es:
Don Ladislao S. G., es trabajador de una empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado desempeñando el cargo de Agente de Seguridad Interna desde hace 2 años.

Es Acompañado de 53 años de edad, tiene 8 personas a su cargo de las cuales cuatro son menores de edad, que estudian todavía. Vive en el Departamento de Managua, Municipio de Tipitapa desde hace 25 años.

Este es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL lo solicita para mejora de vivienda, está muy agradecido con CEPRODEL POR brindarle la oportunidad de ir mejorando de forma progresiva su casamediante préstamo.
texts.en:
Don Ladislao S. G. works for a water and sewage company, where he is an internal security agent. He has had this job for 2 years.

He is 53, is married, and is responsible for eight people, of whom four are minors who are still in school. He has lived in the municipality of Tipitapa, in the department of Managua, for 25 years.

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He is applying for it to improve his home. He is very grateful to CEPRODEL for offering him the opportunity improve and modernize his home through this loan.

loans.use: Improve his home.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar, age 41, has worked as a taxi driver since 1995. He and his wife have three children. Haydar works hard to provide for his family and to keep his car in good shape in order to keep his business moving ahead. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua so as to do necessary maintenance on his car. He also plans to buy a new television and a washing machine for his family, since those he has are currently inoperable. 

Haydar has a good reputation, and he sometimes receives requests for transportation across the country. Such long-distance requests benefit his family's income greatly, and he considers these trips a source of unexpected extra income that is helpful in bad times. He hopes to expand his business by buying an additionA. car.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance repairs on his taxi vehicle

loans.name: Vany Manuel

texts.es: Vany Manuel se dedica a la venta de pescado. Tiene más de 21 años en su negocio,  la experiencia que ha obtenido ha sido muy satisfactoria. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y a pesar de las dificultades que ha atravesado ha salido adelante, ya que algunas veces no vende, pero el siempre tiene que buscar el alimento diario para ofrecerlo a su familia. Siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable y que disfruta de realizar su trabajo. El financiamiento es para la compra de de un motor para su lancha y así buscar los productos que el vende.
texts.en:
Vany Manuel sells fish and has been in this business for more than 21 years. The experience he has gained has been satisfactory. Vany Manuel has five dependent children. He has faced difficulties that impede his ability to move forward, such as a few occasions when he was not able to sell. However, he always finds ways to feed his family every day. Vany Manuel has always been a responsible gentleman who enjoys his work.

This loan will be used to buy a motor for his boat so that he can catch the fish that he sells.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase a motor for his fishing boat

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Morropon en Piura, a unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace 3 años, se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Antonio es muy conocido en su comunidad y tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir sacando adelante a su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. Antonio es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones anteriores en una manera puntual.
texts.en: Antonio is 55 years old, married and the father of three children. They live in their own house in the city of Morropón in the region of Piura, some four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. He has provided transportation services for the past three years. He transports people in his motor taxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a cabin for the passengers. Antonio is well known in his community and in high demand from his customers. He wants to use the loan to service and repair his motor taxi. He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition to be able to keep on providing a good service to his customers. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his earnings and his family to progress. Therefore he thought it was appropriate to come to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and apply for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles. Antonio is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa; he met his previous obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to service and repair his motor taxi

loans.name: Dionicio Roberth

texts.es:
Dionicio M. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, vive en Viloma Grande ubicado en la localidad de Vinto de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él vive con sus padres  y comparte todo lo que tiene con su familia. Dionicio es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, debido a las circunstancias que le toco vivir tuvo que buscar trabajo desde joven para que pueda ayudar a su familia. La mayor parte de su tiempo la dedica a prestar su servicio como albañil, también trabaja dentro de su familia en la cría de chanchos y la alimentación del ganado lechero para la extracción de leche. 

Dionicio quiere el préstamo para comprar conejos cobayos y de esta manera pueda criarlos e incrementar los ingresos de su familia. Dionicio está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de dedicarse a la cría de conejos cobayos y así  pueda mejorar su nivel de vida.

Dionicio entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que haga crecer la pequeña granja familiar que tienen.
texts.en:
Dionicio M. is a 22-year-old single man with no children. He lives in Viloma Grande, located in the Vinto area of the city of Cochabamba. He lives with his parents and shares all that he has with his family. Dionicio is a hardworking and responsible person who, due to his life circumstances, he had to start working at a young age to help out his family. Most of the time, he works as a bricklayer. He also works with his family raising pigs and feeding dairy cows for milk extraction.

Dionicio wants to use this loan to purchase guinea pigs so that he can raise them and increase the household income. Dionicio is very grateful with the Kiva lenders because he now has the opportunity to raise guinea pigs and improve his standard of living.

Dionicio would like to request a new loan in the future so that he can expand the small family farm.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam N. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Zam has a business selling eggs at a wholesale price, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more trays of eggs for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zam hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Zam hopes to own another business.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Lucerito De Jose Galvez Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal Lucerito D. José Gálvez con mas D. 5 años participando con el programa prosperidad tiene como integrante fundadora a Isabel, mujer luchadora que a sus 57 años venD. Comida tradicional e infaltable  como Anticuchos y picarones desD. hace siete años según nos manifiesta.  Actualmente es soltera y durante su vida ha apoyado a sus 02 hijos que ahora son independientes. Isabel ha logrado además construir la primera planta D. su vivienda pero su sueño es seguir  mejorando el segundo nivel pues con ello obtendría  otros ingresos. Isabel desea  alquilar algunas habitaciones. El reciente préstamo será utilizado en la compra D. una nueva carreta  D. fierro para la venta D. sus anticuchos. La alcancía Comunal Lucerito D. José Gálvez tiene 10 integrantes y se llaman así por la que se juntaron residentes D. la avenida que tiene el mismo nombre. Los integrantes D. la ALCOM son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos mes a mes
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Lucerito D. José Gálvez” has participated in the Prosperity Program for more than five years. One of the founding members is Isabel, a determined woman who is 57 years old and sells grilled meats and fritters. She says that she has been in this business for seven years. Isabel is currently single and throughout her life she has supported two children who are now independent. She has managed to build the first floor of her home, but her dream is to continue making improvements and add a second floor so that she can earn additional income. Isabel wants to make rooms available for rent. This new loan will be used to buy a metal food cart for selling grilled meats.

The Lucerito D. José Gálvez Communal Bank has ten members and is named after the avenue on which they live. All of them are responsible and prompt with their monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase a metal food cart for selling grilled meats.

loans.name: Rosa Lelia

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre D. familia D. 42 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, el cual cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. a unos 40 minutos del departamento D. Piura.  Este distrito es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza, engorD. y comercialización D. animales (chanchos y ovejas), desD. hace varios años, su corral lo tiene en la parte D. posterior D. su casa. A sus animales los alimenta con comida  balanceada y una vez que llegan a su desarrollo óptimo los venD. en el mercado D. su distrito  y a otros comerciantes que no son D. la zona.

A solicitado un crédito Rosa a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar  alimentos balanceados para criarlos, engordarlos y luego venderlos con la finalidad D. tener mejores ingresos para poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  Rosa es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad por sus ansias D. superación y elquerer brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of a family, 42 years old, and she lives in a house of her own together with her husband and children. It is equipped with water and electricity and it is located in the district of TambogranD., about 40 minutes from the department of Piura. This district is known for its agriculture, farming, and artisans.

Rosa has been raising livestock to fatten and to resell (pigs and sheep) for many years. Her corral is located in the rear section of her property. She feeds balanced feed to her animals and when they have reached an optimum level of development she sells them at the market in her district and to other merchants from outsiD. the region. 

Rosa requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to raise, fatten, and resell her livestock. Her goal is to have a better income, to be able to repay the loan granted to her and to improve her family's quality of life. Rosa is a very well known person in her community, for her goals for improvement and for wanting to proviD. her children with better opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja y su hija en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 4 años que ofrece el servicio de transporte, para ello cuenta con una  movilidad que alquiló, de esa manera trabaja independientemente, recorriendo las calles de su ciudad  en busca de pasajeros. Sabe que este trabajo tiene sus riesgos, como ser victima de asaltos y accidentes, por lo que últimamente se ha dado en su localidad. Sin embargo tiene sus recompensa el sacrificio, ya que percibe un ingreso considerable que le ayuda a sostener a su familia. Generalmente su horario de trabajo es todo el día y descansa por las noches.  Considera que esta actividad es rentable porque es un servicio muy requerido y demandado por lo que  desea tener mas adelante su propia movilidad. Este será su crédito número 19 con MFP, y espera ser cumplida en sus pagos. Además le agrada ser integrante de su banco comunal porque su grupo se mantiene unido  por varios años  y le han enseñado a ser responsable en sus cuentas. Se muestra agradecido por el apoyo financiero en anteriores veces que le ha servido mucho para desarrollar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de algunos repuestos para el carro que alquila.
texts.en:
Carlos, 30, lives with his spouse and daughter in his parents’ house.  He has been offering transportation services for over four years.  To do so, he has a car that he has leased.  He works independently traversing the city streets looking for passengers.  He knows that this type of work has its risks, like being a victim of assaults and accidents, which his community has recently started to experience.  However, the sacrifice does have its rewards since he earns considerable income that helps him support his family.  

His usual work schedule is all day; he rests nights.   He considers this activity to be profitable because it’s a very needed and sought after service.  Because of this he’d like in the future to own his own car.

This will be his loan #19 with MFP and he expects to make his payments.  Besides, he enjoys being part of his communal bank because his group stays together for several years and has taught him to be responsible with his accounts.  He is grateful for the previous financial help that has been very useful for his business’ development.  He will use the loan he’s requesting to buy some spare parts for the car he leases.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Kimsang

texts.en:
Kimsang, 27 years old, raises pigs at home. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $7 per day. They are married with two children, 3 and 1 year old. 

Every month, she has to spend $15 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to go to work and as a motor taxi when he is free from his work. 

She wants to have a big pen to raise more pigs. Also, though her children are still young now, they will start school soon, so she needs to save money for them when they are ready for school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's career.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy another motorbike for rent-a-bike business.

loans.name: Miluska

texts.es:
Miluska es una persona amable, trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Miluska nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 37 años de edad. Actualmente, Miluska vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su único hijo y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Miluska se dedica a la venta de Vehículos. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Miluska requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa. Su anhelo de la socia es abrir un tienda de venta de artesanía y venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Miluska is a kind, hardworking and responsible person, and it is for those qualities that her friends invited her to participate in the "Chaska" communal bank, of the Arariwa Association.

Miluska tells us that she was born in the city of Cusco in the Cusco Province and Cusco Department (in Peru), and she is 37 years old.   She currently lives in the same city where she was born, together with her only son, and this is where she undertakes her economic activities.

Miluska works selling vehicles. She has been working in this business for four years now, and it is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

At this moment, Miluska is requesting a loan for maintenance on her house.  The desire of the member is to open a shop selling handicrafts and selling clothing.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is from the village of Apnia, Akhalkalaki District, South Georgia. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife, Natela, and their 20-year-old daughter. 

Rezo is a farmer. He has 2 milk cows, from which Natela produces 40 kg of cheese per month, which she sells locally. The family also owns 6 hectares of agricultural land, of which 3 hectares is used to grow potatoes, 2 hectares to grow barley and 1 hectare to grow wheat. The family works hard in the spring and summer months to get a good harvest. Rezo takes all of the harvested products to the capital city and sells them on the open market. 

Rezo plans to use the requested credit to purchase a large sized metal rake to be used for raking the grass in August. Rezo rakes his fields for hours. He will store the collected grass and use it in the winter for feeding the cows. Once he has his own raking equipment, he won’t have to rent it from neighboring farmers. His costs will diminish and, accordingly, the family's profit will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a metal rake to make hay

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La  señora  Ángela, tiene  treinta y ocho años de  edad , estudio  hasta la secundaria terminada  sabe  leer muy bien le gusta mucho  escribir.
Tiene la cantidad de  dos hijos una mujer  Alondra de  veinte años de edad y Rubén de   diez años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la  venta de abarrotes por  mayoreo y menudeo  desde hace cinco años atrás.
Sus clientes están muy contentos por la mercancía que les vende ya que esta  en  buen estado  y le da la mercancía  al momento.
Uno de sus sueños es hacer su mercancía mas grande es hacer mas grande su tienda de abarrotes  para que sus hijos la administren.
Le da las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  y hacer  realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Angela, 38, studied through the end of high school and knows how to read well and really likes to write. She has 2 children - Alondra, 20, and Ruben, 10. 

For 5 years she has sold groceries in bulk and smaller quantities. Her customers are very happy with her merchandise because it's in good condition and she gives them the up-to-date goods. One of her dreams is to increase the quantity of merchandise and make her grocery store bigger so that her children can manage it. 

She thanks the foundation for the support they have given her to get ahead and make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is twenty-seven-years-old, married and they have three children aged between seven years old and two years old whom she hopes to give good education to the university level. She operates a general store in which she sells such items as sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, beverages and detergents. She has been in this business for four year and says that though the business is profitable, there are challenges of financial constraints. 

Judith is using her loan of KES 40,000 to buy sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, beverages and detergents to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. In future she hopes to grow her business into a wholesale operation. She describes herself as humble and God-fearing.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urubamba, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Prudencia; tiene 48 años de edad,  la socia es casada;  la socia tiene 2 hijos de 21, 18  años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la venta de emolientes, la socia tiene una carreta acondicionada para llevar todos sus productos y vender a partir de las 6 de la tarde en la esquina principal de sus barrio emolientes, la socia vende mates elaborados a base de hierbas medicinales que alivian o desinflaman los órganos, la socia cree fielmente en el alivio de sus mates hechos a base de hierbas naturales como linaza, cebada, airampo, limón, cola de caballo, y otras raíces de plantas medicinales usadas desde siempre en nuestro País. La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de hierbas naturales  y en la compra de vasos para implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de hierbas naturales y de vasos para el negocio.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Prudencia is a member of the Communal Bank “Fraternidad de Urubamba” (Brotherhood of Urubamba) which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, married, and has two children (ages 21 and 18). Prudencia sells emollients (hot beverages made with herbs). She has a cart that is used for carrying all of her products. Prudencia starts selling emollients at 6pm in the main square of her neighborhood. Among the products she sells are “mates” made from medicinal herbs that alleviate inflamed organs. Prudencia is a true believer in the curative properties of beverages made with natural ingredients such as linseed, barley, cactus seeds, lemon, horsetail, and other medicinal plants that are frequently used in Peru. Prudencia wants to invest in the purchase of natural herbs and drinking glasses so that she can keep her business in operation. Therefore, she is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Prudencia is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy natural herbs and drinking glasses for her business.

loans.name: Sodiki

texts.ru: Кодири ответственный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у них 1 ребенок. Он занимается купля продажей скот на рынке, где продает животных. В месяц он продает 2 -3 коров по сумме 10000 или 12000 Сомони. Прибыль, который он получает, использует для семейной нужды и улучшения уровень жизни. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получать хорошую прибыль. Кодири запрашивает займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарен всем, кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Sodiki is a responsible and goal-oriented person.  He is married and has one child.  Sodiki is involved in buying and selling livestock at the livestock market.  He sells 2-3 cows per month at 10000 or 12000 Somoni.  He uses the resulting profit for family needs and improvement of quality of living.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  Sodiki is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of livestock.  He thanks everyone who supports him in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 45 years old and is a married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 26 years old.

Sandra helps her husband grow rice crops on their land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She also raises pigs in their backyard. Sandra does her best to support her family. She has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Sandra hopes for this loan to help them achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Pricila

texts.en:
Pricila is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Pricila has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, spices & vegetables. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy food seasoning, spices, noodles & vegetables.
Pricila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Pricila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasoning, spices, noodles & vegetables

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a 51-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband runs a junk shop. Martina owns and manages a sari-sari store business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells shampoo, soap, vinegar, soy sauce and other kinds of products. Martina says that the store has been helpful to her family's daily needs. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap and biscuits. Martina hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap and biscuits.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Con 21 años de edad, este joven emprendedor de la zona rural le quiere dar un impulso a su negocio comprando la herramienta necesaria para complementar su taller y por medio de él, ayudarle a toda su familia económicamente. El futuro es inmediato y su mayor anhelo es poderle dar empleo a sus amigos que enfrentan una difícil situación económica y que con su empresa legalmente constituida seguro lo podrá hacer. Comprar una cortadora y material de trabajo, es una meta que se puso, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para hacerlo por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita mejorar su negocio, y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en: At the age of 21, this enterprising young man in a rural zone wants to give his business a push buying the necessary tools to equip his workshop so that he can help his entire family economically through it.  The future is here and his greatest wish is to be able to give jobs to his friends that are facing difficult economic situations and that with a firm that’s legally constituted he’s sure to be able to do so.  He set a goal of buying a saw and work supplies but he does not have the necessary funds.  So, he’s asked for a loan that will make it possible to improve his business and thus his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metalworking tools and supplies.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a mother and a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya where she lives with her family of 7 children, all schooling save for the first born. She has been doing farming for 20 years running and currently produces maize and milk for the local market.

Jacklyne has decided to make a loan request with Juhudi amounting to 51,200 KES to enable her to boost her dairy farming by buying and insuring an additional cow at 31,200 KES and purchase poultry birds at 20,000 KES and venture into poultry farming as well.

She laments of high cost of feeds in the area especially during acute dry weather.She is advocating for an introduction of school fees loans by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.ru: Зумрат активная и трудолюбивая девушка. Она не замужем. Более 4 года она занимается купле- продажей сувениров и подарочных изделий. У неё широкий ассортимент товаров и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Она планирует поехать за товарами в Китай и хочет поставлять красивые необычные сувениры и подарочные изделия, которые позволят ей привлечь много новых клиентов. Она запрашивает займ для закупа сувениров и подарочных изделий. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент товара к праздникам с целью получения больше дохода.
texts.en: Zumrad is an active and hard-working young woman. She is unmarried. For more than four years she has bought and sold souvenirs and gift items. She has a large assortment of goods and has many regular customers. She plans to go to China to buy goods and wants to supply beautiful, unusual souvenirs and gift items that will enable her to bring in many new customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase souvenirs and gift items. She wants to increase the range of her products for the holidays to bring in a higher income.

loans.use: purchase souvenirs and gift items

loans.name: Sengleang

texts.en:
Sengleang is a 34-year-old divorced mother of three children. Two of her children are still at school while her youngest child is too young to attend school. Sengleang lives in a flat area of a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district where farming is common. She has been farming on her rice field for four years to make a living. In addition, she started running a small business a year ago selling biscuits, candy, and other foods to gain additional income. Sometimes, she works for other people for additional income as well. With her current business, she earns more than 10 USD per day to feed and support her children. 
Sengleang has been with Kiva partner VisionFund since 2009. She completely repaid her last loan with VisionFund. Her loans from VisionFund have helped her to afford sufficient food regularly and have helped to give her a regular income. She is now requesting another loan, which she will use to expand her business by buying biscuits and other foods for her store. Sengleang hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business and earn more income to provide a better standard of living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and other foods for her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy marañón seeds.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Lolita has had a food shop or "sari-sari store" for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Lolita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nyatindo

texts.en: Nyatindo is a married man who has three children ranging from two to eleven years of age. He describes himself as a religious man. For the last three years, his primary business activity has been transportation services. His business challenge is the high price of fuel. He will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare parts for his motorbike. In the next five years, Nyatindo hopes and plans to run a spare parts retail shop and to own at least three motorbikes.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 70-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. For ten years he has been running a retail shop after retiring from active service.  He started with 600,000 shillings as working capital, but now he has over 3,000,000 shillings as well as fixed assets such as a motorcycle and a house.  His goals are educating his children, building a permanent house and diversifying his business to include a coffee plantation and livestock farm. 

Thomas needs this loan to buy salt, sugar and sodas to resell.

loans.use: buy salt, sugar and sodas

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 49-year-old widow, who has five children who support her needs. She presently resides at Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor.

She has engaged in hog raising for five years, and the business helps her to earn more of her living. She requested a loan amount of PHP 3,000, which she will use as additional capital for hog raising.

She is a new member of PMPC and hopes to be successful in her business in the future.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Cao's Group

texts.en:
Mr Cao is 26 years old and he is married.
 
He has worked in agriculture raising cow for 5 years.
Cao lives in Tinh Gia district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Cao faces is lack of capital.  is requesting a loan to purchase baby cow to raise and sell in future.
This is Cao first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With his business profit, Cao hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby cow to raise and sell in future.

location.town: 10 Thôn Xuân Nguyên - Xã Nguyên Bình

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita V. has a grocery store with basic products that is one year old. The business has improved and she has plans for 2007 to increase her line of products and with that obtain more clients. To do this she is requesting a loan for $1,500.00 which she expects to pay on a term of 1 year.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Felicita V. cuenta con 1 año en su negocio de abarrotes, productos básicos. El negocio a mejorado y tiene planes para este 2007 de incrementar la línea de productos y con ello obtener mas clientes por lo cual solicita un préstamo de $1500.00 dllrs ella contempla pagarlos en un plazo de 1 año

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Eliceo

texts.en:
Eliceo has a very humble plot of land that he uses for rice production. Although he does not have much, it helps make ends meet for Eliceo and his parents. He is not married nor does he have children, but he is still very close to his parents as they live together and work the lands. He also works at the local rice processing center.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Eliceo is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice production

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is active in the distribution and sale of rice in 100-pound quantities to stores and markets in the area north of Guayaquil. She has fifty steady clients to whom she provides rice on a weekly basis; she also sells rice by the pound from home. She started her business with a loan of $400 from another institution and with the help of suppliers who sell to her at wholesale prices. With this loan, Aurora aspires to having more capital to invest in her product, purchase more rice and fix up the shop in her home in order to increase her clientele and serve them better. Aurora is very happy and is certain that with this loan her family will improve its standard of living and she will be able to save money for a better education for her son in the future. She is 50 years old and has a son who attends school. She lives in a cement home and enjoys a stable family life.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Aurora se dedica a la distribucion y venta de arroz por quintales en tiendas y mercados de la zona norte de Guayaquil. Tiene una cartera fija de cincuenta clientes a los que les provee de arroz semanalmente ademas vende arroz por libra en su casa. Ella empezo su negocio con un prestamo ($400) en otra institucion y teniendo proveedores que le venden a precio de mayorista y herramientas para comenzar el negocio. Aurora aspira que con el prestamo tendra más capital para poder invertir en su producto, comprar más arroz y arreglar un local en su propia vivienda para tener mayor cantidad de clientes y con una mejor atencion. Aurora esta muy contenta y esta segura que con este credito su familia mejorara su nivel de vida y podra ahorrar para poder darle una mejor educacion a su hijo en el futuro. Ella tiene 50 años y 1 hijo que estudia su casa de cemento y tiene buena estabilidad familiar

loans.use: Purchase rice in larger quantities and renovate her home-based shop

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en: Mariya is a widow who lives in Mukachevo, a small city in the western Ukraine. She supports herself by running a little grocery store, which gives her an income of about $800 per month. Mariya has been in business for eight years and has developed a very stable enterprise. She has requested a loan of $1,200 to increase her working capital so that she can purchase new inventory and take care of some expenses. Her goal is to continue to build her business and increase her profits and income.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina A. T. Chip, 24 years old, runs a small neighborhood food store. When she and her husband started their lives together, they opened up this little tienda called "Evelyn". At first they started off selling drinks and snack foods and now it is a well stocked neighborhood grocery. She is a motivated person and works hard at growing the business with her husband and raising their young family. Currently they have 4 young children who are too young for school but it is her dream that they go to school and thrive with their studies.

The credit with Friendship Bridge will provide more opportunities for growth and decisionmaking as well as responsibilities. She is excited about the influx of investment capital which will help further growth of the business, and she also is fully committed to the responsibility. of paying the monthly installments on time and in full.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her little store

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Mrs. Folake A. loves selling bread, a business which she started in 2003. She hails from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. She needs the loan of $400 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai is a single twenty-six-year-old lady. She’s a new member to our program who wants to start a small elei (a traditional Samoan fabric) printing business but has no job and couldn’t borrow money anywhere for financial support to start her business. Faafetai then decided to join SPBD which is the only micro-finance company that can help her make her dream come true. She has attended three weeks' training with the program and is now requesting her first loan. She hopes that her business will turn out to be successful so that she can support her parents and the whole family.

loans.use: To start up an elei (block printing on cloth) business

loans.name: Erisa B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Mastula is a widow with five children. She supports her family by selling food, particularly matooke, a dish made with plantains that is popular in Uganda. Zira and Josephine sell fruits and vegetables. Margret sells second-hand clothes while Betty sells charcoal. Mastula wants to use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell to their customers

loans.name: Sahliman

texts.en:
Sahliman was born in 1956. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan in the Fuzuli region. He settled down in the Ahmadbayli village.

He has been in this business for four years. He is married with three children. Now, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a cow in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim S., 40, is married with five children and, with her husband, sells corn. They normally earn around $5 a day of profit. One of their children is married and lives away from home. One son works as a goldsmith and makes $120 a month and another one is a tailor. The remaining two are students. They are now requesting a loan from Kiva to expand their business by purchasing more corn to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more corn to sell.

loans.name: Noëlie

texts.fr:
Mrs Noëlie T. was born around 1961 in Savalou in the hills of Benin. Married and the mother of two children, she has lived in Yagbe, a Cotonou shantytown, for about 15 years. She sells a variety of cereals, such as corn, sorghum, millet, soya, etc, and has two stores that stock her very popular products. She is requesting this loan to replenish her inventory in order to fulfill the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame T. Noëlie est née vers les années 1961 à SAVALOU dans les collines du BENIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 2 enfants et réside à YAGBE un bidonville de COTONOU depuis une quinzaine d’année. Elle est une revendeuse de diverses sortes de céréales tels que le maïs, le sorgho, le mil, le soja et autres et dispose de 2 magasins pour le stockage de ses produits qui sont actuellement recherchés .Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner afin de combler les attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 30 x 120 kg bags of corn

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es:
In the municipality of Condega in the city of Estela, Mr. Pedro Calderon has dedicated himself to the agriculture business. He grows basic grains and handles cattle as a small farmer. His family is made up of his wife and his three children who he provides with the education that they deserve. It is important to point out that this gentleman has succeeded in this business and has been able to improve the condition of his business thanks to his sacrifices and great efforts.

Ceprodel has been an important factor in his business as it has given Pedro loans which he has used to purchase cattle and to assist in his crops. Today he needs a loan to provide technological assistance to his crops which is why he confidently waits the approval of this loan knowing that it will be of great use in this business and that his family will greatly benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, el caballero Pedro C. se ha dedicado por mucho tiempo al negocio de la agricultura al cultivo de granos básicos y al manejo de ganado como pequeño productor agropecuario. Su familia consta de su esposa y tres hijos que les proporciona la educación que ellos se merecen. Es de mucha necesidad destacar que este caballero ha sobresalido en el negocio por lo que ha logrado mejorar la condición de su negocio gracias a sus sacrificios y grandes esfuerzos que ha hecho.

Hoy en día, Ceprodel ha sido un factor importante en su negocio por la razón de que ha financiado al caballero Pedro por medio del otorgamiento de créditos que los ha utilizado para la compra del ganado y asistencia de los cultivos. Hoy en día su necesidad es la adquisición del crédito para darle asistencia técnica a los cultivos por esta razón es que muy confiadamente espera en la aprobación del crédito sabiendo que le será de mucha utilidad en su negocio y de esta manera su familia será beneficiada grandemente.

loans.use: Technological assistance for cultivation

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Señora Magdalena is a humble elderly lady that has been dedicated all her life to the farm business; cultivating basic grains and raising cattle in the municipality of Somotillo of the city of Somotillo. The problems that she faces in her community is that, by being in a very distant rural sector, she can not count on electric power and for this reason she has requested the installation of a solar panel for illumination and to do the tasks of the home.

She has requested of Ceprodel to obtain the loan for the payment of the solar panel. Nowadays she waits for her loan to be approved so that she may obtain the electric power that will provide of a lot of benefit. For a long time she has utilized candles for lighting and with the solar panel she will have the use of two lamps and a small television set. With this loan she will benefit and improve the conditions of her home.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Magdalena es una humilde anciana que se ha dedicado toda la vida al negocio agropecuario cultivando granos básicos y criando Ganado en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Somotillo. La problemática que atraviesa en su comunidad es que por ser un sector rural muy alejado, no se cuenta con energía eléctrica y por esto es que ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para iluminarse y hacer los quehaceres del hogar.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para el pago del panel solar.
