Hoy en día espera que su crédito sea aprobado para así obtener la energía eléctrica que le servirá de mucho beneficio por lo que para alumbrarse por mucho tiempo ha utilizado candiles y con el panel solar tendrá acceso a dos lámparas y un pequeño televisor. Con este crédito se beneficia y mejora las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel

loans.name: Rashda's Group

texts.en:
Rashda baji is the wife of L. A., and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her oldest two children are in 3rd standard (grade), while the next three children are in kindergarten. Her husband is a fruit seller, and he has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Rashidan baji is a housewife, and she takes care of her children. She has already successfully repaid her prior loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a loan for her husband. More specifically, her husband uses a vehicle to go to the city to buy fruit, but he needs a loan in order to repair his vehicle.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Farhat baji, who seeks a loan to expand her hair salon/barber shop; (2) Jamila baji, who requests a loan to expand her grocery store; and (3) Nazia baji, who is in need of a loan to expand her repair workshop business.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., to repair a vehicle, to expand their shops, etc.)

loans.name: Patzutzun 2 Group

texts.en:
Patzutzun is a calm and quiet village, where everybody knows one another. The living circumstances are not very good. The houses are not well equipped and often lack running water. Therefore they talk a lot about how to improve their lives. One of the members of this group once heard of micro-finance and started searching for a way to arrange this for them. They contacted Friendship Bridge and after a successful first loan, this is going to be their second loan now.

The women of this group have daily food stores and raise cattle. One of them also has chickens, and Rosa S. buys and sells candles. The president of the Group is called Clavia, who buys corn in Sololá. She takes this to Patzutzun to sell to all her friends, family, and neighbours. They all go to the local millers to have their corn ground into flour, to make their delicious tortillas. The fact that there is a miller in their village saves them a lot of work, not having to do the grinding by hand, says Clavia. 

Mercedes, who is here with her daughter, will buy a new bull and all the necessities, such as food and fencing, to take care of him. When he is big and strong, she will sell him. It was Mercedes who initially started using credit this way. She has done it several times now. Her daughter Eusebia is going to follow her mom's example. This is a reasonably steady business, she tells me while holding the tiniest baby on her arm! When I ask them why they don't buy a cow to produce calves, they tell me that it is a very different business to raise young cattle. Cows are also not easy to find and much more expensive. And since working with the bulls is something they have a lot of experience with, their buyers already know the good quality of their bulls.

Rosa is a very good cook and people buy her tortillas as far away as Guatemala City! She runs her business with the help of her daughter. Her daughter makes the 2-3 hour journey a couple of times a week to sell her mother's tortillas. Maria is hoping to expand her store to be able to sell different products in the future. Next to her sits Antonia, who wants to do the same and eventually improve her home.  

Antonia also wants to provide her children with their own bed and better school clothes. All her hard work is for one purpose only: to give her kids the best she can. And when I ask whether all the kids go to school they answer as one person: YES! 

All of them are very determined to ensure their children will have better and more education than they had themselves.

loans.use: invest in cattle and expand the variety of the products they sell

loans.name: Rokel Group Ii

texts.en:
Yeabu S., who is the leader of the Rokel Group II group, was born in Magburaka. She is 50 years of age, a widow with 5 children; 4 of whom are already grown ups. Yeabu is a farmer and also sells dishes. She has been doing this for over 20 years. With her previous loans, Yeabu was able to pay for one of her sons, who wanted to learn welding as a trade, and also paid school fees for her youngest son. She plans to use this loan to buy more dishes to sell and invest in her farm.

The Rokel Group II includes Yeabu S. and Beintu S.. They are small-scale business women in Magburaka, the headquarters in Tonkolili District. This is their third loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans meant a lot in the lives and businesses of these people. They were able to expand their businesses, and consequently, their profits also increased. Today, these people are thankful for those loans because their livelihoods have improved over the days before the loans.

loans.use: Invest in farm and purchase more dishes to sell

loans.name: Asmin

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Asmin N. from Dar es Salaam She is single and has two children, who are five-year-old twins. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two other dependants because their parents do not take of them. Asmin N. has been selling fish since 2006. She buys fresh fish daily from fishermen and sells them at the fish market. Her business is doing well, and she has two employees to help her. Asmin currently earns about $350 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $600 USD so she can buy larger quantities of fish. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Asmin thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Florian

texts.es:
El Señor Florián cuenta con 37 años de edad, su pareja es la Señora. Constancia Alvarenga,  aún no tienen hijos y viven en una casa arrendada.
El Señor Florián tiene un local con venta de bebidas varias y comidas rápidas, para poder comenzar con este negocio,  Florián, desde el año 1998 hasta aproximadamente 2004, había trabajado en un bar en la capital del país, donde pudo ahorrar un pequeño capital y así montar dicho negocio, nos cuenta que comenzó con   aproximadamente $ 130, esto mas la experiencia que había adquirido en su anterior trabajo y gracias a su espíritu emprendedor, actualmente es uno de los lugares con más concurrencia de personas, por la buena atención y  la calidad de los productos ofrecidos.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de bebidas gaseosas e ingredientes para la elaboración de las comidas rápidas.
Su meta es la de tener una casa propia en donde pueda establecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Florián is 37, his partner is Señora Constancia Alvarenga. They do not yet have children and are living in a rented house. Señor Florián has a shop selling various beverages and quick meals. In order to start this business, Florián worked in a bar in the capital from 1998 until approximately 2004, where he was able to gather a little capital to get his business going. He tells us that he started with approximately $130 plus the experience gained from his former job and thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit, it is now one of the places with the most clients, because of his excellent service and the quality of the products offered. The requested loan is to purchase soft drinks and ingredients for preparation of the quick meals. His goal is to establish his business in a house of his own.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and ingredients for quick meals

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun L. is a villager in Ang Kounh village in Takeo Province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Poeuv Yos, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows rice. Mrs. Khun L. is requesting a loan to buy wood for building a house for her family. She is 52 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. The new house will improve her family's standard of living, and because they both work, the loan will be repaid on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase wood for a new family house

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced and lives with her younger daughter. Oksana owns a retail business. She sells bath robes for both men and women at several markets. Her monthly income is about 10,000 UAH (1 UAH =~0.124USD).

Oksana has been in this business for 10 years. She started when the factory she worked at closed and she lost her job. Oksana started small, but her hard work and good choice of goods to sell helped her to develop this business. At the moment she has 3 business locations where she sells her goods.

Oksana would like to get a loan to increase her assortment of bath robes for sale. Oksana would like to develop her business even further so she can help her younger daughter get an apartment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods for sale.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union) Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Benkadi de l’association Sorotekoumbela du village de kimparana (préfecture de San quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) se connaissent bien à travers leur association traditionnelle du village. Agées de 38 ans  en moyenne, les femmes du groupe Benkadi, ont au moins 4 enfants chacune en charge et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris leurs coépouses et leurs enfants. 
Ayant le souci d’améliorer leurs activités quotidiennes, ces femmes ont accueilli avec plaisir l’intervention de Soro Yiriwaso dans leur localité et depuis 3 ans maintenant elles sont clientes de cette institution. Ce prêt est leur cinquième après avoir remboursé correctement les quatre précédents.
 Elles habitent des grandes familles dans le village de kimparana où elles mènent diverses activités telles que la restauration, la vente de riz, de haricots et d’igname. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter en cette période de récolte des sacs de riz et du haricot à un prix abordable.  
 Elles vendent les nourritures dans des gargotes ou en ambulant au marché ou au carrefour. Le riz est acheté à koury kimparana et niokoyiri, vendu sec ou préparé sur place, elles réalisent un bénéfice moyen de 175 000FCFA par cycle. 
En plus du remboursement des intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, les membres du groupe Benkadi utilisent une partie de leur épargne pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et faire face aux dépenses de la famille. Dans l’avenir, le groupe Benkadi souhaite rester en collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso en espérant avoir des montants élevés.
texts.en:
The six women of the Benkadi group of the Sorotekoumbela association from the village of Kimparana in Mali know each other well due to their traditional village association. Averaging 38 years of age, the women of the Benkadi group have at least four children each and live in traditional extended families with their husbands and co-wives and their children. Because they wanted to improve their daily revenues, these women welcomed Soro Yiriwaso in their area and have been clients for the past three years. This loan is their fifth as they have repaid all four previous loans. They live in large families in the village of Kimparana where they have a variety of businesses such as selling food, rice, beans and yams. This loan will be used to buy bags of rice and beans at a reasonable price as it is harvest time. They sell food in diners or walking in the marketplace or at crossroads. They buy their rice in Koury, Kimparana and Niokoyiri; it is sold dry or prepared on the spot. They make an average profit of 175,000 FCFA per cycle. In addition to repaying the loan interests to Soro Yiriwaso, the members of Benkadi use part of their savings to increase their businesses and pay household expenses. In the future, the Benkadi group wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in the hope of borrowing more substantial amounts.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for resale.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa tiene 20 años de edad, vive cerca de 5 años con su pareja y tienen un hijo, viven en una casa alquilada donde realizan sus negocio de venta de golosinas y gaseosas. Ella anteriormente cultivaba el campo con su esposo; pero como la chacra no es tan rentable en ciertas épocas, abrió una tienda de golosinas y venta de gaseosas hace 8 meses, resultándole muy rentable. En el primer préstamo que obtuvo con MFP logró comprar un estante, pero ahora con este préstamo quiere implementar su bodega, con más productos. A Vanessa le agrada estar en contacto con la gente, y de paso va generando ingresos a su economía, mientras que su esposo se dedica a cultivar sus chacras frutales, que en ciertas  temporadas producen frutos en cantidades, lo que lo alientan a seguir sembrando. El anhelo de Vanessa es tener un terreno propio para que se evite pagar el derecho de alquiler del inmueble donde tiene su tienda. Ingresó a su banco comunal en el tercer ciclo y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, institución con la cual siente una gran identificación. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los productos de su tienda de golosinas y de ese modo sea mucha más surtida y capte mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 20 years old and has been living with her partner close to 5 years and they have a son. They live in a house they've rented and where they run their business selling snacks and soft drinks. Previously she cultivated a field with her husband; but produce isn't that profitable in certain seasons, so she opened a store to sell snacks and soft drinks 8 months ago, and finding it very profitable. In the first loan she received from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) she managed to purchase a stand, but now with this loan she wants to stock her store with more products. Vanessa loves to be in contact with people, and in doing so she is generating an income for herself, and meanwhile her husband dedicates his time to cultivate fruit that in certain seasons they produce fruit in great quantities, something they hope to keep harvesting. Vanessa's goal is to have her own fields to no longer have to pay rent on the building where she has her store. She sought the community bank in her third loan cycle and her history indicates that she makes payments on time, on this her second loan from MFP, an institution of which she feels part. The funds requested will be used to stock her snack store to increase selection, to the end of increasing her client base.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith K. lives in Pech En village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Keav Ry, are farmers who own a piece of land and cultivate rice for a living. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. Another is a construction worker. One is attending the local school, and the last is too young to work or study. Even though Mrs. Ith K.’s family members try to work hard, they still earn less than they need to support the family and are unable to afford a better house. Mrs. Ith K. needs a loan to add to her savings in order to buy building materials for a house. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: Buy building materials for a house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is a 48-year-old mother of three children.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana, where her children attend junior high school and primary school.  Though her husband is employed, Victoria still needs to work to make some income to help support the family.

Victoria has been in business for twenty years, selling food items such as beans, onions, tomatoes and ‘gari’, a carbohydrate food made from cassava.  She procures the products from the wholesalers in her community and then sells from a table in the market square.  Victoria wants a loan to purchase more supplies in bulk to expand her business.  She aspires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure food ingredients

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos, que viven en su casa. Él mismo se llama “el colono”, ya que es un agricultor que cultiva la tierra arrendando chacras en las que también suele vivir. Esta actividad la ha realizado toda su vida, y en cada lugar suele sembrar en cantidades numerosas papa y alverjas. En tiempos de cosecha suele irse a vivir a la chacra, arma chozas cerca de sus sembríos para evitar que le roben los primeros frutos de sus alverjas. De todas sus siembras, lo que mayor ganancia y menor inversión le causa, son las alverjas, por ello que no deja de sembrar este fruto; y para los meses de cosecha busca personal que le ayude en el trabajo. Una vez cosechada, acumula su producción en un lugar apropiado hasta terminar de reunir todas las vainitas y finalmente las comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad. Esta dinámica de trabajo le ha resultado muy rentable y con estas ganancias está pensando en adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivo, para de ese modo establecerse en solo lugar. Durante tres préstamos consecutivos viene trabajando Ángel con MFP, y en todo este tiempo demostró predisposición de pagar antes que los demás integrantes sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes para sus sembríos de alverjas, y está muy agradecido con la institución que le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Angel is 36 years old, married and is father to two children that live with him. He is referred to as "the tenant farmer", since he is a farmer that works the land of farms that he leases, farms on which he also lives. He has been doing this all his life, growing large quantities of potatoes and beans in each of the farms. At harvest time, he goes to live on the farm, constructing a hut near his crop so that he can stop any robbery of his new bean harvest. Of all his crops, beans are the most profitable and requiring the least amount of work, that is why he does not stop growing them and during the picking months he gets persons to help with the work. Once harvested, he collects his production in an appropriate place until he has picked all the green beans at which point he sells them in the markets of the city. This work process has proven to be very profitable for him and he is thinking of buying his own land with the gains, this way he can establish himself in one place. Angel has been working with MFP for the last three loans. during which time he has paid his installments on time before any of the other members. The money that he is now requesting will buy fertilizers for his green bean crop. He is very grateful to the organization that allows him to continue his work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en: T. Margaret is a polite and hard-working lady, and these qualities help her relate well with her customers. She is the leader of Ndekye Tukwatanise group in Bushenyi. She is sixty-four years old and has four children, the youngest being twenty-eight years old. She helps to care for eight orphans who are in school by helping pay for their school fees, as well as contributing to their general welfare. Margaret has a shop with a variety of merchandise including firewood. She is faced with the scarcity of firewood because there is a government policy to stop people from encroaching on the forests. Since her business has been strategically positioned in the town center for seventeen years, she makes a good profit that helps her to care for her family. She would like to achieve her dream of working from her own premises so as to avoid rent. She also wants to educate all her grandchildren so that they can take care of her when she is too old to work. Margaret needs a loan to buy sacks of beans and ground nuts to increase her shop stock.

loans.use: To buy beans and ground nuts to increase her shop stock.

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Greetings from Gerard N.. 25 years old and single with no dependents, he currently lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur is a productive young man who owns a shop selling different kinds of merchandises but mostly his store is made up of vessels. Gerard is requesting his first loan worth 500000Rwf from Vision Finance Company and will be paid back within12 months. Gerard had been working in the same activity since early 2008; he has one full-time employee to help him in this business. He starts his daily business at 6h00’AM to 20h00’PM and used to earn 182 USD. With the loan from Vision Finance Company, N. intends to buy more stock of merchandises, and with the increased profit he will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: Buy more store of marchandises

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela L. is from the city of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro. She is 32 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Carmela owns and operates a specialized retail store. Carmela has engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carmela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Carmela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase a transport vehicle. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be the fourth taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to pay for a motorcycle and support the needs of her family.

--------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
37-year-old Nancy F. proves to herself and to her family that she is more than just a plain housewife. She started engaging in her farming business in the last 15 years to support her husband in meeting their needs, especially in financing their six children’s education. While they are obtaining a good income during harvest, Nancy still finds it insufficient, thinking that as their children are growing, so are their needs. With this in mind, Nancy desires to acquire an additional hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field to improve their harvest.

Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) is now helping her by lending her Php 10,000 as additional capital for her business. The institution is also providing her with new techniques in proper business management through their free training and seminars for active members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Kurbonho

texts.ru: Курбонхо Хикматуллоев проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Курбонхо по образованию работал учителем. Вот более 4 лет занимается бизнесом. Он покупает скот, откармливает и продает его на рынке как мясо. В данный момент он просит кредит, для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Kurbonho H. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 47 years old. He is married and has one child. Kurbonho has worked as a teacher in which he has a degree. For more than four years he has been doing business. He buys cattle, feeds it and resells on the market as meat. At this time he is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has been working with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for two years and is currently the official secretary of her communal bank, 'Teresa Ramos'. Francisca sells beauty products and also helps her father by investing in his business. Francisca's father purchases fruit and other crops from the small agricultural communities along the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and joins the Amazon to the north. He then resells the goods in the city.

Francisca used her very first loan of 300 PEN to begin her business selling beauty products. She plans to use this current loan of 1500 PEN in two ways. Some of it she will invest in more beauty products, and the rest she will use to help her father with his business.

Francisca is engaged and is due to have her first baby in December. Her partner works at the factory for Kola Real, a local soft drink. Francisca has many goals for the future. She wants to purchase a plot of land on which to build her own home as well as a store. She wants this store to either be a grocery shop or a small pharmacy. Francisca knows a little bit about medicine because she completed a course of studies to become a nurse technician. She hopes to return to school eventually to study pharmacy as well.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and crops for resale

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro O. es una persona emprendedora  desde hace 4 años el inicio como chofer de Transporte Escolar, ha ido progresando poco a poco ahora el ya tiene cuatro unidades, en las que también su esposa le ayuda y otros dos empleados para el traslado de cada niño. Aparte de ser un pequeño empresario también es generador de empleo ya que a sus dos empleados les paga por cada unidad.
Lo que nos llamo la atención de Isidro fue cuando en una plática nos comentó que tiene un proyecto llamado “Adopta un Niño”, este se trata de que le da apoyo al estudiante que no cuenta con dinero (bajos recursos) para el traslado a la escuela. Isidro preocupado por la Educación de cada niño; al comienzo del ciclo escolar con la ayuda del Director de la Escuela seleccionan al niño para que pueda entrar en este programa es una causa noble de parte de el ya que hay pocas personas que se preocupan por esto.
Ahora el recurre a nosotros pidiendo un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus 4 transportes ya que se vienen el inicio  a clases y el desea que sus unidades este en perfectas condiciones para la seguridad de las personas que lo abordan.
Aparte de esto el también quiere darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia; a sus dos hijos y al que viene en camino.
texts.en:
Sr. Isidro O. is an entrepreneur who has been operating a school transportation service for the past 4 years. His business has grown slowly over time, and now he has a fleet of 4 vehicles. This allows his wife and two other employees to help with transporting students. Being a small businessman, he has been able to provide employment for his two employees who are paid for each trip.

When we talked to Sr. Isidro, he mentioned that he started a program called “Adopt a Child” in which he provides free transportation to low-income students who cannot afford to pay for this service. Isidro is concerned about the education of each child. At the beginning of the school year, he meets with the School Director to select which students to accept into the program. For the few people who care about this situation, they feel this is a noble cause.

Sr. Isidro is now a requesting a loan in order to pay for maintenance of his 4 transport vehicles. With the start of classes, he wants his vehicles to be in perfect condition for the sake of his passengers’ safety. In addition, he wants to provide the best quality of life for his family. He and his wife are expecting two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of 4 school transportation vehicles

loans.name: Grace Kwamboka

texts.en:
Grace is forty-nine years old and married to Evans Ototo, who is fifty-five years old. They have five children, named Stella Nyambane - twenty-four years old, Monica Nyamusi - twenty-one years old, Juliet Kemunto -nineteen years old, Jackson Mambe - fifteen years old and Christine Gesale - nine years old.

The client has been in the quarry business for two and a half years. She was introduced to the Kiva field partner, KADET, by other existing clients, and she has no loans from other MFIs. She intends to use the loan to rent another site and hire more miners.

Grace's place of business is Njiru - an upcoming market center in a semi-slum area.

With the extra profit, she intends to pay school fees for her children. Grace works hard and her hopes and dreams are to see all her children go through school successfully.

 ABOUT KADET LTD. 

Kadet Ltd is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to the rural communities through the microfinance model. Kadet is the only microfinance in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities we serve. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, Kadet has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on Kadet from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To rent another site and hire more miners.

loans.name: Hazel Ivania

texts.es: La joven Hazel Hernández de 23 años de edad, es una joven esforzada ya que ha logrado terminar su carrera en ingeniería en sistema, debido al poco empleo en Nicaragua no ha logrado encontrar trabajo en su especialidad pero espera lograrlo, trabaja como recepcionista desde hace dos años. Es casada y reside en un barrio de la capital 380, con una niña de dos meses, su esposo se desempeña como aforador en una aduana y es responsable. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en casa de su mama, pues vende al contado y al crédito aunque tiene poco inventario su meta es poder volver a crecer en sus ventas, ya que su objetivos es poder remodelar su casa, con este crédito invertirá en cerámica para poner en un cuarto, este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic  y esta contenta por lograr sus objetivos con su casa. A futuro espera seguir trabajando con la institución.

loans.use: Comprar ceramica para poner en el cuarto

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Bineta N. est une commerçante de prêt-à-porter pour homme et femme, chaussures et sacs de ville, âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée. Dans le cadre de l’agrandissement de ses locaux Mme N. demande ce prêt afin d’augmenter sa production et sa clientèle ce qui lui permettra d’obtenir plus de revenus pour payer les frais de scolarité de sa fille qui est dans un collège privé
texts.en:
Bineta N. sells ready-to-wear for men and women, shoes, and handbags. She is 39 and married. In the intention of expanding her sales point, Mrs. N. is requesting this loan to grow her business and her clientele, which will allow her to earn more money to use for the school fees of her daughter who attends a private school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering her little business

loans.name: Try And See Group

texts.en:
Try and See is a group of five borrowers led by Korpo K. G., who is 45 years old and married with five children between the ages of 15 and 30. Their educational levels are 7th to 12th grade. Korpo herself is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close to Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, in northern Liberia. Korpo’s business is baking. She buys baking materials and ingredients like flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs and butter to bake and sell to residents of Ziggida town. She has been running this business for three years and hoping to expand to a larger bakery. Korpo’s bread, doughnuts and other baked goods are very nice as well as affordable, which encourages her customers to continue buying from her.

Korpo started her business with a small fund saved during the civil crisis, but because of family responsibilities, Korpo has been facing some financial constraints. She needs this loan in order to purchase more baking ingredients so that she can continue to bake and serve customers and improve her business. Korpo dreams of educating her children and giving her old-age husband the best of support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking ingredients so that she can serve her customers and improve business.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en: Rem H. raises crops and rice to make a living. She earns approximately $2.66 US per day. She is 53 years old and married. Her husband is employed in a non-governmental organization as a deminer in Preah Vihear Province, earning $5 US per day to help cover the family expenses. Rem H. lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. This is her first loan from Kiva’s partner, CREDIT. Mrs. H. is asking for a loan of $500 US to build a suitable tomb for her ancestors.

loans.use: To build a tomb for her ancestors

loans.name: Esther Dadi

texts.en:
Esther, 37, is married and has two children. She runs a grocery shop where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for about five years, and she makes a monthly profit of about 10,000 Kenya shillings. 

Esther has never borrowed from an MFI. A friend introduced her to KADET, and she is requesting a loan so she can buy more fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of her customers. She also wants to start selling clothes as a secondary business. This way, Esther will diversify her job.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve the living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables and venture into selling clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell sandalettes (flip-fliops)

loans.name: Gregoria Fernandina

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y vive con la última D. sus seis hijos en el distrito D. Paiján, provincia D. Ascope, en la región La laibertad, ubicada a tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace tres años se encuentra al cargo D. una bodega instalada en su casa, allí ofrece bebidas gaseosas y golosinas a sus habituales clientes. Ella nos comenta que el negocio originalmente era D. una D. sus hijas que tuvo que viajar al país D. Chile a trabajar, al partir ella se lo dejó encargado y desD. entonces lo ha sacado adelante.

Este negocio constituye una ayuda importante a la economía D. su familia ya que su esposo trabaja como peón agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Gregoria desea ampliar su negocio con la venta D. abarrotes pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es mejorar la construcción D. su casa, por ello desea seguir trabajando en su bodega, Gregoria es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y muy estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 57 years old, married, and lives with the youngest of her six children in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, in the region La Libertad, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For three years she has been in charge of a grocery store set up in her house, in which she offers soft drinks and candy to her clients. She tells us that the business originally belonged to one of her daughters who had to travel to Chile to work. Since then, she has managed it and moved it forward. This business is a big help economically, since her husband is a farm worker and the income he receives is not enough to cover the family's expenses. Gregoria desires to expand her business with the sale of groceries, but she doesn't have enough capital to carry this out. Therefore, she sees it necessary to request for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles. Her greatest wish is to improve the construction of her house, for which she wants to keep working in her grocery store. Gregoria is a happy and hard-working woman who is well respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget T., 62 years old, is a group leader of four members who will each use the loan for different purposes. This group is located in Smau Khnhei village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Nget T. is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Men Mor is a farmer who owns 1.5-hetars. In her breeding business, Mrs. Nget T. has a problem as she does not have enough money to buy pig feed. She decided to request a loan to buy pig feed to support her business. This couple has a grandchild who lives with them.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando José R. M., Labora como Supervisor de Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene cinco  hijos a su cargo, y tres de esta en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado diez créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido diez créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra, para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás de su patio, por lo que esta estaba cerrado con alambre de púa y postes de madera.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 Fernando dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Sr. Fernando José R. M. works as a sanitation supervisor at the Mercado Mayoreo (a wholesale market) in Managua. He is married and has five children, three of whom attend school. He has worked with CEPRODEL for seven years and has received ten loans. During this period, he used the loans to make improvements to his home.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and stone in order to build a wall behind his yard. This area is currently closed off with barbed wire and wooden posts. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Fernando says he is grateful for the loans provided by CEPRODEL because they have helped him make his home much safer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es:
La  señora Virginia 53 años y  esta casada con el Sr Alejandro  con quien tienen 3 hijas ya adolescentes ,una D. ella trabaja en una fabrica D. ropas D. Marca, las otras dos les ayudan en la confección D. ropas y cortinas, en su casa y luego en la posterior venta por los barrios  D. la  Ciudad D. Capiata. DonD. viven desD. hace 12 años, en su casa propia que fueron pagando mensualmente con el fruto del trabajo D. la Familia. 
El Sr.Alejandro  trabaja también en forma independiente en la Ciudad D. Asunción donD. se dedica a la venta  Tarjetas  D. Loterías  y todo los relacionados a juegos D. Azar, esta actividad lo viene realizando desD. antes D. casado.
El Proyecto D. ellos es  tener un Taller D. Confecciones con mas Maquinarias  y dar Mano D. Obras ( Trabajos) a muchas otras Familias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virgilia is 53 years old and married to Mr. Alejandro with whom she has 3 adolescent daughters. One daughter works in the Marca clothing factory; the other two help make clothes and curtains at home, then sell them in the neighborhoods of the City of Capiata. They have lived there for 12 years in their own house, for which they pay monthly with the fruits of the family's labor. Mr. Alejandro also works independently in the City of Asunción where he sells lottery tickets and everything related to games of chance. He has been doing this since before they were married. Their project is to have a shop to produce clothing with more machinery and to proviD. employment for many other families.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A 5-THREAD OVERLOK MACHINE TO MAKE CLOTHES

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina D. S., 44,  has two children, with the oldest age 23. She is a farmer and she  also runs a small store, which, according to her, gives her a little daily income. Her main source of income is from her rice farm so she spends most of her time making sure it is free of weeds and pests. Like other farmers, Edwina aims to grow her farm to earn more income and to ease her family’s financial challenges.

Edwina has  applied to CEVI and requests for a loan of PHP6, 000. She said she would use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer and also crude oil for the tractor she uses at the farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. She and her family live in Vehari, Pakistan. 

Nasreen’s customer base is 80% from the community and 20% outside of the community. Her business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. Once a month she travels to the neighboring city to purchase new clothes to sell. Her business helps to meet the financial expenses. She also has a sewing machine which she uses to earn additional profit.
 
Today Nasreen has requsted a loan of Pak Rs. 15000 to purchase new clothing.

Nasreen is also the group leader for four other women from her locality. Shamim baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Another lady named Shamim baji wants  a loan to buy a sewing machine for her  clothes-sewing business.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai K. and her husband, Mr. Chun Nhem, have been married since 1985 and have five children: three daughters and two sons. Two of their daughters are garment-factory workers, one son is a construction worker and the other children attend school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Lai K. used to sell fish her husband caught. But now the couple stopped the fishing and fish selling business and run new businesses. Lai sells porridge in front of her house. Her husband is a construction contractor.

In addition, Lai hopes to buy rice for resale; she will be able to get extra income to better support her family. Hence, she is requesting another loan of $400 in order to buy rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda F. has been a member of CEVI since May 2008. She likes the program because it helps her to financially establish her business.

Erlinda is presently engaged in raising pigs and farming. She would like to borrow Php 15,000 which will be used to buy pig feed and farm supplies.

Erlinda is 60 years of age and has four children. Her eldest child is 38 years old.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more river fish and cray fish to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie N. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Tessie is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a business selling vegetable products like "petchay", "sibuyas dahunan", "sili atsal" and others in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of over $3 per day. She is married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She has five children, all of whom are now married and live independently. Sok S. lacks money to buy a piece of farmland on which she plans to plant crops for additional income. Sok S. is therefore applying for a $300 loan to buy land.

loans.use: To buy a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.ru: Шералиев Эркинжон проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование средне. Более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где сажает овощи и фрукты. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Erkinjon S. lives in the area of Shahrituz. 30 years of age. Married, with two children. He has finished secondary school. He has been doing farm work for over six years. He rents a land plot where he grows vegetables and fruits. He is taking out a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun N., 50, has been selling dried fish in the market for years. She is married with a teenage child who attends school. Her husband operates a trailer-motor taxi around the market in the middle of city. Bun N. always buys fresh fish in bulk and turns them into dried fish for sale, enabling her to generate $4 per day to help solve the financial crisis of her family. 

In addition to her fish business, Bun N. also buys plastic items to resell for extra profit. This is the third loan she has requested. Bun N. will use this loan to order to buy a larger quantity of fresh fish to turn into dried fish for sale. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will resupply the inventory of plastics to sell. Bun N. was not available when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: buy a larger quantity of fresh fish to process for resale

loans.name: Dela

texts.es:
Dela es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector El Sandial, una centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace cuatro años en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en done vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento concentrado y forraje, el cual sembrado por su esposo de este modo garantizan el rapido crecimiento de sus animales, lo que les permite comercializarlos de mejor manera y percibir mayores ganancias.

Dela desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de ovejas con las cuales piensa trabajar del mismo modo: engordándolas y vendiéndolas en la misma zona, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Con el préstamo ella podrá ampliar su negocio y nivel de ventas, asimismo la calidad de vida de su familia mejorará. Dela es una mujer entregada a su familia y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en:
Dela is a 39-year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in the El Sandial sector, a rural town center in the Pítipo district. The agricultural district is in the Ferreñafe province, which is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She has been breeding small animals for four years out of her home. When they have reached a good size, she sells them to her neighbors and to the merchants who always visit the place where she lives. She gives her animals concentrated feed and fodder planted by her husband, thus ensuring the rapid growth of their animals and allowing them to market the animals better and realize more income. Dela wants to expand her business with the purchase of sheep. She is thinking of operating the same way with the sheep: to fatten and sell them in the same area. To achieve her goal she finds it necessary to request a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of $200. With the loan proceeds, she will be able to grow her business and her level of sales, at the same time improving her family's standard of living. Dela is a woman devoted to her family and esteemed by his neighbors and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep for breeding business expansion and for sale.

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Go Try” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Abu Bakar K. who is pictured in the left. Abu Bakar is age forty; he was born in Magburaka town where he is currently residing together with his wife and five children. His wife is a businesswoman. Three of his children are attending primary school and two are in secondary school. For fifteen years now, Abu has been a motor vehicle driver. He is requesting this loan to enable him to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Anarkan's Group

texts.en:
Some women have proved to be successful as providers of families and owners of business. Anarkan D., leader of the group, is one those women. She is 53 and divorced. She raised 4 children alone with the help of her business. Now her elder son is 25 and he works as foreman in the company named “Alyukobond”, her second son works in Russia, her daughter is seamstress and the youngest son is a student. 

But 22 years ago she had to start her business alone in order to provide her children only with a calf that was given by her relatives as a present for the birth of her second child in compliance with Kyrgyz national traditions.  Using the calf meat and initial investments of 3,000 soms, she started doing and then selling meat dumplings. Now she has hired two assistants who make 20 kilograms of meat dumplings a day. Her business brings her 1,000 soms monthly. 

In order to increase her profits she is planning to buy small cattle, fatten it for slaughter and use this meat in making meat dumplings. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have sufficient funds, therefore she is applying for a loan. This loan will help Anarkan reduce the costs on the purchase of meat and as a result increase her profits. 

Group members:
Nargiza D. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 32 and married. She has a son of 14 years.  Her husband is working as a driver on the fish-factory. She works as a seamstress. Still, their wages are not enough to cover their living expenses. Thus, they started seven years ago their own family business. Mainly, this business is on Nargiza because her husband is working in the capital of Kyrgyzstan – Bishkek. When their son became 5, their relatives gave them as a present a calf. With this calf she started her business. She fattened it and then sold it. So this is how she started her business of buying, fattening and selling a calf with the purpose of making profit. Monthly she gets 1,200 soms. For now, due to the successful functioning of her business, she can make capital repairs to her house. She is applying for loan in order to continue her business. But now she wants not just to sell a calf but also she is considering an opportunity of exchanging it for a milk cow and then selling milk in the mornings. 

Ibarat K. is 53 and widow. She has 3 children. Her first son is 23, her second son is 21 and both of them work as builders. Her daughter is 16 and she is student. During her summer break, she works as washerwoman at car wash. Since the situation in the country changed a lot, she lost a job and it forced her to consider options of starting her own business. She decided to breed cattle. She is almost three years in cattle breeding business. She started it with initial investments of 2,000 soms and it brings her monthly 1,700 soms. On the money received as profits from her business, she is able to pay tuition fee for her daughter at her institution of higher education and she could buy household appliances for her house. Now, she needs funds to buy another calf, fatten it and sell it. Therefore, she is applying for a loan which will help her to develop her business. 

Nazarbek K. is 42 and married. He is a builder in the capital of Kyrgyzstan – Bishkek. He has 3 children. The elder son is 15, his second son is 13, his little daughter is 7 and all of them go to school. His wife is working at the grill factory. Still, in order to have enough money to provide his family, he started breeding cattle. Here, his elder son and his wife assist him while he is at work. They started breed cattle upon the advice of his wife’s parents to buy a calf, fatten and sell it. He is 10 years in the cattle-breeding business with an initial investment of 4,000 soms. This business brings 1,300 soms monthly. On the profits from his business, he could provide his family, pay for their education and make partial capital repairs of his house. Now, he applying for a loan to buy a calf, fatten and sell it. After selling it, he is planning to add money and to buy a milk cow and then sell milk. This will help him to increase his profits from business and make him closer to his dream to build a big and beautiful house.   

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Patricia M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called In God We Trust.  She is 30 years old, married, and has two children between the ages of three and 12 years old. She is a sophomore college student.

For eight years, she has been selling used clothes in the Waterside Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. 

She describes herself as a very quiet woman whose dreams are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey J., 52, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. J. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $1 each per day. Two of her children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of about $3 each per day. Every month the family has to spend $41 on food, $3 on their children's education and $20 on other expenses.  

J. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing the new clothing in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Karla Griselda

texts.es: Karla Griselda M. C. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Santa Ana, en donde vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado en una empresa privada, y junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad. Karla es una mujer muy emprendedora, quien cuenta con tres negocio, todo con el deseo de poder aportar lo más posible a su hogar. Ella posee una pupusería en la cual cada noche se encarga de elaborar y vender pupusas, así mismo comercializa perfumes para hombres y mujeres y así también vende ropa para ambos sexos. Karla es una madre de familia muy responsable quien lucha por una vida mejor para sus hijos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas como: queso, maíz, frijoles y otros más; así mismo desea invertir en la compra de perfumes y ropa de manera que sus ganancias se incrementen.
texts.en:
Karla Griselda M. C. is 34 years old and lives in the Department of Santa Ana with her husband who is an employee in a private company and her two children who are 13 and 8 years old.

Karla is a very enterprising woman who owns three businesses because she wishes to be able to contribute as much as possible to her household. She has a stall from which she sells “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, pork, chicken, etc.) and works there every evening making and selling pupusas.  She also sells men's and women's perfume and clothing for both men and women.

Karla is a very responsible mother who is fighting to provide a better life for her children. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy all the raw materials she needs for making pupusas such as: cheese, corn, beans and other ingredients. She also hopes to invest in the purchase of perfume and clothes to increase her profits.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make pupusas

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: La señorita Sara  María T. T. inicio con su negocio hace 10 años necesita un refinanciamiento  para poder trabajar en la venta de comida típica  para la celebración del día de los santos que es celebrado el primero de noviembre  de cada año es soltera vive con sus papas y el mayor deseo que tiene ahora es poder tener otra venta de comida para generar más ingresos y poder surtir mas sus diferentes ventas ya que le han hecho pedidos de comida  y necesita tener más capital  para su negocio la señora solicita el credito para comprar insumos para la elavoracion de comida
texts.en: Sara Maria T. T. started her business 10 years ago and she needs financing to be able to sell traditional foods for All Saints Day, celebrated on November 1 every year. She is single and she lives with her parents. Her greatest wish is to sell another batch of food to generate more income. With these earnings she will be able to add variety to her products and she will be able to fill the orders that have been placed. She needs more working capital for her business.  She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare more foods.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Aparicia

texts.es:
La Sra  Aparicia   es casada tiene   2  hijos,  todos   en edad escolar.
Ella    se dedica a la venta de artículos   electrónicos,  en su domicilio que está ubicado por la Súper Carretera, cuya venta le genera  un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposo  y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
La venta de electrónica es muy común en Ciudad del Este y muchas familias se mantienen con este negocio.
Afortunadamente  a la familia de la señora Aparicia le va muy bien con las ventas, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de celulares, radios, mp3 y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Aparicia is married and has two school age children. She sells electronic devices from her home located along the superhighway. Through her sales she is able to generate a good income. With the help of her husband and the rest of her family, Aparicia is able to move forward with great sacrifice and dedication. Selling electronics is a very common business among many families in Ciudad del Este as a way of supporting themselves.

Fortunately for her family, Sra. Aparacia has done very well with her sales. She is requesting a loan to buy mobile phones, radios, mp3 players, and other devices.

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones, radios, mp3 players, and other devices

loans.name: Zenobio

texts.es: Zenobio, de 69 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive junto a su hermana Carmen, una devota de la iglesia cristiana. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palca. La siembra de arveja, papa, verduras y hortalizas; son los principales sembríos de Zenobio, ya tienen 7 años dedicándose a este noble trabajo de la agricultura. La dedicación y buen trato a la tierra, le proporciona buenas cosechas, por ello los comerciantes mayoristas del mercado central de Tarma, le suministran buenas ganancias. Según menciona los días, miércoles, viernes, y domingos, son los días que más demanda tiene su producción. Por ello más adelante desea abrir un comercio de comestibles, al por mayor donde venda arroz, azúcar, aceite y demás cosas por sacos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante con el apoyo de su banco comunal; que son personas honestas, responsables y sobre todo cumplidas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 4 bolsas de semilla de alverjas, que sembrará en sus más de 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Zenobio is 69 years old.  He is a single and hard-working man who lives with his sister Carmen who is a devout christian.  They live together in their own home which is in the town of Palca.  Zenobio is a farmer and his main crops are peas, potatoes, greens and vegetables.  He has been in the noble work of farming for 7 years.  His commitment and the good care he takes of his land have provided him with good harvests which means that the wholesale merchants in the central market in Tarma provide him with good profits.

Zenobio says that Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays are his busiest days.  For this reason, in future he would like to open a food store where he can sell rice, sugar, oil and sacks of other foodstuffs wholesale.

This is Zenobio's first loan from MFP and he hopes to get ahead with the support of his community bank.  The other members of his bank are honest, responsible and, above all, punctual.  He will use his loan to buy 4 bags of pea seeds which he will sow on his land which extends to more than 4 hectares.

loans.use: To buy 4 bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Nancy Esperanza

texts.es: Nancy de estado civil casada y con 4 hijos de 13 a 26 años de edad,  es una mujer con mucha creatividad que vive en la ciudad de Bogotá y se dedica al diseño y confección de ropa de dotación  y  deportiva principalmente. Nancy estudió en el SENA, entidad del estado, y cuando terminó estuvo trabajando cuatro años en una sastrería  y luego tomó la decisión de confeccionar por su propia cuenta e inició con colegios muy conocidos y misceláneas y posteriormente fue ampliando su mercado hacia otras instituciones y personas. Ella provee a varios puntos de venta,   pero su sueño es tener un almacén propio y especializado en uniformes de dotación y línea infantil. Con el fin de mejorar la calidad, los tiempos productivos y aumentar su número de clientes. Ahora se ha propuesto perfeccionar su infraestructura, por eso con su credikiva que es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará una maquina fileteadora.  La microempresa de Nancy tiene un margen de utilidad bruta del 46% y su infraestructura fisca actual está compuesta por 2 máquinas planas industriales, una fileteadora, una maquina collarín, dos maquinas de aguja, una maquina fuccionadora, una maquina brochadora y una cortadora. Así como una mesa de corte  y 40 herramientas más. Su máximo desafío es tener su propia marca  y todos los días no deja de pensar en ello.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and has four children ranging in age from 13 to 26 years old.  She is a very creative woman who lives in the city of Bogotá.  She designs and makes uniforms and sportswear primarily.  Nancy studied at the SENA (National Employment Service), a state entity.  When she finished, she worked in a tailor shop for four years.  Then she made the decision to make clothes on her own.  She started with well-known schools and various others.  She later expanded her market towards other institutions and people.

She does business at various sales locations.  Her dream is to have her own store specializing in uniforms and a children’s line.  Her goal is to improve the quality, to improve her productive time, and to increase her number of customers.  Now she has proposed perfecting her facilities.  

She needs a Kiva loan to do so.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy an overlock machine.  Nancy, a small businesswoman, has a gross profit margin of 46%.  Her current facility is comprised of two industrial lockstitch machines, one overlock machine, a serge machine, a single needle lockstitch sewing machine, a fabric fusion machine, a heavy duty machine, and a cutter.

She needs a cutting table and 40 more tools.  Her biggest challenge is to have her own brand.  She never stops thinking about it.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine

loans.name: Rosa Emerita

texts.es: Rosa Emerita M. G. de 38 años de edad, reside en la cabecera departamental de Santa Ana, donde vive junto a su esposo. La señora Rosa posee una panadería, en la cual se dedica a trabajar desde hace 16 años atrás, es por esta razón que ella es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora la cual entrega todos los pedidos a tiempo y que cuenta con muy buenos estándares de calidad. En muchas ocasiones su esposo le ayuda a repartir el pan por los diferentes lugares en donde posee clientes fijos. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, miel, azúcar y otros ingredientes más, los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan. Rosa trabaja arduamente día con día para poder mejorar el negocio, el cual ha sido muy rentable para ella, y el cual le permite en gran manera contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rosa Emerita M. G. is 38 years old and lives in the departmental capital of Santa Ana, together with her husband.

Rosa owns a bakery where she has worked for 16 years.  For this reason, she is very well known in her area since she has always been a very hard-working woman who delivers all her orders on time and who observes very good standards of quality.  On many occasions, her husband helps her to deliver the bread to the different places where she has regular customers.

Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can buy flour, butter, honey, sugar and other ingredients which she needs to make her bread.  Rosa works hard every day to improve her business.  Her business has been very profitable for her and allows her generally to have everything she needs.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and yeast for making bread

loans.name: Att's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Krang Pou village in Takeo province. Mr. Att S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 
Mr. Att S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice to sell to support his family.  His wife, Mrs. Channa Toeur, is a vegetable seller at the local market where she can earn some money to support the family.  They need a new motorbike, but the money Att S. has saved is not enough  to buy one.  He is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike. He is a father of three children, two of whom are attending the local public school.  The youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Cliber

texts.es: Cliber, de 38 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador que vive en compañía de su mamá Clara y su padre Magno; a quien protege y cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como técnico Agropecuario, él tiene muchos proyectos, su mayor desea es mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, con miras a la exportación, pues su especialidad son proyectos productivos. Eso lo demuestra en sus cultivos de café, donde aplica todos sus conocimientos, por ello en cada cosecha vende su grano a la cooperativa de Alto Palomar, asimismo siembra plátanos como un producto alternativo, asegurando así su economía. Cada 15 días recoge los frutos maduros para comercializarlos. Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a esto, pero según menciona antes no tenia el conocimiento que ahora posee, por ello está seguro que logrará su objetivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que  tiene con MFP, donde se compromete a ser puntual en las actividades que realizarán en su asociación. Cliber menciona que en estos meses las lluvias son cada vez más intensas, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, como también dedicarse al cuidado de sus cultivos por las intensas plagas que azotan en estos tiempos.
texts.en:
Cliber, age 38, is a single hardworking man who lives with his mother Clara and father Magno who he protects and cares for in his own home in the community of Unión Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle. Working as a technical farmer, Cliber has many projects. His greatest wish is to improve the quality of his crops that are designated for export. He specializes in productive projects, such as his coffee crop in which he applies all of his knowledge. With each harvest, Cliber sells his grain to the Alto Palomar cooperative where he also sells bananas as an alternative product that helps secure his income. Every fifteen days he gathers the ripened fruit to sell. Cliber has been in this business for twenty years and says that he did not have the knowledge that he now possesses to help him achieve his goal.

Cliber belongs to the Communal Bank “Prestatrios de la Unión” (Borrowers of the Union) and this is his first loan with MFP. He promises to be punctual in his group activities. Cliber says that the rain has been intense in recent months. For this reason, the loan he requested will be used to buy several sacks of organic compost. In addition, part of the loan will used to protect his crops from the intense infestation of pests that can occur during times like these.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost & supplies to protect against pests

loans.name: Giringuvu Group

texts.fr:
Marceline N. est une commerçante âgée de 40 ans qui habite  la localité de Mvugo en   commune Nyanza –Lac  de la Province de Makamba  au Sud du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme le poisson et autres denrées alimentaires au  centre de Mvugo depuis 4ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer ce métier. Elle n’a  pas fréquente l’école. Elle  est mariée  et  mère de 6 enfants dont deux sont a l’école. Elle  arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant beaucoup de produits alimentaires  a revendre a ses clients dans l’espoir de réaliser de grandes épargnes et ainsi accroitre son business. Elle espère qu’elle pourra diversifier ses articles à commercialiser dans l’avenir.

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Giringuvu»
texts.en:
Marceline N. is a merchant, age 40, who lives in Mvugo in the Nyanza-Lac commune (township) in the Makamba province in the south of Burundi. She has been selling food products such as fish in Mvugo for four years. Before beginning this career, she was a farmer. She did not go to school. She is married and the mother of six children, two of whom are in school. She is on her fourth loan cycle with Turame Community Finance.

She is seeking a Kiva loan to increase her working capital to buy many food products to sell to her customers in the hope of achieving big savings and thus growing her business. She hopes to be able to diversify her offerings in the future.

She is a member of the Giringuvu Community group.

loans.use: Increase capital by buying many food products to sell to customers

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.en:
Doña Juana is 28 years old and married. She has one child who is currently studying in school. Juana owns a general goods store and is also a skilled seamstress. Her husband helps support the family as a metalworker. 

Juana is requesting a loan to help purchase more goods for her general store.  She started her store with a small amount of personal savings and now has six years experience running the business. She hopes to grow her store and increase sales with the help of this loan. She would also like to increase the variety of products she offers her customers. This is Juana´s 2nd loan with ASDIR; the first loan was repaid on time with no problems.

loans.use: purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Nora Valia

texts.es:
Nora es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector Urrunaga del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado así porque algunas de las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio desde hace 8 meses. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad, carnes, verduras, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y cerveza. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, gracias a la buena atención que brinda y a la variedad de sus productos. Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Nora ha pensado en ampliar su bodega y para lograrlo desea adquirir  más productos sobretodo comprar útiles escolares porque la demanda aumenta por la campaña escolar.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Nora is 22 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Urrunaga area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district, one of the most populous districts in the Lambayeque region, characterized that way because some of the people who live in marginal urban zones lack basic services.  

She has had a small store located in her home for eight months.  She offers a variety of everyday consumer products for sale to her neighbors and customers from other areas, including staples, meat, vegetables, groceries, sweets, drinks, and beer.  The business has had a good reception, thanks to the attention she gives it and the variety of products that are offered.  Nora helps her husband support their family financially with her business.

Nora has thought about expanding her store and in order to do this, she wants to offer more products, including school supplies, because the demand has increased during the school year.  To accomplish this, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and other products for her store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets.

Lorna has been in this business for seven years. Lorna also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to send her children to school and do house repairs.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and piglets

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman lives in the village of Kokotauri, Keda district. He is married and has two children – a 15-year-old son and an 11-years-old daughter; both of them go to school. Murman’s family consists of six persons – Murman, his wife Natela, their two children, Murman’s sister and his father, who is retired. 

The total income of the family is 1000 Laris per month. A small part of this amount is the social assistance given to the Z. family by the Georgian government, as a family living below the poverty line. The biggest part of their total income comes from agricultural activities. In particular: three milk cows, the dairy products of which are sold locally. Besides, they have a plot of land with an area of 1 ha, where vegetables are grown. Also the family grows different types of fruit, which is sold locally. 

With the requested amount Murman plans to build a small greenhouse, where vegetables will be grown. This will allow Murman to grow more and better quality vegetables and sell them, which will be positively reflected in the family income and family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Margaritas De Tlatelulco Group
