texts.es: Este grupo se llama “Margaritas de Tlatelulco” este grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes, esta ubicado en Toluca Estado de México. Una de sus integrantes del grupo es   la señora Mónica A. Ríos  de 41 años de edad, ella estudio  la primaria, es comerciante y tiene 7 hijos ella vende desde hace 16 años pan y vaR. productos de temporada. Comenta que debido a que tuvo vaR. hijos se vio en la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo quien también es comerciante y vende tabique. La señora Mónica se dedica principalmente a la venta de pan ya que de ahí obtiene más ganancias, ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en pan que tiene mucha demanda, sus clientes comentan que su pan es muy rico y siempre tiene variedad. Ella quiere incrementar sus ganancias para salir adelante y poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que aun dependen de ella. Observaciones las señoras que no se ven bien se llaman Lilian R. y Yeni C.
texts.en:
This group is called “Margaritas de Tlatelulco” (Tlatelulco Daisies).  It has 11 members and is located in Toluca, state of México. 

One of the group members is Mrs. Mónica A. Ríos, 41.  She finished elementary school, is a merchant and has 7 children.  For the last 16 years she’s sold bread and seasonal products.  She comments that because she had several children she had to help her husband, who is also a merchant selling bricks.

Mónica primarily sells bread because that’s where her profits are best.  She is asking for a loan to buy bread because demand is high; her customers comment that her bread is very delicious and she always has good variety.  She wants to increase her profits to get ahead and provide a better quality of life for her children that still depend on her.

Observations: the women who aren’t clearly visible are Lilian R. and Yeni C..

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos que son independientes. Su casa está ubicada en una  localidad  grande y bonita, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito  de Chepén del departamento de La Libertad.

José se dedica a la venta de refrescos en un pequeño puesto ambulante ubicado en la ciudad de Chepén. Desde hace varios años José desde muy temprano se dedica a ofrecer refresco de cebada, soya, entre otros  sabores a todos los transeúntes de una de las principales calles de la ciudad, para este negocio José cuenta con una amplia experiencia y con clientela fidelizada a su  negocio.

José está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que él pueda comprar una refrigeradora la cual utilizará en su negocio ya que le servirá para almacenar hielo, uno de los insumos que el utiliza para su negocio, así como también para la conservación de sus bebidas , así estas  no se malograrán en épocas de verano.

José es una persona responsable, tranquila, y las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona trabajadora y honesta.
texts.en:
Jose is 56 years old and he has 3 children, all of whom are independent. His house is located in a large and beautiful community located in the district of Chepen in the department of La Libertad.

Jose sells fresh drinks from a cart in the city of Chepen. For many years and from the very early mornings he has been selling barley, soy, and other flavored drinks to the passers-by of a main street in the city. Jose has ample experience in the business and he has a loyal client base.

Jose requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase a freezer for his business. This will help him store ice, one of the products that he uses for his business. He will also be able to conserve his drinks, especially during the summer months.

Jose is a responsible and calm person. Those who know him consider him to be a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to use for his business

loans.name: Salima's Group

texts.en:
Salima is 49 years old and has given birth to six children. Two of the children work and the others are studying by attending a local school. Salima is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very well. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He put his fruits on a cart every day and visits different streets of the city to sell. He works very hard to bear the financial expenses of the family. 
 
Salima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity, which will help him sell more to his customers and earn a better income. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Salima is confident that her husband’s business will improve after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia comes from village Kakabeti, Kakheti Region. She is 45 years old and lives with husband David, their 19-year-old daughter (a student) and her parents-in-law. Lia works in a local school as a deputy director. Besides her regular job, she takes part in the family agricultural business, which is the main source of income for the family. 

Lia’s family owns agricultural land, where melons (1 hectare), grapes (1.5 hectares)  and Lucerne (alfalfa, 5 hectares) are grown. Melons and grapes are sold to fruit wholesalers and Lucerne is sold to the neighbor farmers, who use it for feeding their livestock. Along with the above-mentioned, Lia and David run a sheep-breeding farm, which consists of 40 sheep and lambs. They sell lambs in the spring season. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris, including the pension of Lia’s parents-in-law. 

Though the family has quite a strong farm, they still are faced by lack of cash for financing seasonal costs. Because of this, Lia requested a loan for mowing Lucerne (to hire special mowing machinery) and purchasing fertilizers for their melon garden. Mowed Lucerne will be stored and sold. After fertilizing the land, the family will get more harvest and thus more income from sales. 

The increase in income will be used for financing Lia’s daughter’s education in high school.

loans.use: to hire a mowing machine and purchase fertilizers for melon garden.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is a 37-year-old business lady who has been selling shoes for seven years. She is a single mother of one child who is 15 years old. 

She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one in five years. Her dream is to own a piece of land, construct her own house and buy her own vehicle. She has requested 30,000 KES to buy more shoes.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Benicia

texts.en: Benicia is 66 years old and is married with five children. Her children are 26, 29, 32, 34, and 37 years old and have moved out of the house. Benicia has a business selling crafts that are typical of Peru. She is asking for a $300 loan to buy a wider range of crafts to sell such as blankets, pottery, knitted hats, and satchels. She desires the loan in order to expand her business and is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy crafts to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old and lives on the outskirts of the city of Ibarra in northern Ecuador. He is married and lives with his wife and his children. Luis is a father of four children aged 16, 15, 10, and 8 years old, respectively. Luis is a hardworking man who takes responsibility for his family. He is a man of good character. Luis' business is selling animals, especially pigs, guinea pigs, and cattle at the market. He began this business when he married over 20 years ago. Luis began by selling animals to his neighbors. Now, 20 years later, he uses micro loans to more easily obtain the capital necessary to purchase animals to sell at a profit. Earlier in the history of his business, he used to obtain his capital from loan sharks who charged him daily for their money-lending services. Luis works with his wife, who is pictured beside him in the photo. Luis reports that his business is going well and with the earnings he sees, he invests in the education of his children. His loan will be used to purchase more pigs. His past loans have given him the opportunity to buy his animals, pay a low interest rate, and get his loan quickly so he could get to work. Luis’ dream is to build a new house on new land in the next year. He wants to continue his work with his business and support his family.

In the photo, Luis and his wife are pictured with their guinea pigs, as Luis had not yet had the opportunity to purchase the pigs that this loan will finance.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de crianza de cuyes, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los cuyes y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la ciudad de Cusco y lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio de crianza de cuyes la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y también para comprar alimento para los cuyes.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de pollos, negocio de transporte, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de maquinaria, negocio de tienda de abarrotes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Kusikoyllor Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Valentina is a member.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  She works in her business of raising guinea pigs.  She fattens them, and the guinea pigs grow.  She then sells them at different fairs in the city of Cusco.  She sells in an itinerant manner at the market.  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  It is through this business of raising guinea pigs that Valentina gets her children ahead.

She would like to expand her business of raising guinea pigs.  She is requesting the loan in order to buy guinea pigs and feed for the guinea pigs.

The businesses of the other members are selling chicken, transportation, selling handicrafts, selling machinery, and a grocery store.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for the guinea pigs.

loans.name: Abendowooza Women's Group

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and has a six-year track record of hard work at her clothing outlet in Kampala. She started her business after she was prevailed upon by close friends and family and after a pep talk. Although she was naïve in the beginning and had some reservations, she has done well and not given in to pessimism. Gradually, her confidence grew and she began to increase the number of customers, endearing them with the good quality of her products. Irene envisions a bright future for her business and word-of-mouth is spreading making her upbeat. She makes a weekly gross sales income of up to 100,000 UGX. Irene also earns additional income from trading in chicks.

Irene is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more clothing and young chicks to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and young chicks to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Don Felipe, es casado y vive en un barrio en donde el barrio tiene una capilla especialmente del santo San Sebastian, el es casado con la señora Felipa y a su responsabilidad  tiene a un hijo.

   El  trabaja en campo y solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropas para después venderlo en  las comunidades cercanas de su localidad, en esta actividad lleva  cinco años y nueve meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello tuvo un buen ingresos para sostener a su familia.

  Para dedicarse a este negocio se inspiro por si solo así tener un  mejor ingreso y tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia que es lo más importante para él.

   Lo que  desea es que  con el préstamo y su actividad mejore sus ingresos  y pueda tener sus propios a horros.
texts.en: Don Felipe is married and lives a neighbourhood which has a special chapel dedicated to Saint San Sebastian. He is married to Señora Felipa and has child under his care. He works in the fields and is asking for the loan in order to buy clothes. He plans to sell them later in the communities near his neighbourhood. He has been doing this for the last 5 years and 9 months and says that it is going well as it gave him a good income  with which to support his family. He decided to start up the business on his own in order to have a better income and give his family a better quality of life which is most important for him. He hopes that with the loan and his work he can improve his income and have his own savings.

loans.use: to buy clothes for later sale in the neighbourhood and other neighbourhoods nearby.

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en: Tsogzolmaa is 45 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Dundgovi province of Mongolia. Her daughter is a high school student. Tsogzolmaa is a single mother. She started her business in 2004 by selling meat. Since then she also began to sell packed coals and second-hand clothes from her house. Also she makes and sells clothes from her house. With her business profits, Tsogzolmaa has purchased furniture and a personal computer. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a open-minded woman who says " Next year, my daughter will study in the university. I want to provide the best possible education and opportunity for my daughter." Tsozolmaa is requesting a 850,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos alguns maiores de idade e outros ainda frequentam a escola. Fez 5ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua sobrinha que vive com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, trabalha como encarregado geral de uma bananalândia ha mais   de 10 anos e tem um salario de 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construcao de uma casa (cimento, barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros.) para a sua obra. Os primeiro emprestimo foi de 15.000.00mt para a compra de bens de consumo.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa, mobiliar para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ernesto was born in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of six children, some of whom are adults while the others attend school. He went to school through the fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports his nephew, who lives with him.
He's never left Inhambane. He's worked as the general manager of a banana plantation for more than 10 years and earns about 6,500 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loan was in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he used to purchase consumer goods. He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house so he can provide his family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 43 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 
Esmeralda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Esmeralda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, 40  years old, is a garment factory worker earning $2 per day. Her husband provides motor taxi service earning $3 per day. They have one child and she is working in the factory earning $2 per day.  Every month, Srey has to spend $80 on food, $14 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to complete the money she has to buy a van for her husband to use to transport garment factory workers to work so that he can make other income.

loans.use: To buy a van for her husband to use to transport garment factory workers to work.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del centro poblado D. Caspa, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento D. Puno, tiene 49 años D. edad, está casada y tiene siete  hijos.  Cuenta con estudios D. educación primaria (incompleto).
	
La señora Teodora trabaja desD. hace dos ciclos con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra D. dos chanchos.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, con la que comprará chanchos y ovejas.  En el negocio  le ayudan sus hijos, su esposo trabaja como albañil.

La señora desea tener ganados mejorados y así tener mayores ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the “Aymaras Juli II” communal bank from the town of Caspa, in Juli district, in Chucuito province and Puno department. She is 49, married, and has seven children. She did not finish primary school. 

Sra. Teodora has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles. Her previous loan was for the sum of 500 nuevo soles, which she invested in the purchase of two pigs. 

She will request a new loan in the amount of 500 nuevo soles, which she will use to buy pigs and sheep. Her children assist her in the business, while her husband works as a bricklayer.

Teodora wants to have improved livestock and thus earn better profits.

What she most likes about her communal bank is the ease of obtaining a loan and its timeliness.

loans.use: to buy pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Mounira

texts.en:
Mounira is a 29-year-old single woman who is working hard to prove herself to her friends and relatives. She is an industrious woman who improves her business as much as she can by adding new products attractive to new customers. 

Her nine years of experience in the field of mixing and creating special perfume blends has earned her the trust of her customers and given her encouragement to continue mixing new scents in the future.  In response to her customers' needs and requests, Mounira will put a great deal of effort into improving and expanding her perfume-making sector.

Mounira has also started selling hookah, which is a highly requested item these days and brings a good income.

This is Mounira's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan helped a great deal to improve her hookah business; at this time, she is requesting a loan from this Kiva partner in order to buy new perfume collections, in addition to special bottles. She also hopes to open a private perfume atelier, where she can make her special blends and expand her market.

loans.use: To increase her selection of perfumes with new collections and bottles

loans.name: Progressive C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Progressive C Group in Western Kenya! Truphosa is the facilitator of the Progressive C group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Truphosa takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Truphosa had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Truphosa was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Truphosa and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Truphosa will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Progressive C group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Truphosa with her group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maudi

texts.es: Maudi, de 14 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, así como amable y alegre, es conviviente con Marco quien es empleado. Vive en compañía de madre, hermana, su pareja y su hijo de 5 meses de edad, instalados cómodamente en la casa de su madre. El negocio que tiene Maudi es la venta de bebidas gaseosa, contando con una congeladora que compró con el apoyo de su pareja, e iniciándose con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros comprando una caja de bebida gaseosa para empezar. Su ventas lo realiza todo el día desde y por las noches vende comida rápida como pollos broaster y salchicha con pollo frito, para eso cuenta con un carrito sanguchero. Ella realiza ambas actividades desde hace 2 años, contando con el apoyo de su madre en la atención hacia los clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar de su hijo, así como los ingresos le sirven para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar. Gracias  a las buenas ganancias que ha tenido por la  regular clientela que maneja, desea continuar con su negocio y ampliarlo y en un futuro tener un distribuidora de bebidas gaseosas. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP,  está agradecida con el apoyo financiero ya que gracias a ello avanzará con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de bebidas como aseosas a precio por mayor para de esa manera tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Maudi, a 14-year-old, is a dynamic and enterprising woman. She is also happy and kind, and she lives with Marco, who is employed. She lives in the company of her mother, her sister, her boyfriend, and their five-month-old son, all in her mother's house.

Maudi's business is selling soft drinks. She depends on a freezer that she bought with the support of her boyfriend. She got her start with capital which came from her own savings and was used to purchase a case of soft drinks to begin with.

She sells all day long, and at night she sells fast food such as roasted chicken and sausage with fried chicken. For that work she counts on her food cart. She has been doing both of these activities for two years, relying on help from her mother for customer service. She likes her business because it allows her to stay home and take care of her son, and the income helps her pay for household expenses.

Thanks to good earnings from regular customers she handles, she wants to continue with the business and expand into soft drink distribution in the future. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the financial support. Thanks to this she will be able to move forward with her business. With the amount she requested, 800 nuevos soles, she will invest it entirely in buying drinks such as sodas at wholesale prices in order to have a bigger profit margin.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is a 23-year-old married woman with two children; one in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for the past two years. Roda is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda is a poultry farmer who lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is married and has been involved in this business for two years.

Ndinda was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more broilers.

Ndinda would like to venture into hen layers farming. The challenges she faces are seasonal weather and the high cost of transport and feeds. She will use the extra income from the loan to purchase more chicken feed.

loans.use: to purchase more broilers.

loans.name: Kitheka

texts.en:
Kitheka is 51 years old and married to Joyce, who works to provide additional income for the family. They have three children, ages 25, 21, and 16. 

He sell tires, a business which has been involved in for two years. His monthly income is 20,000 KES. He is borrowing his first loan of 50,000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase more tires for resale.

His hopes and dreams are to become a wholesaler and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more tires.

loans.name: Diego Alberto

texts.es:
Diego es un joven emprendedor de 20 años que hace aproximadamente 2 años y medio viene desempeñándose en la actividad de la barbería. Gracias a sus buenos trabajos, ha logrado conseguir muchos clientes, por esto ha pensado en independizarse y no seguir trabajando como empleado recibiendo un bajo sueldo. Sin embargo, la mayor dificultad con la que se ha presentado es la falta de capital para poder montar su propio negocio, es por esto que con ahorros y mucho esfuerzo ha logrado ir comprando poco a poco las herramientas necesarias para montar su propia barbería. Para terminar de montar su negocio, Diego busca que un préstamo le permita comprar equipos de barbería, un televisor y decoración para terminar de montar su propio negocio y así progresar financieramente.

De esta manera podrá cumplir su sueño de tener su propio negocio y atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera, al mismo tiempo que podrá recibir mejores ingresos y así poder contribuir económicamente en su hogar para tener una mejor calidad de vida en su familia.

loans.use: Comprar equipos de barbería, un televisor y decoración para terminar de montar su propio negocio y así progresar financieramente.

loans.name: Nhóm 05_Chợ Rừng Thông_Đông Sơn. Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has had a retail business selling cake, sweet, suger, milk,...  for 8 years.
Lan lives in Dong Son district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. .
In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Lan is a reputable person in the community, she is the leader of her solidarity group. 
The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, suger, milk,... to resell.
With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, suger, milk,... to resell.

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en:
You can see a young man, who is enjoying with his business. He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. 
This 39-year old man is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Fizuli region. He is married, has 2 children, settled in a dormitory of Yasamal region, which is located in Baku city.
He has run this business for 10 years.
Komak Credit Union help to him to begin his business.
Having borrowed a loan amount of $800, he bought tea-house equipments: tables, tea-pots, cups.
He has a lot of plans.
Farhad works very hard to bring about his plans.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 conditioners, 2 billiard-tables.
He desires to have the tea-house with all conveniences.
Farhad tries to create the good conditions for his clients in his tea-house.

loans.use: To buy 2 conditioners, 2 billiard-tables, to do capital repairs of his own tea-house

loans.name: Ngorn

texts.en: Ngorn P. is 47 years old and the mother of four children.  She plants crops for her family and also for others.  This business activity generates about $2.50 per day.  P.'s husband is a construction worker and typically makes between $4.00 and $6.00 per day.  One of her sons helps her grow the crops and two of them work construction with their father.  P.'s daughter works at a garment factory and can make up to $100 a month.  The family plans to use this loan to buy more corn seeds and also to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant corn and to buy a cow

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna operates a flourishing business at a small marketplace in Zaporoshye selling dishes. She sells cups, glasses, dinner dishes, pots, pans, thermoses and many other useful kitchen items. She is the only one who sells dishes in her area of the bustling market. Anna is very particular in the quality of her merchandise. She often travels to a larger city, Dnepropetrovsk, to personally pick out and purchase good, durable dishware in bulk quantities. She also orders dishware from Odessa and has it shipped to her busy little store.

Anna is a very open, fun, likable and lively lady. She is not married but helps support her aging parents financially. Those who work with and around Anna describe her as an honest, hard-working, and trustworthy friend. She has a wonderful reputation at the marketplace.

Anna has run her business for 3 years. She has requested a $500 loan to expand the variety of her products. She was very successful in selling her dishware during the winter months. Now she needs to replace the merchandise she has sold and add a new assortment to her stock. She makes between $200 and $300 a month and has around $600 to $800 invested in inventory. She gives credit for her success to her partnership with Nadezhda Ukraine which allows her to purchase additional assortments of dishware in sufficient quantities and at the right timing.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio runs a small bakery where she makes all kinds of baked goods (cakes, cookies, pastries, bread, and so on). Her home and bakery are in the La Merced neighborhood of La Paz. She is single and has more than twelve years of experience in this line of work.

This is her first loan request. She would use the loan as investment capital (to buy an oven, flour, sugar, and so on). Her work history qualifies her for this loan. She has experience in pastrymaking and brings in enough money to cover the loan as well as her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Rocio tiene un horno donde elabora todo trabajo referente a repostería (tortas, galletas, masitas, pan, etc.) Su domicilio y su horno se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Villa La Merced de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene experiencia de trabajo más de 12 años.. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para capital de inversión (compra de horno, y harina, azúcar, y otros) Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en la repostería, actividad que le da ingresos para cubrir tanto el préstamo como sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: To buy an oven, flour, sugar, and so on
